review_body: Group of 4 of us stayed 2 nights at this hotel. We were due to stay 5 but unfortunately coronavirus ban hit and had to go home early! Hotel was perfect! We each booked a double room which meant we had plenty of room! Rooms were spotless and cleaned daily! Beds were so comfy!! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful! Always had a smile for us!!! Location is ideal, just around the corner from the flatiron building! Great bars nearby including the 40/40 club which Beyonce owns! Class spot. Another nice spot is the rooftop bar around the corner from hotel!!! Will definitely stay again!!!!

I have just returned from my trip to New York. Again, I stayed at the Heritage Hotel. I have been in the Hotel/Casino business here in Las Vegas for a very, very long time. I like the Heritage for two reasons.1 – The location is so good. If you go out the front door and to the right and at the end of the street you are at the famous Flatiron building area. A very interesting building and there is a park and restaurants and stores all around. And tables and chairs to sit and enjoy the view. BTW turn around and look above the buildings and you will see the iconic Empire State building reaching out to the heavens. You can walk east over to Park Ave and get the subway and go downtown to Battery Park and the Statue of Liberty or go uptown to Grand Central. Both amazing places to visit.Go out the door to the left and down to 6th Ave and the great shopping stores. Or walk over to 7th Ave and visit Chelsea, an ever changing area. You can take the subway at 7th and go downtown to Greenwich Village. Or go uptown to Central Park, right in the center of the city.2 – The Hotel and it’s staff. Manager, Zahid Rehman, is always around and his staff all do their job well. Front Desk people are polite and helpful. I see them every day helping people, from all over the world, find what they’re looking for in this great city. The maids were good. Took good care of my room every day. Maintenance guys were great. I started each day by going down to the breakfast area. So nicely done and had everything I wanted. I would start off with a cup of very good coffee and use the Wi-Fi to check the weather for the day.I am 82 years of age now and if I visit New York again, this is where I will stay.

We had a wonderful time again :) we come to NYC every year around the same time and we always choose to stay at this hotel. They recently renovated so it's even better. My daughter always looks forward to our stay.

nice place, very friendly and personal service is what they stand for. Newspaper and coffee at every moment. I didn't like the bed and linnen, airco loudness for heating, breakfast scanty and no egg or meat.

This hotel is in a great location and close to lots of things. It’s very basic and had it been more modern I would’ve had a very comfortable stay. The rooms are very dated and are ultimately dirty. For 3 consecutive nights we had a toenail of a different colour each night left on our floor we felt the need to clean the bath as soon as we arrived and there is very limited room if there is 4 people sharing a room with 2 double beds. The breakfast was okay if u could be bothered to wait in the queue to make a waffle otherwise you were left with toast or dry muffins.

The good:Good value hotel in a great location with nice staff. The rooms are clean, the bed is comfy and the bathroom appears to be recently renewed. Great amenities: coffee/tea-maker in the room, fridge, safe, iron, USB charging options. There is also 24h coffee/tea in the lobby. The not-so-good:A key to a room already occupied was accidentally given at check-in first. Although breakfast is included (which is a nice touch), it's really basic and the addition of at least some eggs and alike would improve it a lot. And please replace the single use cutlery, plates and cups!

First of all, I find the reviews as well as the reply's to reviews very amusing.The best part of the hotel is indeed the facade! Much nicer than anything on the block, though most of the block is in scaffolding as is THE WHOLE CITY.I found the staff very nice and spent some time having really nice conversations with some front desk people. The room was in fact pretty big. It was room 608. Pretty clean except for the bathroom which has different colored hairs to great me on the towels. I'm bald, so the hairs were not mine. I could live with that. There were 2 (and not 1) elevators. Between both, you didn't have to wait too long. They were slow, but are 100 years old. It is what it is. Bed was very comfortable and the heating was indeed a little noisy, but worked well. Breakfast:First of all, most of the travellers are from Europe. t's important to wake up in a good mood. There should be NO TV ON and particularly not with news. No one is interested. This also applies to the lobby, which could use an update. The breakfast room is indeed often full. The coffee is undrinkable. Much too weak especially for your European customers. PAPER PLATES AND FORKS, KNIVES AND SPOONS, are1. of the cheapest quality and will not even cut through scrambled eggs or frozen butter.2. really bad for the environment. Get some silverware guys and a dishwasher!The chairs are also way to big for the tables, so if you get a seat, you can't move around. They don't make a good combination. Lose the chairs! The breakfast is a good but failed attempt. Basically everything is filled with sugar.The waffle maker is great, but it's not a matter of if you're going to burn yourself but WHEN as the waffles when ready stick and the man wearing the net and gloves though polite, is far from helpful. Both the eggs and the sausage substance are inedible also. I suggest (as in most cheap European hotels) forget the hot stuff and just have a bowl with fruit salad, several meats and cheeses and your done. If you're going to make an attempt at an American breakfast, you're falling short. All in all an average stay. I paid $76 a night in January for a roomy single room, so I don't know where the prices come from in various reviews.Mixed feelings, but all in all, ok and good value for money at $76 a night. That is about what it was worth.

Have to say great location, staff very friendly and helpful, breakfast really good. Rooms were comfortable and clean only downside was we had a very small bathroom, but we managed .. fantastic value for money and would highly recommend this hotel.

Clean and decent hotel. Very good price compare with other hotels in Manhattan. Great location and the personnel was very polite and professional. The bathroom was a little small but overall I left with a pleasant impression.

Everything was as expected. Quite clean place great location. Decent breakfast always possible to have tea or coffee. Confortable bed. Would come back here to stay on the future without any doubt. Thanks

I came to stay for a week 12/28/19-1/4/20. New Years in NY for the first time. I actually used the towels to was the floor. I bought cleaning wipes to clean the “closet “ room I stayed in. There were no other rooms. I actually cried the whole first day and night. Didn’t sleep the whole first night. OMG, what I paid! This was booked in September. The most awful place. I don’t know what to say. Breakfast was just a mess. Grabbed a bagel and juice and went back to my now clean room because I cleaned it. This is whole zero hotel. I can’t afford to go anywhere else because it’s non-refundable. STAY AWAY FROM HERE . If you want to sleep in a dirty closet, have at it.

The stay at the heritage was great, it was close to every place we wanted to visit, the hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. Just a few minus thing in which it kind of mine a bit, like the elevator was small and slow, the room was small for me specially when you have kids with you and parking was off-site but overall it was great. In the future I’ll definitely will stay again!!

I grew up in NYC and come back every year at the holidays to visit family. I know what to expect in a budget NYC hotel. The elevators are small and slow, the room is small and the view is of the building next door, but that is to be expected. What makes this go from average to poor are three things that should have been better:>> the beds are not attached to the headboard so if you want to sit up in bed and read, the bed slowly rolls away from the headboard and you need to get up and shove it back in. Rinse, repeat.>> the wifi is terrible. I'm trying to write some work emails and the wifi kicks me off about every 60-90 seconds. Oddly, it's staying on long enough to let me write this :-)>> The TV has digital reception which pixellates and lags a couple of times during a movie.I'm not asking for luxury, just basic modern services to work well.

Room was in 10th floor. Outside view was the rear side of the next buidling. Very small room (for four people) and bathroom. Cleaning service excellent. Hairdryer was defect. After contacting the manager the hairdryer has been exchanged immediately. Breakfast room definitely too small for this hotel. Breakfast was standard. Excellent location to start exploring NYC: 3-5 minutes walk to the next subway stations.

What a great stay! Convenient to Time Sq, Rockefeller Ctr, and Empire State Building. Very happy but breakfast was a bit crowded. Will stay again. They have a minimum of 200 characters for the review so I’m making stuff up to fill the minimum.

the only two things that we didn't like were the heater, that was very noisy, and the elevator, that was very slow. Room, staff, services, location... everything else was great. I will recommend this hotel to everyone willing to go to the city

To begin the location when you go in Train its super easy to find. Everything is close by. Food, supermarket, pharmacy, train, entertainment. The hospitality, the personal, front desk, room service, janitors, everyone is super helpful and very attentive. I give you a 10 on that. The eating area alot of Variety, it’s worth it. The room nice, clean, comfy the only thing for me it needs a little bit of work os on the bathroom its a little bit small maybe rearranging it would be good and to put something inside to hold the soap at least. Other then that I love it and will stay again when needed. God bless.

Pluses-all the staff were very helpful and friendly;Clean roomsNo noise from outsideLocation was good-close to Madison Square Park, Flatiron Building. Cvs pharmacy on the corner. Eately right around the corner and is a must for dinner and dessert!Felt safeFree breakfast (although I got tired of eating the same thing 4 days in a row; maybe change the eggs and sausage to ham and grits every other day)ConsNoise from inside made it impossible for me to sleep well. I even brought a travel fan for white noise but that didn’t help at all. Interior walls seem paper thin. I could hear conversations in adjoining rooms. Fire doors are heavy and they slammed all night long.Keys never seemed to work so we had to get them reset several times.Elevator was probably the slowest I’ve ever encountered. Thank goodness I was only on the 6th floor.
user_name:
Dawn F
Nicholson, Georgia, United States

review_body: Very nice accommodations! The staff were GREAT helping us with directions and breakfast was a Plus! We had a great first time visit to New York! We would highly recommend this hotel to future visitors! Quaint and nice!

The thing with this hotel is not at all the room quality but the location.Situating at the crossing of 5th avenue & broadway near the subway is the advantage.Rooms are small,older & not well heated, but you can sleep & shower,thats it.Employees are extremely friendly&helpful.The included breakfast is enough for starting the day.conclusion: for the price they asked it's more or less OK.If you want more comfort,like we know in EUROP,you have to pay double or more.

We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The location was great for walking and using the subway. The breakfast was nice and many choices. The price was good and rooms were clean and comfortable. I’d certainly stay here again!!

This hotel was in an amazing location! It is central to all of the sights in Manhattan and you can walk to any place you’d like. We walked the majority of our trip, but the subway was a very short walk when we wanted to give our legs a rest. There is a wonderful place nearby called Eataly...absolutely AMAZING...coffee, authentic Italian restaurants, Italian market, Gelato, and wine all rolled into one place. The hotel was clean, had a great complementary breakfast, staff was very friendly and helpful, and most importantly we felt safe and secure staying there. The neighborhood had a great feel to it. We had a room with 3 twin beds and it was perfect for our stay. The only recommendation I would have is for the hotel to put a mirror on one of the walls in the room for another place for guests to get ready. The bathroom was small, so we each had to take turns using one mirror...but we made it work. Overall I would definitely stay here again, and I will recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone traveling to NYC. Great location, and great value!! Thank you Heritage Hotel NYC for a wonderful girls trip that I will never forget!

The hotel is in a top location around the corner of the flatiron building and 2 subway stations nearby, the staff is very friendly and helpfull, breakfast that is included is good for the price paid, the room and bathroom were very clean !

Stayed at hotel in December for 5 nights.. staff were excellent and so friendly and accommodating.. rooms were super clean and hotel was great location... breakfast was complementary and was perfect start to the day...def recommend the heritage hotel

Meeting with friends over a two day turnaround in NYC. 3 women. We needed a clean, basic, comfortable, good value room. As we got exactly that. It was perfect! 3 twin beds, our own little dormitory. Lol. We dropped our bags and headed out to the city. Room was comfortable with good beds, refrigerator and coffee maker, but coffee was fresh and hot in the lobby 24/7. Breakfast was an added treat, to fill up for day of site seeing. Reception staff was lovely and very helpful with directions or suggestions. Definitely will stay again.

Just back from the heritage Hotel New York. We spent 4 nights in the Heritage. We had a triple room on the 10th floor. The receptionists on duty when we arrived were very busy with arrivals, however they were very very pleasant to everyone. They dealt with the public very professionally. The hotel is in the flat iron district of New York which means it is within minutes of everything...... you may need good shoes for walking around....but think of the sights you will see..... I had read reviews about this hotel before we left and was hesitant about it well now I have the proof to tell you that this hotel is so central and perfect for.a short stay.... it’s not the Ritz for sure, but the rooms are clean and just big enough.... you don’t come to nyc to look at the toilet...... we were only in the hotel to sleep and it did that job very well....We got breakfast as well (it is all on paper plates and plastic cutlery) which consists of good coffee, or tea, toast, you make your own waffles with syrup, cereal and juice .... and bananas and apples. The little girl helping out in the breakfast deserves a good tip.....as she cleans up all the time so give her a tip....The hotel is perfect for a short stay.... the staff are very very pleasant, the breakfast is a plus at this hotel, it kept us going until lunch. The rooms were en-suite and clean and fresh everyday. The Hotel is in the center of New York City and yet it was quiet...... what more can I say.... stop complaining, it’s cheap and it’s clean and we enjoyed every minute we were there.....

Clean, comfortable with great location. Only issues were thoughtless fellow guests allowing doors to slam early in morning and slow lifts divest to be on lower floors.Helpful reception and generally good value.
The excellent reception at check in and the care they took of us helping us to spend good days in New York City.A special thanks to Christina, who helped us in everything by making our easy life!!!!!

Just returned to Las Vegas. Stayed at the Heritage Hotel for a week, Oct 2nd to the 9th. I am from Las Vegas where I was in the Hotel/Casino business for many, many years. I was at the famous Sands Casino, The home of Sinatra, Martin, Davis and so many others. These guys and so many more worked for us many times. It was when Las Vegas was growing up and becoming known around the world. It happened because we treated people right. Great hotels and the best entertainment in the world.. I turned 82 this year and still feel good when I see a hotel as well run as this place. Location: It’s on west 25 and right off 5th ave. You go out the hotel door and to the right and at the end of the block is the Flatiron Building in full sight. A beautiful sight. Madison Square park and lots of restaurants all around. The 23st subway is right there to take you uptown or downtown. Out the hotel door and to the left and down to 6th ave. Again, lots of restaurants and shops. Walk a bit down 6th and you will come across some of the best shopping anywhere. This is where I shop. At 23rd is the subway and if you know how to use it then you can go anywhere in the city.I like to walk 23rd west over to 7th and 8th. The Chelsea area. Boy, is it going through a change. Old buildings being converted into multi-million dollar apartments. Continue walking over to the river and you are at Chelsea Piers and all that’s happening there. Very exciting time in New York.I love the WiFi to check the weather every morning on my iPad and start my day with the very nice Breakfast the hotel serves. It is so well done and free. And the Smart Phone charging outlets in the room are a great idea. I could charge my iPhone, IPad and Nook at one time.My room was well set up and everything I needed was there. Maid service was very good.The Hotel front desk staff were so polite and helpful.So overall I am very pleased. Heritage is doing a good job and I feel this Hotel is in good hands.I am 82 years old and would like to visit New York city again. If I can make it, this is where I will stay.Ed WaltersLas Vegas

We spent 4 nights at the Heritage. We needed to be close to lots of NYC attractions to reduce the amount of cab rides. This hotel is ideal. True the room we had was small for three ( especially the bathroom) but it served our purpose well.The staff were so helpful. Breakfast was plentiful, buffet style and coffee available both in our room and by the dining room. Ideal for travellers who don't need frills.It was neat and clean. The rates are good and we would like to thank everyone who works so hard to maintain the rooms, provide breakfast and man the busy front desk.We don't always need red carpet treatment as we were out all day and just needed a hot shower and clean bed.Thank you all. We enjoyed NYC and the Heritage helped make it possible.A night view of the Empire State Building taken a few metres from the hotel.We three ladies would definitely use this hotel again despite the cramped bathroom. On behalf of all of us ( Mrs Dahl and family)

Great place to stay for our 2 nights in the city! Very convenient location, located by a lot of shopping and great restaurants. Plenty of subways nearby. Check in and check out were nice and smooth. Room was much bigger than expected! Bathroom is small but everything works just fine! The bed is a little hard but I know that's all about preference. We had a nice view of Empire State from our room. All and all I would stay again!

This place is run by people who know the hotel business and how to make their guests happy. My room was pleasant and whoever cleaned it just read my mind, even though we never met. The dining room staff was friendly and nice and it was great to be greeted by a smiling face in the morning. The reception desk staff was very friendly and with some of them we had interesting conversations. This place is comfortable, close to Union Square and 34 st. Many subway lines within 1-2 books walk. Times Sq is within 20 minute walk. It is also a few steps from Medison Sq. There are many eating places around a super a block away on 6th Ave. In short, it is perfect. Thank you for a great stay.

Hotel in good location, easy walk to Times Square 15 mins and subway just 3 mins walk away. Easy walk to Empire State too 10-15 mins, could see it from our room. Family room ok in size however only 1 bathroom which is challenging for 5 adults to get ready.The rooms are nice though, they have been renovated.Breakfast room is a bit disorganised of a morning however good option for the start of the day.There was a very bad fish smell outside our room in the hallway that they could not get rid of which was sickening, was offered a room on the last night but too hard to move the 5 of us with all our luggage just for the last day. Family room would be more suitable for 2adults with smaller kids not 5 adults.

Excelent place for price, near to all places of interest, very clean, helpful staff. Hotel is 5 min from Bellagio and Strip street. Easy to go to bus station for traveling around main Las Vegas street

The hotel was in a good position near the Flatiron Building and a park, and had some lovely period features.Check-in was easy, and there was no problem in leaving our bags until our room was ready.The room was clean and a reasonable size, with a closet, fridge and comfortable bed, and a renovated bathroom with plenty of space for toiletries with a window ledge and shelf. The shape of the room didn't really allow a dedicated place for our suitcases, but putting them at the end of the bed worked well. Although there wasn't a lot of light it didn't really matter since we were rarely there during the day, and it was very quiet at night, which is more important to us. Housekeeping was good, and staff were friendly (although the men who supervised the breakfast room looked a bit surly).Breakfast was good - juice, cereal, bread/toast/bagels, sausages and eggs, fresh fruit, muffins and danishes, and make-your-own waffles.The two elevators were a bit slow, and the corridors were very narrow, but going down there were two staircases. Wifi was fine - it dropped out now and then but came back immediately.

The hotel was great and clean. There was 5 of us and we had enough room for us all, bathroom was tiny for 5 girls but we made it work. The breakfast was ok, it would be nice to have different options.

Great hotel, staff were amazing, helpful and would definitely come back again. Breakfast was delicious, enjoyed my stay for 5 days.Reception staff were lovely, thank you to all for making my stay very welcoming.

Absolutely love it Christina on reception was very accommodating she couldnt do enough for us. Christina is a credit to the hotel. As a hotel manager myself in england so I know what difficulties can occur with in the business she never stops smiling made my stay more memorable would defo stay again xx

This place is literally a step above a hostel. If you're looking for a place to just lay your head at night that is no frills then this place is for you. If that isn't what you're looking for then I wouldn't stay here. Room and breakfast is what we paid for but the breakfast was appalling. Everything was served on paper plates with plastic cutlery and there was no variety in the "buffet" either. The staff are unhelpful and unbothered particularly the lady who works the front desk at night and listens to her iPhone earphones constantly. The TV remote in the room didn't work and when I asked for a replacement they sent a guy who stood in the room for 20 minutes pressing buttons till he decided the remote wasn't working. He then went and got a replacement that had the top part of the remote missing. Long story short this "hotel" is a joke and I would never ever stay there again.

very nice staff, good location for visitors , parking lot available (you have to pay extra at a parking lot inside on 26th street close to hotel if you drive ) you need to pay each time in and out if you need your car . AC working well but a bit noisy, good for family, room not very big, busy breakfast area if you come late, but ok.

Not sure where to start from the moment we arrived we were misled the hotel itself is more like a hostel the staff were very abrupt and not concerned that we were in fact given the wrong room and did not want to help us until we Stood our ground When we finally got our room it was dirty The quality of the room was way below a one star.For the time I was there I couldn’t bear myself to actually go under the blankets Of fear of getting bit The pictures might explain this . The Breakfast area was overcrowded and you were watched by a funny man with a hat on his head Making sure you didn’t take any food back to your room this was not going to happen anyway because it was disgusting food overall please do your research before you book this hotel

Nice clean rooms with fresh bed linens. The Staff was courteous and friendly. Great central location that is close to everything. I highly recommend this hotel if staying in New York City and looking for a clean affordable place to stay

Stayed here for 3 nights,as per the last review we experienced problems with booking in with credit card booking also being given wrong type of room for which receptionist tried to fob us off / room totally different in size/looks to the one advertised/also the bedding was stained/we should have left immediately but after trying to book alternative hotel we decided it would be too much trouble/the breakfast room was crowded as soon as it opened and it had the feeling of a hostel rather than a hotel/...We should have done more research into our choice so i would advise others to BEWARE ITS NOT GOOD/ The only plus point to this place is that its close to 5TH Avenue.....

Paid for our room in full in advance via Bookings.com arrived approx. 3am in the morning, gave them our credit card, which was different from the one we booked with, they accepted our new credit card as everything had been pre paid. Our room turned out to be so small there was not any room for our suit cases. Had to put them on the floor beside the bed which meant there was no room to walk around them. No where to hang clothes. Would have had to live out of the suit case, but after putting them on the bed. The picture shown is nothing like the rooms themselves. The room in the photo has been doctored for advertising only. Next morning complained bitterly about the terrible room that we had been allocated. They agreed to book us out of that room and book us into a new room, which turned out to be the room next door. At this stage they had used our new credit card twice so what ever their objection later was it was obvious it was a scam. Every morning we heard the people complaining bitterly about this small room and demanding a change. This is how they tried to scam us returned to our room on the 7 August to find that we had been locked out, they had confiscated our clothes, passports, monies and papers which they would not return to us. They demanded that we repay for the room on our new Credit Card as this was different from our initial payment. They said that they would then reimburse our initial payments to our old Credit Card even though we told them we no longer had this Credit Card. What would be our chances of retrieving this payment when we had left America the following day PROBABLY NONE I am 80 years of age and my wife is 74 she was very upset and reduced to tears as it was very embarrassing with other people in the lobby thinking we could not pay our bill, one lady offered to help us out financially. After a long heated debate we demanded that they fetch the police to sort it out, a few minutes latter they gave us back the key for the room. The obviously thought that they could take advantage of an elderly couple. I give this Hotel the BIG DO NOT USE IT which I would have said regardless of them trying to scam us. Everybody in the Hotel were complaining were not as they expected from the advertising. Reported this to Bookings.com they did not even have the courtesy acknowledge our complaint.
user_name:
stacey8522019
New York City, New York

review_body: Overall it was so clean and hospitable. The staff was welcoming and extremely polite. All my expectations were surpassed for this quick weekend stay. I realy enjoyed staying here for its convenient location. From check in to check out all was a breeze.
user_name:
Afb91
San Sebastián, Pais Vasco, Spain

review_body: Very convenient location for traveling around Manhattan. Was able to check in very quickly and the rooms were nice. Would recommend to anyone visiting the city and wanted a location that is convenient for most major attractions.

The only thing I didn´y like was the temperature during breakfast. It was too hot and it was better to take the food and have breakfast in the street.The room was small but confortable and the shower was very good.

his hotel literally had everything that you needed, it was very clean and comfortable, we had an amazing view of the Empire State Building from our room. We couldn't have picked a better location either, Central Park, Times Square, Grand Central station and Rockefeller were all within walking distance! Subway was less than 1 minute walk too...will definitely stay here again the next time we go!!!

A nice little hotel. A little on the cheap looking side, and very basic.Rooms are a good size, and equipped well. Friendly staff.In a great location with plenty nearby, but just far enough away so you’re not in the thick of it.Would happily recommend

Spent one night here in July,pluses and minuses:PRICE:much less than other hotels in Manhattan Accomodations:Larger than most economy hotels in NYCAge of facility:Very aged, A/C was an old noisy window unit (it did work)TV:Small , poor cable choicesBathroom:Aged but functional Hallways were dangerous and very narrow Free Breakfast fair to middling Staff was very friendly honest and fair allowed us to stay a little later than checkout time Recommended but understand what you are getting

We’ve just returned from a family holiday from NYC and stayed in the Heritage Hotel for 5 nights ( 2 adults + 3 Children). Our room was on the 9 floor and for rooms in Manhattan it’s was s good size. The Lift was a bit slow but we didn’t mind, but that probably the only small complaint as for everything else we couldn’t fault it. Our room was spotless and cleaned everything day the beds were very comfortable and after a busy day with plenty of walking it was great to come back knowing we’d all have a great rest. We found all the staff very friendly and helpful with everything. We found the WiFi great in both our room, breakfast area and lobby. Tea, coffee, water and ice was available in the lobby area 24hr, we all found this brilliant especially the iced water as it was so warm when we were there. The breakfast was busy at time with s contest flow but you wouldn’t be waiting to long for a seat. A good selection of cereals, pastries, breads, fruit along with juices and of course tea and coffee. The location was perfect, very central but yet far enough away from the chaos of midtown Manhattan. The subway was 2 minutes walk from the hotel and the flatiron Building seconds away also. We had an added bonus of a view of the Empire State Building from our room. If we ever get the opportunity to travel to Manhattan again we will definitely return to this hotel.

friendly crew but room was not OK. There is a TV that does not work. If you want to use the coffee maker then there is no power connection and you have to replace the coffee maker. Next the power connection and USB connection on the bedside table did not work as well. With a small fee it is possible to store the suit case for the rest of the day when you have to move out of the room. The morning breakfast is average and the crew is not so friendly there. Or they don't understand English.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Heritage Hotel. It is in a fantastic location and has everything you need, including a superb inclusive breakfast and tea/coffee available 24/7. There is air con in the rooms which is very effective (though a little noisy).

For as old as this building is, they've done an excellent job of maintaining it. Always clean and welcoming. The continental breakfast was sufficient and a real perk in NYC, but after 7 days the same food got a little redundant, and there wasn't ever enough fruit. The elevator required patience because it was a bit slow. But we were thrilled with the option of a family suite. Maintenance was prompt when we had an issue. Convenient to many subways, and Madison Square park with Shake Shack is just a quick walk, great part of town to be in that put us central to wherever we wanted to go. Would absolutely stay here again.

This is in a great location with the subway just a few minutes walk, great cafe next door and only a short walk from Time Square. Its an older building and not very updated. typical NYC old building with small rooms. if you are on a budget, its a great stop. The breakfast is minimal but sustaining for a day of exploring.

It was peak season in NYC and a great deal to get this petite quad room. Located at 25th street and just a few minutes walk to Broadway, 5th Ave and Madison Square. All basic amenities were available and the room was clean. The reception and team were always friendly and helpful. Stayed there for 7 nights so breakfast repeated the same, but really no complains, there is Chinese and a great cafe just beside. It is indeed in a heritage building so elevators were slower and hallways are smaller, but isn't that the beauty of NYC too? Would love to be back again! Thanks!

The room was small, but clean. There is an average breakfast and the elevator is slow. The staff were helpful when needed. We went for pride and the hotel is a half block from Madison park, where it stepped off. It was convenient to go back to for restrooms and breaks during the day.

Very basic room and quite humid with no light. Bed was comfortable and the shower was good, too. Old building. Free breakfast. Location is amazing, very central, 2 mins walk from the underground. I would recommend it. We stayed 5 nights.

This is an old boutique hotel. Rooms are in the process of updating. Very nice staff. Continental breakfast. Slow elevator. They will store your luggage before or after checkin/out. Fridge in room was not cold enough to keep what I needed cold.

Clean hotel, service minded staff.Helpful in arranging shuttle to the airport. Good price/performance .Good location with the nice madison-park nearby, washington-square, Kleinfield Bridal, DavidMetro and bus stations nearby. Advice: Take the M55 bus up/downtown as a replacement for Hop/on Hop/off

A fantastic hotel with superb faciliteis and staff. Very comfy beds. Breakfast was awsome and a good choice of coffee 24/7. Yes it could do with decorating but the cost compared to other hotels was a steal. If you want perfect walls go to the Hilton.

Clean, comfortable, everything worked; good sized fridge and safe, an average sized room for this area. This was my second stay at this hotel and once again everything went fine--all the employees are very nice and helpful.

The pictures really don’t look like the room we had, but it was perfect for us. We had a smoking room which isn’t often offered and it was really clean.The front desk gal Christine truly made us feel welcome at the end of our long days traveling around the city. It was like coming home every night.The metro stations are really close and there was never an issue hailing a cab.I would go back again for sure!

Very pleasant staff, excellent location. The rooms are clean and quite.There is a free wifi and the complementary breakfast is very good.The subway station is only at 1 min from the hotel.I recommend this hotel

The hotel is in a good location close to all major midtown attractions but has a quiet feel to it. Its proximity to the subway, restuarants and bars of the Flatiron district make it a great place to stay for those who are budget concious.

Surrounded by restaurants, bars, and beautiful Madison Square. Breakfast was good with pastries, bagels, sausage, scrambled eggs, donut holes, cereal, coffee tea and juice. Discount parking a block away $28 per day. But the property is very old and the furnishings are really basic, like an old Days Inn in the Carolinas. Lots of dust under the bed (room 902.). The light fixtures above the breakfast buffet are really filthy, covered in dust.A good bargain hotel in a great location on Manhattan.

The front desk was great, especially Christine. She couldn’t have been more helpful!The room was fine and clean.The only draw back were the elevators, very slow, but what can you expect for a old building.

Staff on the desk where very helpful and knowledgeable about the area and how to get there hotel was basic but clean going through a refurbishment at the moment breakfast was good plenty to choose from

I had booked us 4 nights here, telling them it was a special occasion, we arrived, and were told our room number, had trouble entering the room, as the bed took up so much room, you could not open the access door fully, the bedding left something to be desired as well. To their credit, when we spoke to them, they were happy to show us, an alternative room, which actually looked like a room from their promotional pictures, we had a view of the Empire State building, as well, though the bathroom was a bit cramped. The hotel location is great, 20 minutes from Empire State, 30 minutes to Times Square, but why bother, there is also a number of different restaurants located near by. There are two small lifts, which give you access to the floors, but narrow winding staircase, if you have to walk up, these give away the age of the hotel. Breakfast is buffet style, but be aware, it gets very busy, room is limited, and as with America everything is done to make life easy, plastic plates, knifes and forks, all throw away, have they not heard of dishwashers.We stayed 4 nights, bed was combatable, room was tided each day, shower and the shallowest bath I had ever seen, required you to think a head, no turning on the water and expecting it to be hot straight away, but it came, just took a while. Would I stay there again, yes, would I look to stay somewhere else, yes again.

Good overall, great staff, charming vintage building. They are renovating and our bathroom was new and spotless. The room's floor was new plank tiles, which we loved as an alternative to carpet, just feels cleaner! Staff were all very friendly and helpful; the blanket on one of the beds appeared soiled, may have been washed but we couldn't tell. Five minutes after calling the front desk, a fresh blanket was delivered to the room. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, although I think they were full size, not queens. A tall or large person should double check. The room and bathroom were very small and there was no view, but that's what you get in Manhattan, so not a negative. The free breakfast was pretty low end but the coffee was decent, which made a huge difference. The chairs in the breakfast room need to be swapped because an average person's chin was just a few inches above the table, but hopefully better chairs are in the renovation plans. Our ONLY legit complaint was that the room had no place to HANG anything! No closet, no hanger bar, not even a door or wall hook. It rained off and on the whole time were were there and three people had to really scramble to find places to lay wet clothes - we draped them over the shower door, from door knobs, over the tv and desk chair, etc. One thing to know if you stay, you have to watch for the elevator to arrive at your floor because it does not have an alert sound, and you have to open the door to it. If you don't notice it arriving and fail to open the door in time, it will leave without you. If you like this location and can get a good rate, stay here for the cleanliness and comfortable beds. Hopefully as renovation progresses they will provide a place to hang clothes!

Staying for six nights, we pre-paid the full amount, non-refundable through booking.com to get a better rate. When we arrived at the hotel we weren’t carrying the debit card that had made that payment (it had expired a few months previously). We were told we would have to pay again, and then receive a refund. That seemed very odd to me as the room was literally bought and paid for - if the hotel wanted a new card on file, we offered one to swipe. They were intransigent though. When I asked to see the manager, I was refused on the basis that he would say the same - it’s policy. When I asked whose policy, because it was unclear, the hotel or booking.com, the lady on reception said she had had enough of this and stormed off in to the office and handed us over to a colleague. Just unbelievably rude. World class rude in fact. Welcome to New York.We decided we just needed to pay - again - and wait for the refund. Incredibly annoying, but we could see no alternative. I handed over my credit card and the payment was taken. The new receptionist then processed the refund on to the original card, not the credit card! Without telling us she was doing this!! Aaaaaagh.Genuinely awful customer service - an inability to deal with a simple issue in a way that is in any way positive for the customer. I am still shocked by how rude the staff on reception are at this hotel.The hotel itself is very tired. Paint and plaster is chipped on every wall. There was even some graffiti on the window frame. The windows are so filthy you can barely see out of them. It needs millions spending on it to bring itself up to any kind of acceptable standard. Maybe if the staff cared about their customers this wouldn’t matter so much...In short - find somewhere else to stay.

Stayed for 5 nights. On arrival really quick and easy check in. Thank you Christina. Excellent view from our room of the ESB. Location fantastic for exploring New York. Close to metro stations but also easily walkable. Breakfast great with varied options. Comfortable beds. Would recommend and stay here again.

This hotel is just off Madison Square Park (not Garden) and brilliantly located in the iconic Flatiron district. There are lots of cool shops and bars nearby (e.g Lego store Eatitaly, 230 Fifth) and the park is lovely for views, Shake Shack and the play area. There are subway stations 3 min walk but you can easily walk around Midtown from here. The Empire State Building is visible from the lobby.The room was small and the decor a little shabby (although they are renovating) but all clean and as expected for this price in New York. The building itself is "faded gradeur" and the breakfast room and selection were grand (cereals, juices, coffee, waffles, eggs, sausages, bagels, pastries, fruit). They will show luggage for $1 per item and the staff were pleasant.

We were staying in a suite at this hotel for 5 days. In the suite, there was one room with a king sized bed and another room with two double beds and the door to the bathroom. We had a fun stay and also the food at breakfast was good, though there were only plastic cutlery and cups and paper plates.

We had 4 nights at the Heritage Hotel on Manhattan. It’s in a great location and super for sightseeing. The room was basic, small and we overlooked an alley. However, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. It had an iron and ironing board, fridge and hairdryer so those things all made the stay easier. The lady at check in was friendly and helpful. The free continental breakfast was plentiful and definitely helped to save money as NY can be expensive to eat out. On our last stay in NY, the hotel was more upmarket for not a lot more, but this one was in a better location. Therefore, I would definitely recommend as a budget hotel and would stop there again if I could get it at a good rate.

I’m just back from New York with my sister and I spent a great time at the heritage hotel. Rooms are always very nice and clean, bigger than average size. The position is great: in front of the Flatiron building.Staff is so lovely and helpful. Rafia and Haja (I hope to remember right) have been so kind and able to answer to any request. So great the fact that we could leave the luggage for only €1.It is very convenient the fact that they offer breakfast. The only think I would suggest some lactose free options.

Pros - great location, good service, good breakfast, good wifi, clean and v comfy bedsCons - a bit tired and in need of a bit of tlc and an update. Breakfast room too small for No. of guests so can have to wait for table to come free. All in all, good for a budget stay, which is v hard in NY!

Perfect location, nice breakfast ( very good selection for the whole family - eggs, sausages, wafels, cereal, fruts ...), clean room. Coffee and hot water 24/7. Very helpful service. Subways were easily accessible. Thank you for the pleasant stay!!!

Everything fine, great amenities (coffee and hot water 24/7).Very helpful and friendly service. You helped to make my trip unforgettable. Nice comfortable in our spacious 3 single beds room (and it was just the standard room). Your location is also very convenient for 1st time New York visitors: Flat Iron Building and Subway just around the corner.Thank you very much.

I,along with 20 of my peers stayed a week at this hotel when traveling as a group for a college trip. The rooms are adequately equipped. They offered comfortable beds and good showers. The buffet breakfast had plenty to offer with cereals, make your own waffle machine, pastries and sausage and eggs. There was also juice, tea and coffee. We gave the hotel 5 stars for location, there are supermarkets at the end of the street. Subway stations a couple of blocks away and the Empire State Building is within easy walking distance. Overall a great little no frills Hotel with lovely helpful staff. We would recommend this hotel as a great base to explore Manhattan from.

We stayed here in April 2018 and this was before the rooms were renovated and the work was ongoing. That said we had a lovely stay at the Heritage. Staff were helpful and friendly. The location was central and subways were easily accessible. Rooms although small, were warm, comfortable and adequate and the breakfast was excellent. Looking at the photos now we would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to get back to New York. Thank you for helping to make my son's 21st birthday a memorable one.

The rooms are clean, there is a big television and toiletries are provided. The rooms are adequately decorated and you are provided with what you need. However, by air conditioning they mean a kind of large space heater which can be very loud and once you turn the heater off the room loses temperature very quickly. We asked for a balcony, we didn't get one and we had a lovely view of some scaffolding on the back of a building. There were four of us and we were placed 7 floors apart for some reason and the tv could not be operated by the controller, it could turn the volume up and down but the channel had to be changed by your own hand to the television. Some redeeming things about the hotel was the breakfast was really good with a lot of variety and tea and coffee was available downstairs at all times.

Stayed on 11th floor, perfect view of the Empire State Building!Rooms were clean and comfortable with a fridge and safe. We had one of the suites and the rooms were a very generous size, quite basic but you get what you pay for.We found the best time to go down for breakfast was 7.30am before the rush and there was plenty to eat, lovely waffles each morning!The lifts were slow but that wasn't a problem as we just allowed extra time to get out.I may also add we were in New York when the temperatures were well below freezing but having heaters in each room meant we could warm up very quickly!And lastly the staff were very pleasant even the guy cleaning the lifts!Thank you for a lovely stay!!

The rooms are very small, but clean. They offer you breakfast from 7-10am which is cool. The problem is the place is packed you can't get in to eat and they don't allow you to take the food to your room. Therefore, those who can't get in have to miss out.....not cool!!

This place was nothing special, but gets the job done! It was clean and the staff were friendly. We were on the 9th floor so it was nice and quiet. It's an old building and the bathroom was TINY but there were no real issues! If you're just looking for a nice clean place to sleep while you're in the city, this place is great.

We are regulars at this hotel. Every year at the same time we come to NYC and stay at this hotel. We've been staying here for 4 years. Its clean, affordable, in a decent location, has a great restaurant next to it. The staff is helpful and we've had no problems. Rooms are on the small side but that is to be expected in these tall buildings in the city. Saturday and Sunday there is a flea market across the street. This is the only hotel we will stay at. And I recommend it. Free breakfast.

A very good hotel for the Money. Good breakfast, most of the receptionists were very nice (especially Christine) Location is OK and the rooms are clean and nice. The manager was very polite and every breakfast he makes sure that everybody is satisfied.

Great hotel, awesome atmosphere and the workers were very nice and super helpful when I needed guidance around the city. Complimentary breakfast was good, great variety, the rooms looked newly renovated and were very clean. Also located conveniently to everything-Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, Flatiron building, Times Square and all other touristy things were within walking distance, and if not, the subway was located around the block. Overall, I really liked the stay, and 100 percent would stay again and recommend!

Love the hotel it was clean central staff were lovely and helpful and we had a great view of the empire state building from our room thanks guys great stay now I have said all that needs to be said trip advisor needs more words so I will just dribble on need I say more

I stayed at Heritage hotel with my fiancée for 7 nights whilst on holiday - first time to New York. Couldn’t have wanted anything more: good-sized room with really comfortable bed, all the basic amenities, great location and all for a good price. Breakfasts included which was a a good way to start each day (on paper plates and disposable cutlery) but plenty of it.Midtown location meant all the main attractions were very accessible - flatiron building, Empire State Building, Rockefeller centre and Times Square are all walking distance. The hotel is just off broadway so you can easily walk up into Times Square. Staff are friendly and helpful and the manager would walk around at breakfast sometimes to ask if everything was ok. Our room was in good condition with mini fridge and coffee machine and 32 inch tv. King sized bed was very comfortable! Haven’t got anything negative to say about Heritage hotel really - you could spend a lot lot more money for a fancier hotel with nicer breakfast (and crockery!) and a fresher coat of paint on the walls but why would you. This hotel was comfortable and was a great base to see Manhattan - perfectly suited for our needs.

Me and two of my friends stayed for a night out in the city. Great location, and nice staff. Rooms could've looked a little nicer and doors slammed so it was hard to sleep in the morning. Overall, stay was great and I would stay there again.

The location is convenient, few steps away from flatiron building, fifth ave shops and also to the MTA station. Staff was kind and helped us with all check-in/out procedures. Very Good american breakfast, clean and comfy bed.Only few drowbacks: 1- the room was a bit cold, so you have to turn on the heat system which is pretty noisy and does not serve the bathroom 2- stairs, corridor and elevators are dated and a renovation should be considered 3- luggage storage is cheap but not free

excellent price-performance ratio, continental breakfast, nice staff, great location, public transport access, views of the Empire State Building, shopping options within reach of the hotel, I can recommend a stay here

We were visiting our daughter who has a small apartment in the Chelsea district of Manhattan for a long weekend and were amazed to find a h li tel for around $100 per night. Old building but very clean. Nice breakfast included. Couldn't find a better area for so many sights. Restaurants, and things to do.

This hotel is in a real good location we walked to everything from here as long as the weather is good and you have time the location is very central for all the top toursit attractions as well as being close to Manhatten park to just chill and relax after walking .Hotel has breakfast included which is a massive plus and food is always hot and fresh and always topped up regular.The hotel itself has a lovely view of the Empire state building off its front steps and comes with the added bonus of 24hr hot tea and coffee as well as coffee in the room so you can have hot drinks anytime day or night.Rooms are very clean with fresh towels daily and come with free toiletries and ample storage space and good heating or cooling depending on the time of visit .Yes hotel is a bit dated in places but it is clean and full of character and charm .staff are amazing very helpful polite and kind i would definately recommend staying here and will be returning myself in the future keep up the good work and thanks .

Lovely, helpful team. Breakfast very good (waffle maker included). Rooms clean. Air con a bit noisy, but not a major inconvenience. Bathroom a bit cold, but not unbearable. Location perfect. All midtown attractions close and subway a very short walk away for longer journeys.

We stay for four days on the hotel, hk miss to clean the room floor twice, fridge was broken we reported never repairs; Cristine the best worker you have it,waffles are great but only one person always smile( the person who stock the area) he was fantastic; sad to say that we great them and their answer was given with a bitter face.

Very good location in mid Manhattan. Close to bars and restaurants and central to many attractions. I’m not one to normally care about the appearance of the hotel as to me it’s a bed to sleep in.... Reception for me was OK, friendly staff, not quite what I’d pictured but fine. I was a little taken aback when I got out of the lift into my corridor and found it was very very dated and really could do with a tidy up. The room itself was absolutely fine. Lovely comfy bed, tv, private bathroom. Morning time brings complimentary breakfast, again the breakfast room needs a little updating but that’s me being harsh. Breakfast is great, cereal, hot food, toast, fruit, freshly made waffles and juice and hot drinks. Overall.... I’d booked for my wife’s 40th birthday as a surprise so for a change wanted a hotel that was a little tidier. But it is a great hotel if you can see past the decor. I would certainly return to this hotel.

This is pretty decent and clean hotel for the price and location. Both my wife and I liked our stay here except couple things....one, the lift; there's only one of that, but the biggest problem is it's very very slow. Second, humidity control. Our trip was in January so for obvious reason we had to keep the heater on as long as we stayed in our room. That made the air very dry because there's no humidity control anywhere. Our sleep was hampered big time. We got barely 5 hours of sleep per day and even that was not uninterrupted. Every time I slept, I woke up shortly with a dry throat. It sounds like a small problem to not have humidity control of the room, but it messed up with our vacation plans significantly. We were tired and drowsy the whole time. Not fun!

All you need for a central Manhattan hotel. Clean, helpful, great location for travelling in and getting around. No problems at all although the lifts take a little time to come down! We had a really good time based here.

Good location and comfortable beds. Cleaning could have been better as there was dust under the beds and above the lowlevel wardrope. We requested a view to the Empire State Building and we got it, it was great! Breakfast was okay for a few night stand.

I stayed at this hotel three times so far.The biggest attraction is the location!I can use a subway with many lines,I could also go to Times Square by walking.And from the room ...,A good view of the Empire State Building!Unless this hotel goes away,I think I will stay here forever!

The experience in the Heritage Hotel was wonderful, the location of the Hotel is the best.!! I’m definitely will stay again in Heritage. PS. The staff is great.!! Very helpful.!! We are in love with the city.!! But just for vacation.!!

It´s ok if you use the hotel just to sleep and have a shower. Room is very old and was very cold, on our 1st night we request an additional blanket and receptionist seem to be annoyed but the heating was no powerful enough. Breakfast is VERY basic. Location is great.

A fantastic hotel with a few niggles but overall a great experience. The staff are great and always helpful. The rooms are spacious for New York but I did have a family room with two bedrooms so for a family it was perfect and a small bathroom - perfectly acceptable for a weeks holiday! The beds are so comfortable I work up everyday refreshed. The hotel is a little dated in some areas but I can see that they are trying to update as they go forward. The lifts really aren't as slow as what everyone else is making out - if you get caught at rush hour or breakfast it does stop a lot but that is the same in any hotel!! The breakfast is the same every day, but the waffle maker was our saviour - kids loved it! The hotel could do with two though as you did sometimes have to queue for this but no more than 5 mins! It would be really nice though not to have plastic plates, cutlery and cups to eat breakfast with as its such a waste and surely it's more cost effective and less waste for the environment to use reusable crockery and cutlery! A bit more washing up but a good dishwasher would be better than all that waste!!! Did have an IPhone charger/wire disappear, they left the English plug though so keep an eye on your belongings - this is not the first missing item I have read about. The hotel was also very close to the metro - literally round the corner and the infamous FlatIron building was also just around the corner. The heating is great when it's on - we left it off when out but as soon as we turned it on, the room was boiling in a a matter of 10 minutes - so no stress, yes it's a little loud but no big deal as we didn't leave it on during the night. A great little hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to another family especially a family of five - it's very difficult to find hotels that can accommodate us so a real pleasure.

We had very comfortable beds in a cozy room. The staff was friendly and helpful. Checked luggage service meant we could explore the city after our overnight stay, and get the car later. Parking was simple and affordable (by NYC standards). Breakfast was satisfactory. Not a lot of choices for someone trying to avoid gluten and carbs, but we weren't here for the breakfast.

Excellent location, close to subway station, comfortable beds, the bathroom small but clean and updated. The staff was very helpful and the room was always made and clean when we arrived. For the price is really worth and I would stay here again if I had to come back.

Great location, all you need for a city break.Staff was very helpful and informative.There are few great places to eat around and only 10- 15min subway ride to 9/11, Brooklands Bridge, time square or cental Park.

Great value for your money. And the location is wonderful. Bathrooms clean and updated. The front desk very helpful in giving advice on tourist ideas. Breakfeast buffet had a variety of selections. Would stay again.

Seemed super sketchy at first, but no one died, and nothing was stolen so that’s a plus. The lighting in the room was harsh, and they had no full length mirrors, only a small mirror over the sink in the bathroom (not fun for 3 women getting ready at the same time.) Can’t complain about the price and location.

To find a hotel that could house 2 teenagers in separate beds and within our budget was incredibly difficult until I found the Heritage.The rooms are not modern, the air con is old and noisy but is very efficient. The beds were very comfortable.Location wise it is halfway between times square and lower Manhattan. The subway is a very short walk away. Flatiron building is around the corner.Our daughter was sick the day we arrived in new york, the hotel let us check in early so we could get her into bed. The staff at reception are a true asset to this hotel. Breakfast is basic but it is still better than paying for it.

There was an iron sheet on a conditioner which rattled during rain like a thunder. Couldn’t sleep rainy nights. Bed linen was washed with a smelly detergent so it smelled a lot. Blanket was torn. The main pros is location of the hotel.

Perfect location in town but room a bit dated, the aircon was more of a engine on a 747 airplane... room felt sterile. Service was great though, kind and attentive and there 24/7. Breakfast ok but nothing more.

Stayed only one night before a cruise to Caribbean.it is very central,and great deli's around on Broadway.Walking distance to lots of things.Rooms are not big,but they are clean and bathroom has toiletries.It is older style hotel.Staff was nice and they serve great breakfast.Waffles were to die for.Staff was nice and helpful.On the day we left for our cruise 14 Nov.they were upgrading their beds and furniture.There is also all night coffee and water in the lobby and coffee maker in the room.Would stay again and recommend it to my friends

amazing exelent staff close to rocafeller center really good . rooms very clean dosent have indoor parking but they have a good deal with a privete parking . the elevator a little bit slow but we got room in 3th floor no to bad for us

Great staff made our visit a pleasure. Nipa and Ruiza as well as the rest of staff were superb. Clean and great location, although rooms are tight. Shower pressure was great. Breakfast was well organized and efficient.

All people of front desk, I need say thank you, All of them were very kind, educated, lovely and helpful, Without word to describe the service of them. The room was always clean and tidy.The hotel is simple but very well located.The room that we used has the very good vision like a post card of the Empire State Building.

Room was small but very clean. Perfect for a weekend getaway. Hotel allowed us to drop our bags off early for free and kept them after we checked out for $1/bag, a great service when a tourist in NYC. Elevators are a bit slow, but the stairs are easily accessible.

I stayed in this hotel with 2 of my adult children. We all stayed on the 6th floor. The hotel although needing a bit of a paint was wonderful. The beds were comfortable and the breakfast was lovely and kept us going throughout the day. The staff were friendly and so helpful, there was someone on hand 24 hrs a day. The hotel was very clean and was cleaned several times a day. The location you wouldn't get any better. I would totally recommend this hotel. I would definitely go back. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay easy and enjoyable.

Room was very clean and available immediately, the front desk staff were very polite. The building was also quiet throughout the night and early morning. I would definitely recommend as it's an excellent and accessible location.
user_name:
TheRW378
New York City, New York

review_body: Very central place to stay in New York - just around the corner from Flat Iron building so very central. 15 min walk to Times square and another 10 minutes to Rockefeller centre. Rooms not huge but did the job and were clean and comfortable. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was fine and waffles loved the waffles machine..

Although the staff is quite friendly and helpful, my room was littered with mouse droppings. I stayed at the Heritage in July and, because it was at the height of the season, I paid almost $300 for the night. Let's just say that it was a complete waste of money: I found mouse droppings at the foot of the bed. If I had read a review like this one, I never would have booked the room. Travelers BEWARE!

Pros.: Great budget hotel located centrally in Midtown. Close to subway and offers free breakfast. Will store your luggage for a super low fee. Hotel staffs are super nice and very helping. Has a budget chinese restaurant on the ground floor with average food quality.Cons: As with most budget hotels in NY, the rooms are way too small. The lifts are absolutely the worst, takes ages to reach your floor. Please stay on a lower floor if you need to go out often. No restaurant. Room cleaning service can be improved. Rooms, though renovated, look old and the air conditioning unit in our room was from a different generation.Overall: Great option in midtown at a budget with great staff. Most things are exactly as advertised and if your expectations match that, go for this hotel.

I stayed for one night. Excellent location, great customer service, and decent rooms. A couple of subway stops extremely close by, and plenty of major attractions within walking distance. I would stay here again.

I was looking for a hotel in Manhattan for the week after Thanksgiving so all the prices were pretty high. I found the Heritage after quite a bit of looking and the price was fairly reasonable.The check in process was nice and smooth, though the official pictures are careful to avoid the outside of the building.The hotel itself is clean but really dated, it looks like it's been untouched since the 1980's. Rooms were a reasonable size for NY with a decent sized bathroom.With a little TLC this could be a really great hotel as the location is excellent

Heritage Hotel is in an excellent location with several subway stops nearby and within walkin distance to Broadway and Central Park. While the building could certainly use some updating and the a/c-heater are definitely on the noisy side, the rooms are comfortable with large beds and bathtubs. The staff is helpful and assists effectively with arising problems. The complimentary breakfast has good offerings with cereal, diy waffles, eggs, sausages, bagels and other pastries. In a very expensive city, this hotel is a very good option if you need to watch your finances.

Stayed here for 4 nights.There were 6 adults and 5 children. Girl on check in was very helpful.sorted out cots for 2 rooms.Rooms were small but only used them for showering and sleeping.Breakfast was adequate and loved we could get a coffee anytime day or night.Great location.Nice bars and restaurants round about.Would definitely stay here again .

I would not recommend this hotel if you’d like to enjoy your time in NYC. We ran into a minor issue that could have been easily been solved (and has been easily solved in multiple other hotels that I’ve stayed in) but the hotel staff was not only unwilling to solve my minor issue but was also extremely rude. I am not a picky person with high standards, in fact this is the first negative review I’ve ever taken the time to write, but if I can save others from the worst customer service in NYC then it’s worth it. Enjoy this beautiful city in any hotel other than Heritage Hotel.

We stayed for 3 nights during thanksgiving, and it was perfect. Room was small (it’s New York) but it was newly updated and clean. The free breakfast had a lot of choices, and there was always hot coffee and tea in the front for when we came in from the cold. Overall, we are very happy that we stayed here.

The hotel is well located - less than 5 minutes from 23rd station. There are excellent restaurants in the neighborhood. The breakfast is good (muffins, wafels, toast and more). All staff are really helpfull (from the front desk to room service). It’s a really good choice in NYC.

The wife and I stayed for one week and really enjoyed our stay. A very comfortable bed, air-con worked great and we loved the complimentary breakfast. Close to everything if you take the nearby subway and so many places to eat nearby. Next time in the big apple we’ll be booking in again.

Yes, the elevators are slow, a couple of art prints on the walls would brighten up the room, and the touted remodeling didn't include the beat-up old furniture in the room. But the location is great - in the heart of Flatiron area shopping and a short walk to the orange R-W subway line. The room was comfortable, the bed was fine, the staff was great and the included breakfast makes it a great value for the area.

This might have been the dreariest hotel room that I've ever stayed at. I realize that this is Manhattan, but C'mon! If there's a plus it's that I'm going to find the photog who did their promotional pictures. This guy/gal's a genius at creating an illusory fantasy place. More seriously, the staff is friendly. But overall, the Heritage Hotel NYC was a massive miss.

This is a budget hotel, a stone's throw from the flatiron building. So bear that in mind when considering at this hotel. The entrance lobby feels tired... but not as tired as both lifts which are probably the slowest I have ever used. This is a real pain at breakfast when everyone wants to use them. Breakfast is... well... minimal... but does the job. The rooms are clean, basic, compact and again, they feel a bit tired. The reception staff are friendly enough and helpful. But here's the clicher... a hotel this price... in the heart of New York is pretty damn good.

The location was good. It was walking distance to many of the main places, like time square, in NYC manhattan. The Staff was nice and helpful and quick to respond to my questions. They offered details about how to find things in the city too. The Room was as expected and comfortable.

Yes, in the middle of Manhattan, but the room standard could have been better. Perhaps what you get for the money spent. No view at all, room was sort of worn out, and very small. Polite and friendly staff, breakfast was ok.

Nice place. Great waitstaff. Very good breakfast. No bugs. Good proximity to an all-night CVS, a subway stop, and crosstown buses as well as uptown buses.Refrigerator, safe, TV, and iron were provided.Very pleasant and helpful concierge.Hotel take note: The room is well-lit but there was no direct light on the workspace so I was mostly working in my own shadow.

This hotel was conveniently located, inexpensive for NYC, and comfortable. We enjoyed our visit and would recommend it to friends and family. Free breakfast was very basic but good and appreciated for a simple start to the day.

the location was perfect for all the things we did on our short visit to NYC. right around the corner is Eataly and other restaurants and shos. also across the street on 6th ave, there is a kid-approved playground. which was great since we have an energetic toddler. We had a king room, it was small, but you can expect that in the city. like you walk in and bam the bed lol it was nice and clean. had no issues, the only recommendation maybe updates the breakfast options.. the eggs were kind of watery and you could tell it was an egg powder mix.. maybe invest in real eggs?but the management was very friendly.. i would book again next time i'm in the city. :)

I didn't expect a lot from this hotel however, the bed was a need. We did not sleep well all 3 days we stayed due to the beds being incredibly uncomfortable. I've never had a worse nights sleep. The location was fabulous and staff was friendly. They allowed us to leave our luggage prior to check in so that was a big plus. Room was quite small but doable for the 3 of us. Breakfast area was so small we were only able to eat there 1 day due to being so over crowded. Slow elevator. Overall, ok stay.

Room was small but clean. Could barely move around. Four people in the room. The elevator took forever. Breakfast was ok, but not much selection. The location was great! Staff was nice and helpful. Will probably not stay there again though! Almost forgot...there is a small pizza shop across the way with excellent $2.99 pizza!

Room was ok for the first week but not large, location was good, staff in breakfast room not friendly at all, like you are doing a prison sentence. Came back to New York to spend our last night, room was ridiculously very small, could not get suitcase in.couple of people nice at reception but that's it, it's just location.Christina was excellent she made us happy.

Note: I did not go into this hotel expecting all the bells and whistles at a 5-star hotel. Room was small big bed was king sized. Fit the luggage we had. Great. It was complimentary WiFi and it was fast! So we were happy with that. Complimentary breakfast - we came at 9:40, towards the end of the 7-10am times and still a lot of food was out. Not too crowded. Had your basic selections: eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, bagels, muffins, cinnamon rolls, cereal and some others. Very generous for it to be free- did not expect that from such a cheaper hotel. Got a great deal for basically $100 a night, so it had everything we needed and more. We didn’t need anything too fancy since we would be out of the hotel most of the time. Beds were comfy and A/C worked fine. The only issue is that there were signs up about water being out the next day from 10pm to 6am, which seems super inconvenient. Otherwise, great stay.

Older hotel and a bit run down. A really small room and even smaller (slower) elevators. Bathroom was the size of a closet. Staff was friendly enough. Short on amenities. Drink machine had a sign that said "no water" and the breakfast dining area was so crowded, I skipped the free breakfast. Think they should change the main photo on their web site to an image of the actual hotel, rather than featuring the nearby Flatiron Building. Would not stay there again, and certainly not for that price ($450 a night for a weeknight).

Stayed here for two nights at the end of a USA visit to see family. Booked a room with two queen beds which is supposed to be for 4 adults but the room was so small the two beds had to be pushed together to get into the room with our suitcases! Our party size had changed so although this helped as the room was so small, this was a very expensive room for two people! The bathroom too was small and there wasn’t enough space for our suitcases as floor space was a bare minimum. Breakfast was included in the price. The food selection was ok with a variety of cooked and fresh options including fresh waffles you make yourself. What let the breakfast experience down was the paper plates and plastic cutlery! They also made sure you cleared your table too so no table service at all! The hotel is within walking distance to The Empire State Building and Times Square and just a stones throw from the Flat Iron building.

Room, clean bed are good.Nice shower.Airco.Breakfast good.not enough space in dinningroom.All kind of choices for breakfast.Simple evenig dinner would be nice.Interieur renewing would me nice not a must.

Very pleased with the stay at Heritage Hotel. The best part was the view from our window, where we could see Empire state building.The breakfast was very good. But there could have been one more toaster, since there always was alot of people in line for that.Nice and friendly staff. There was coming water out from the bathtub but they where very fast with fixing the problem. I would love to stay there again next time I go to New York.

Location is fine, hotel crew is nice. It's an old building, well conserved, appearance not so great. Installations are ok, nice front space, with business office, breakfast area, free newspaper, vending machine. Breakfast is poor and the area is tight, usually gets crowded. Rooms are small and sometimes (like in may case) you can get a neighbour who gets in the middle of the night and slams the door and starts talking loud or watching TV inconveniently. Elevators are a problem, very slow.

Stayed in Heritage for work. First night room had no closet (unheard of and totally unsuitable for business trip). WiFi didn’t work, TV remote didn’t work. No bedside light. Complained but they couldn’t change my room till next night. WiFi never worked satisfactorily thereafter. Hallway carpets extremely tired and grim. Breakfast was paper plates and plastic cutlery and v basic food. All in all, poor. Yet still over $250 a night. A shocker. Emails in reply to management’s own emails asking for feedback went unanswered. On plus side: staff nice and apologetic, bed comfy, location good.

My family of 4 stayed for 4 nights and had a good time during the day. If you rest well you enjoyed your days. The breakfast was covert good as well. The only thing is to provide drinking water during the day. They only provide water during breakfast. Thanks for my memories.

The hotel presents some basic standards of cleaning, at least for the visible parts. Rooms are rather large, beds are old, but comfortable. Breakfast is basic, but you find everything (toasts, waffels, eggs, fuits...), It may happen that the maintenance fails somewhere, the AC filters are full of dust, infrstructure is not new, staff are not always kind. But at the end of the days that's what you get for a double room at 300 boxes a day in Manhattan mid town.

I stayed for a Saturday night at the Heritage. Good location within walking distance of Penn Station (I arrived in town by Amtrak). Bed was very comfortable and I had a good nights sleep. Bathroom was nice with newer fixtures, floor was wood. Room had one queen bed, a dresser and not much room for anything else. The a/c unit was mounted under the window and worked well. Breakfast is included which is nice. Would stay here again. Easy luggage storage for early arrival or leaving your bag for pickup later on day of departure.

It was my first stay in NYC and I´ve heard about the troubles finding a good hotell at a fair price. So we booked the Heritage based on location, breakfast and price.Pros: Clean room of good size, bed really good, breakfast good by US standards. Location is very good with only a few steps to the subway, and its even walkable from Penn station!Cons: Stairways and corridors in desperate need of refurbishment! And the lights! Cheapest possible LED:s makes everything look like a police station or operation room! Security!? Felt as the desk had no control of people going in and out of the hotel. And the coffe was of the weakest US kind! We bought nescafe at the store to improve things, and we saw people bringing Starbucks coffe to the breakfast.But to sum things up, the cons are acceptable and the total experience was nice.

We had the perfect room 1104 with a splendid view on the Empire State Building. Every evening different colors on top of the building and every round hour an exciting lightshow. We love the lady that booked this room for us!
