I chose this hotel for its location and the fact that it included the breakfast. The room was small but had what's needed, the bed was big and comfy. Room for improvement, the TV reads pictures from a pendrive but no videos. I think this is a must nowadays! Still, it was a big screen so if you just want to watch local TV, they have you covered.The internet works fine, it proved a bit slow for Skype calls but still enough for work.The staff was very friendly in general, only with the exception of a man working on night shifts who was a bit rude.They charged us 2$ for holding a couple of bags during the last day, is the first time they charge me for this kind of service and I spend 25% of my time in hotels, but mainly in Europe/latam, so could be a US thing...The breakfast is good with good cold juice, not the typical juice full of added sugar in other places! Waffle maker, great! And... FREE COFFEE 24/7!!

Expend 5 nights at this hotel. Very good location. Expensive price but in the line of the same quality hotels in New York but with the plus that includes breakfast. Breakfast is good with cereal, toast, donuts, muffins and a waffle maker which is really good. Very important as well is that they offer coffee/tea 24 hours free of charge and you have your own coffee machine in your room too.My room was small and the view not nice but the bathroom is very clean and refurbished recently.Overall very good for New York and happy that includes breakfast.

This is a good value for the money. The room is small, but well laid out. The elevator is slow, but at least there is one for lugging suitcases. We took the stairs when not with our suitcases. Close to Madison Square Park and Eataly.

Staff were friendly and accommodating. Clean rooms and CR. I think the room I had is just renovated. It is the lowest price hotel at mid Manhattan. Knowing the location, it's the best to stay considering price. I just walked from Time square going to the hotel. Thank you for all the staff.Alex

I have just returned home to Las Vegas from a week in New York. Again, I stayed at the Heritage Hotel. This hotel is perfect for me. It puts me a block away from the iconic Flatiron building and all the interesting places around it. Great restaurants and shops. There are Subway stops on 23rd that will take you anywhere. The hotel staff are so professional. The front desk personal were so courteous and helpful. The maids did a good job on my room every day. Each morning I would go down to the free breakfast and have coffee and cereal. I would use the WiFi and my iPhone to check the weather and see what I should wear that day. So useful. I was in the hotel and casino business for a long time. I will be back. I like the way they do things here.

Me and my daughter had a great time, the staff on the front dest were always very helpful, breakfast was very good all you need for a good start for your day, hotel is nicely situated to get around the city, and sub stations are close by, would definitely recommend the Heritage Hotel

I’ve been several times to New York and I always find it difficult to write a decent review of any hotel I’ve stayed in. In any other city in the world, this hotel would be considered a nightmare. Sure, location is great and for NYC, prices are rather low. But let’s be clear that what you’ll get for that money, is a very old, outdated, sloppy, extremely small room. Add to that: noisy AC, windows that would not open, terrible breakfast (both in terms of choice and quality), awful WiFi connection, staff at the reception often unfriendly (the lady who welcomed us when we arrived was nice, but all the others were quite rudd). I am planning to go back to NYC in a few months and I surely won’t be back at this hotel.

Lovely budget hotel,clean,fantastic and helpful staff. Room lacked hanging space but great shower, very comfy big bed. Basic breakfast. Great position between uptown and downtown Manhattan. Would definitely recommend and use again.
user_name:
Carol D
Frome, England, United Kingdom

review_body: We had a quick overnight trip to NYC, and this hotel was in walking distance of all the places we were going to be visiting. I will say for this annual trip, we typically stay at the Radisson Martinique on Broadway, which is quite lovely. The Heritage is no Radisson, but if you are looking for a clean, comfortable room, this definitely will fit the bill. We had two rooms for our group, and both had comfortable beds and very nice showers with great water pressure. The rooms could use some color and updated furniture, and of course as with most NYC rooms, there's not a lot of room to move around, but if you are using the room just to sleep, it's quite nice. Having the fridge in the room is a nice touch (for storing medication.) Front desk staff was nice; we had no issues at all. You should note that the hotel is not ADA compliant, and there was not a smoke detector in one of our rooms (didn't check the other) but you can request a portable smoke detector at the front desk. The hallways were pretty dirty (needed a good vacuuming), but the rooms themselves were clean. All in all, a pleasant stay for an overnight trip.

Quirky is the word I would use for this hotel, but in a good way. The hotel is not fancy, but it is clean and comfortable. It is clearly an older building, hence its "quirkiness", which gives it character. The elevators are a little slow at times, but I did not find this extremely problematic. The location is great. The hotel is situated on a slightly quieter street just off of Broadway but close enough to access plenty of shops, restaurants, and more. My friend and I found a great little wine bar just a couple of blocks away and it is a very short distance to the Madison Square park, a nice little place to sit and people watch, eat outdoors, or whatever. The breakfast was pretty typical of a free hotel breakfast - again, nothing fancy but definitely adequate. Overall, Heritage Hotel met my expectations. The price seemed right for the location and I would stay there again.

Lets start with the end - Heritage hotel is a good hotel.The bad - Small rooms (a common problem in NYC), the shower pressure is a bit low and the elevator..well its slow.The good - The location is amazing, at the middle of everything near the major sites and subways.The bed was very comfortable (important because in NYC you're gonna walk alot)The breakfast is really nice and offers a lot and the stuff was very nice!

room was very clean staff very helpful wifi big problem losing connection stairways very dirty. Gave over 48 hour notice to cancel last nite of 4 nite stay and was told no refunds. Kind of left bad feelings after such a notice.

Very nice newly renovated rooms. Aircondition a bit hard to adjust.Rooms are clean. Towers changed every day. (No need for that)Breakfast Much better Than average Staff is Very nice and polite and especially Christina- I love her. She was Very helpfull and so sweet. Elevator is Very slow but working. It's faster to take the stairs .. at least down. Even from 11th Ooh, there is free coffe 24/7 and it is the Best in town.Breakfast room a bit crowded due to Very big furnitures but it works.I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Stayed for 6 nights

The bedroom in general, and the bathroom in particular were too much smaller tan expected, as per the photos at the website.The room service and breakfast were quite good, in general terms. The facilities and rooms are pretty clean

Excellent customer service, room is clean and nice food.The staff are all helpful, good location will stay there again,we really have a good time and not too expensive ,heritage hotel is close to many attractions.

I visited NYC from the Midwest and was so happy I chose this hotel. It was clean, the staff was friendly, the bed was soft, and the hotel was quiet. I was a little nervous about staying at a hotel in NYC with all the noise and people, but this room was like an oasis where I was able to sleep like a baby and rest up for hours of walking, eating, and drinking. Will be coming back next year!

Location was excellent close to the Flatiron Building, very dated, needs an update. Elevators were very slow. Breakfast was okay it was nice to save some money on coffee and breakfast. Don't forget to ask about the parking discount,

The staff at the front desk are very nice and helpful! Really appreciate the special rate offered by the hotel so that we could park our car at a much lower price. Although the room is not very spacious, it's clean and well-furnished.
user_name:
stellaob
New York City, New York

review_body: Comfortable reasonably priced hotel in a great position in midtown Manhattan. Restaurants, subway & Empire State building in easy walking distance. Great value for money with a basic but ok breakfast included .

Small hotel but great location. Most of the rooms are small, but clean and recently remodeled. The beds are the most comfortable EVER. Pretty quiet street for New York City, nice breakfast, nice staff... Good value for money!

Wish I could give zero stars. Loud construction at 8am on a Saturday. Even after asking the front desk to ask them to stop, it kept going. Never would have stayed here if I knew this would happen. That's $500 down the drain. The hotel is very basic, and all I wanted was a place to sleep, and apparently I can't even get that.

I stayed here for 5 nights with my teenage daughter. We found the staff very helpful and courteous. The breakfast which was included was very satisfying - muffins, bagels, pastries, eggs, sausages, fruit, cereal, juice, tea, waffles. We found the room quite small. We had 2 single beds and there was hardly any space to put the suitcases and and to walk around. The fan in the bathroom was also noisy. The price was a little expensive for the room however this is New York City in the summer unfortunately. We loved the location. It is central to everything. 23rd st station is just a couple of minutes away. Times Square about 20 minutes walk uptown and 20- 30 mins downtown you can get to Union Square and Soho and more - depending on how many stops you take on the way :) It is right near the iconic Flatiron Building and Eataly. Chelsea markets are not far and Madison Square Park Markets are across the main street of Broadway and Fifth Ave. There is a great souvenir shop very close. Plenty of cafes, restaurants, pizza, pharmacy, supermarket - all near by. Really enjoyed our stay there.

Great location,close proximity to Penn Station and the subway, clean rooms, and excellent breakfast buffet (free). Front desk was very helpful and professional. Upper floors were newly renovated and well done.

Stayed here for business in NYC from Australia.Really well situated - the free all day coffee and tea in the foyer is a nice touch.All the staff are great - especially Larry & Razia - who were very helpful. Larry, you need to come to Australia so you can spend your $10 aussie! Also Jesina was very helpful when checking out.The building has a great history - and they're renovating it floor by floor. Will be good to see that develop further!Highly recommended.

We were here on vacation! Awesome experience! Christina was amazing at the front desk as she was kind and very helpful with directions and answers to questions. The room was recently redecorated and had everything we needed. No noise, clean and comfortable bed. Will definitely stay here again if we come back to NYC!

I stayed at the Heritage Hotel in the first week of June with my two teenage daughters. To give you an idea of the location, the hotel is located around the corner from the Flatiron building and the lovely Madison Square Park, and from the entrance of the hotel you can see the Empire State Building. The room was big enough for us all, with a great shower and plenty of towels. We also had WiFi in the room an airconditioning unit, a fridge, TV and coffee maker. The beds were made every day. In the morning we had our breakfast in the hotel - plenty of choice from eggs and bacon to waffles, doughnuts, cereals, fruit and juices. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, there was always someone there for questions and advice. The manager (i assume) was also around in the mornings in case you had any questions. On the final day we could leave our bags in the hotel ($1 per bag) which was great as we had 6 hours to kill before heading out to the airport. There was some renovation going on in the hotel (5th floor) but as we stayed ont he 10th floor it wasn't a a factor for us. Overal, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Heritage Hotel - you can't beat the price given where you are. I will definitely be back!

We stayed here from 14th May till 16th May, family of 4. The best thing about this hotel is its excellent location, very close to 23rd street metro which connects you to all the major locations in and around NY. 24 hr Tea/Coffee machine at the lobby machine is really convenient, check in & check out is really quick & the staff is very quick & helpful with information. Breakfast is basic but sufficient to start the day, there are lots of eateries around. The best is the chinese restaurant attached to the hotel itself, its nice, tasty & cost effective. The only disadvantage about this hotel is the room size! The rooms are really small & the family members have to really adjust if you spend more time inside the room. There is hardly any space after keeping the luggage bags! Location wise this place is perfect if you are a tourist & need to stay in th eheart of NY!

Stayed here on Memorial Day weekend. The best thing about this hotel is the Location! It is old & dated. One of the lamps in our room did not work; the closet door barely closed & the elevator was so old it was extremely slow!The front desk staff was not very friendly or helpful. The concierge was never available. The free breakfast was average...at best! It is across from Madison Park & Flatron Building. I see many other hotels in this neighborhood that were the same price but were much nicer (I went to ck them out).

I have just returned to Las Vegas from my trip to New York. I stayed at the Heritage Hotel again. I have been involved in the Hotel and Casino business for a long, long time. I know a good operation when I see it and this is a well run Hotel. My room was clean and everything worked. I see there a doing some renovation here and it looks like it is going well. The staff are so well trained. All do their jobs and do right. Front desk people are so courteous and helpful. The maids do a good job. My room was always clean and ready for me. Every morning I go down to the breakfast room and using the hotel WiFi I check the weather and all my mail etc. The free breakfast is a delight. A great way for me to start my day.The location of this hotel is so perfect for me. Out the door and to the right and your at the Flatiron building area. Lots of restaurants and things to do. You can take the subway here and go anywhere in the city. Out the door and to the left and down to 6th ave. At 23rd there are more subway entrances. You can go downtown to the Village or Wall street or anywhere. But I love to walk, so sometimes I go west to Chelsea or east to the river. Or up to 34th and the Empire State building at 34th. Or go up to 42 and Times square. I love walking down to Union Square and watch all the people there. No other place like it.At my age, I’m 81 now I go slow but the magic of NY keeps me going. Again I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Mr. Rehman can be proud of what he has done here.

Due to an overbooking problem with the hotel I booked on a famous on line website I had to spend two night in the Heritage Hotel. The first one was a nighmare: the room was extremely cold (10/12 C°) so I had to sleep dressed with my coat, meanwhile the fan coil in the room made noise as an airplane. The breakfast was horrible and, for only 20$, they offer us marmelade and butter already opened!Keep away!

Heritaget Hotel is just in the right spot: easy access to the metro and walking distance to many of the "must sees". Staff in reception were helpful and very kind. I would like to name Christina, who had the right words for us every time we stopped by: she gave us directions, she asked how my mother was doing (my mother's luggage was lost and it was a stressful situation for her), she really seemed to care. Thank you, Christina! Breakfast was traditional, the restaurant clean and staff friendly and efficient. The room we had was small, but as a tourist, how much room do you need?!! I would certainely stay here again if I go to New York.

I just stayed at the Heritage Hotel this week. I was in NYC for a conference and booked it at the last minute, since the price was reasonable and it was close to the conference venue. I figured -- it's one night, how bad could it be? Mistake!The hotel is very rundown. There are 10 floors and there was one elevator that took forever to arrive once summoned. All of the carpeting was dirty and ancient-looking. The bedspread immediately went on the floor because it looked dirty. The icing on the cake, though, was my shower experience in the morning. When I went into the shower and got the water going, the entire faucet came flying out of the wall, and I was left with a metal pipe spilling water into the tub. I've stayed in a lot of hotels, but this was the worst experience I've ever had.

We stayed at The Heritage Hotel in December last year as part of my 60th birthday present. The room was not large but more than suited our needs, was comfortable and clean. We backed onto the rear of another building so no view at all but we were only in the room to sleep.The location of the hotel was fantastic, just round the corner from the Flat iron building, close to a large range of shops and restaurants and at the junction with 5th Avenue so easy access to all the sites and amenities. The only downside was breakfast - the food offered was adequate and filling BUT and this is a big BUT, paper plates and plastic cutlery NO thank you. We only had breakfast one morning because of this, oh and polystyrene cups yuk!! Despite this we did have a pleasant stay at the Heritage.

We arrived before the check-in time at 10 am .. The room was available at 11 am .. The room is spacious .. Of the spacious room in Manhattan .. it was clean .. Everything you need is available .. The location of the hotel is good and close to everything .. worth the price we paid . Will come again

I don't know why some people got upset about this hotel but my family did have very good experience. The location is amazing, right next to 5th Avn, Broadway Avn and subway station. We literally could walk to Empire Building or Broadway theatres. Breakfast was okay. Even though there wasn't much choice but was enough to fill the stomach. The size of the room wasn't as small as a hole. This is a golden area in Manhattan, so you can't expect a large room at all. Hotel staff were quite helpful! We unfortunately encountered the storm and traffic was a mess, but thanks to them we got a cab in advance to the airport. Anyway, the money we spent was well paid off. I would consider staying here again when I come to NYC next time.

Great location, 5 mins from gridiron building and subway, 10 mins from Empire State Building, the reception staff couldn't do enough for you but, the room was very small, it did have a double bed but not much room for anything else, I could use the desk chair, no wardrobe so couldn't hang any clothes up. Breakfast left a lot to be desired. They are starting but definitely, definitely in need of a renovation

Selected this hotel for location ( excellent) and availability on a Saturday night in December. I expected a small room in Manhattan but literally couldn’t fit 4 adults standing in the room. That was amusing but not a problem. The hotel and rooms were rundown and dingy. Didn’t want to sit on the bed or couch in the lobby. Didn’t even consider the breakfast in the am as I wouldn’t have wanted to eat in this hotel. Can you give 0 stars??

Stayed at the Heritage hotel in early December. Great value and close to everything. We came to NYC for dinner and a show and to do Christmas siteseeing. Rooms were clean and staff was great. Free breakfast included which was convenient. Read some other reviews stating that the rooms were small. What do you expect in NYC for these prices? Just enough room and the beds are super comfortable.

I don't write reviews often because of my busy schedule. That being said, when I do it is because it was worth it. I really enjoyed my stay here, my family was visiting and wanted to really get a true perspective of NYC and what it had to offer. We booked a weekend at the Heritage Hotel and had a delightful experience. The environment was safe, clean and most importantly attentive to all our needs. Much appreciated this is a true gem. Recommended to anyone.
user_name:
Afb91
San Sebastián, Pais Vasco, Spain

review_body: If I could give 0 stars I would. From when we first arrived we noticed our room looked NOTHING like the photos online, we had no toilet paper, and our heat was blowing out cold air. After returning to our room we were relaxing and noticed a BED BUG crawling on the bed and also another one on my bag. I called the front desk ASAP. The gentleman who spoke no English came up to my room and squashed the bed bug on my bag with his fingernail and walked right out of the room. Afterwards, we were not comfortable sleeping in the room. We lifted up both mattresses got our flashlights and scoped around every nook of the room looking for more bed bugs. After going downstairs to talk to management I was basically called a liar and he said I was saying this to get my money back and that I needed evidence. The only evidence I had was the excess skin of the bed bug that lived until the gentleman’s fingernail. The end result is this.. they did NOTHING about my issue to reassure me that any other room would be clean enough to spend the night. At 1230am we decided to take the 2.5 hour ride home and lost over $300. HORRIBLE STAFF, HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, DIRTY BED BUG INFESTED ROOMS!

A 2 star hotel, very frequented because of its good location and for Manhatten moderate prices.The room we had for two nights (150€/night in Dec.) was very cramped, there was no place to open the suitcase except on the bed. The heating came from the ac, it was blowing warm air in the room and was very loud. The bathroom had no heating at all, it was cold, so you had to leave the door to the room open to heat it.The bed was kingsize and very comfortable, a nice tv was there too.Breakfast was very basic, you might want to go and get a nice breakfast someplace else.Fazit: It is okay for one or 2 nights, is located near several subways stations and lots of attractions are within walking distance.

We stayed here for two nights in October. It's a nice hotel with 'older' style rooms and is clean and safe. Reception staff are friendly and helpful and - the big plus - there is a free breakfast including several hot selections. When we stayed the hotel had a lot of seniors as guests so you there's no wild parties! The hotel is an inexpensive taxi ride from Penn Station and is a good central point for sightseeing.

On the upside it’s a block from Eataly. And the ceiling in the lobby is pretty. The front desk guy, who was very nice, apologized that we were getting a “smaller room” due to our late check in. Thank God we had a quick one night stay ....... terribly outdated, old, shabby place. Location was why we picked it. Room was so small there we really didn’t have a spot to put luggage. If you just want a place to lay your head it will work. Otherwise....no

Stayed here in mid November for a few days. It was FREEZING!If you're coming from JFK it's better to get the Airtrain and then use the LIRR to Penn Station - think it costs around $15 ish in total but it gets you there in the fastest way possible and without the hassle of having to swap trains on the tube. From Penn Station it's around a 10 minute walk. Easily done.Check in was swift, the girls behind the desk were lovely and chatty. The reception area also has unlimited free coffee throughout the day, always a bonus. Theres also an ATM, drinks machine and a tiny gym. Not bad at all.We were on the 11th floor though the view is nothing spectacular - what is spectacular is the ridiculous time it takes the elevator to climb 11 floors. Slowest one i've ever been in in my life! The rooms themselves are of average size, but comfortable for two people - coffee facilities, iron, TV (with actually some good channels on!), small bathroom but with decent shower. All very standard but clean and tidy and the beds were comfortable. The walls are thin and so if you're a light sleeper you can hear people coming and going, particularly because the rooms are so close together. The doors also tend to slam shut rather than close gently so early risers tend to wake you up as they leave.Breakfast was included which was downstairs just off reception - the standard offering was on display, eggs, sausages, cereal, pastries etc - the sausages in particular were very nice. Not the worst, not the best but not bad to start your day. The room is reasonably sized too so it's never too cramped.Overall a lovely stay and i'd have no hesitation returning to Heritage if I was in NYC again.A few extras:- You can store your bag(s) for $1 per bag - I'm surprised this is the first time I've come across a charge but its perfectly acceptable, particularly because its done properly in a locked room and with a ticket system so you're bag is secure.- I didn't try the Chinese takeaway next door but the '2Bros' at the end of the street has excellent pizza when you roll in after a few drinks.- The Flat Iron building is literally around the corner - turn right out of the hotel and right at the end of the street and you can't miss it.- You can walk to either end of Manhattan in around 45-60 minutes. - if you can arrange it it's worth doing the day trip to Washington DC - takes around 3-4hrs each way on a coach but the tour guide is full of info and DC itself is a gem. Its served as a taster but It's so worth it and it'll make you want to return.

So, we stayed at this hotel last week (5 nights) 13 - 18 Nov 17. We were pleasantly surprised after reading some previous reviews that it is very nice. It is quite old but modernized. Our room on the 10th floor had a very comfortable king size bed, an adequate bathroom and a wardrobe and dresser. When I noticed after a day that the fridge wasn't working a very efficient maintenance man immediately replaced it with a new one. Breakfast was OK, the price was right! (included). I must say that the staff are all wonderful, particularly the young lady working the evening shift every night of our stay. she had the answer for every question.The only small thing I could mention is that the elevators (2) are quite slow but that is understandable considering their age.The price we paid was very competitive even much lower that neighboring properties (Holiday Inn Express). And, the hotel is well located both to the metro and lots of restaurants. All in all a very nice central location for a city vivit.

It's a good budget hotel in a great location.The room was quiet enough even if somewhat small and without closet.Staff is kind but could improve, continental breakfast plentiful and good.It could get crowded in some instances (i.e. NYC Marathon), but it's certainly a great option in the City.

This is an older hotel with modest updates. It's in a great location just steps away from Flatiron, close to eateries, a park, and the subway. The lobby is modest but clean and comfortable. Two small elevators are available. Ice is available just outside the elevators. There a large room where the continental breakfast is served. We ate there one morning. The offerings were varied enough that most folks could find something they liked.My sister and I chose a room with 2 twin beds. When you walk into the room, there's a small refrigerator, safe, and coffee pot to the left. There was a closet with an ironing board and iron. We had enough room at the end of one of the beds to use it. The bathroom was good size with sink, toilet, and tub with shower. There was plenty of hot water with a good spray. We had a window that looked out to the other side of the hotel. There was a dresser with I believe 4 nice size drawers. The television was mounted. The picture quality was good with a fair number of channels to choose from. The mattresses were quite comfortable. There were enough pillows and blanket coverings for comfort. The pillows were full and comfortable. Each day our room was cleaned well, beds made, and fresh towels left. The staff was courteous and helpful. We stored our luggage without cost while awaiting our room to be prepared. We paid $1/bag for storage after checkout. The price of the room was affordable by NYC standards. We'll definitely consider staying here again.

Rooms are small, old and dark. Hotel profits from a great location, half a block away from Madison Square Park.Breakfast was a very pleasant surprise, but overall I wouldn't recommend this for other reason than the one I had, was the last decent priced hotel in a very crowded week.

Well, I am 80 years old and did return to NY and this hotel. I came in from Las Vegas where many years ago I was in the Hotel and Casino business. I enjoyed the stay. I was here for 8 days. This Hotel is well run. The room was clean and everything worked. I loved going down to the free breakfast they serve here. Good selection and the coffee is just right. I started each day with checking out the weather on my iPhone. They have WiFi throughout the hotel. The front desk personnel are very polite and helpful. I found the staff and the maids to all be very good at what they do.This location is so right for me. Out the door and to the right and you are at the Flatiron building and all the restaurants nearby. A great area. The 23rd street subway is right there to take you downtown or uptown. Uptown to 34th or up to Central Park or down town to the Village or Wall street. Sometimes I walk over to Lexington Ave. and take the subway there. Out the door and to the left and to 6th Ave. and the subway is right there. I like to walk 23rd over to the Chelsea area, very interesting and changing area. Mr. Rehman can be proud of his staff and how this hotel is run. Well done.

The room was a good place to lay down and relax, they had a tv, a cute bathroom, Location was ideal, walking distance to everything to where we wanted to be, there was a small food area court with a lot of different types of Asian food nearby, Close to the flatiron building. There is also a rooftop bar nearby. Everything was good and we were happy with our for a few nights.

The hotel was old and in need of some updates. The room I had was very small. Pretty much just a bed and a tiny tiny bathroom. Not uncommon in NYC though. I'm sure they have bigger rooms so if I were to come with my family I would want something bigger. It worked just fine for just myself. The staff was fantastic. Very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic though. Close to so many great restaurants and bars. There is a walgreens right down the street too which came in handy. I was in town the same week as the UN summit so hotel rooms were really pricey. This one showed up with a great rate so I jumped on it. It might not be my first choice but based on price and location I would stay here again.

We booked on booking.com as it was deal of the day and I can say I was perfectly happy with my stay. We were in room 908 and although the room was fairly small it was big enough for 2 of us! Bed was comfy, the whole room was cleaned well every day and the rooms were fairly quiet. The location was good within walking distance of the Empire State and Times Square. My only complaints would be the hair dryer didn't work (Not a big issue) and the toilet blocked multiple times (which seems to be a problem in the hotel). For the price I paid I was happy with my stay.

Our stay was for a concert at MSG. Everything was within walking distance. Food,shopping,and lots of fun! The hotel has great customer service, Neepa at the front desk was very attentive and professional. Although the rooms were on the small side, the free Wifi/breakfast were a plus. Definitely would stay there again!

DO NOT BOOK AT THIS HOTEL. I have stayed at hotels all across the world, and this is the absolute worst by far. Within 5 minutes of sitting in the room, we saw a mouse run across. We called management immediately, who sent someone up to check into it. They acted very non chalant as if this was very routine call for them to get. I have looked at other reviews which also mentions rodents being found in the room - you can waste your time digging through those reviews or just stop reading this now and book ANYWHERE else. Person at the front desk joked and said maybe the mouse was on the luggage...In fact this is the attitude of everyone there...Deny Deny Deny...They know they have many issues and fail to acknowledge any of them. We asked to be switched into another room, which they managed to do. The toilet overflowed upon first use with poop all over the floor. Again we called and same person came up with same attitude as if this is very routine business. My wife used the bathroom and the toilet paper holder fell onto her foot and cut it. The wifi in the room was nearly non existent, very bad connection. The breakfast was empty, we had to tell them to take the food out of the kitchen and actually put it out so people can eat it. We witnessed someone trip and fall due to the breakfast floor being wet, they were in extreme pain....floor should have been dried off if staff were actually paying attention to the breakfast area. I tried to get in touch with the manager the same night, and manager was not available. I then tried to get in touch for the next 3 days and left messages for manager to call me back...Never got called back. Final message we left was call back by 5pm before we take this up with our credit card company and leave a negative review on trip advisor. We later got a call from the manager (who we were told previously was not available that day). Manager told us he could give us 10% back, a complete joke for ruining our trip to new york city. He stated that we had left a negative review on trip advisor already, which was not true. I got on trip advisor and found that someone else also found a mouse in their room the same time I was staying there, he must have thought that was me!! I tried to get info for the hotel owner, but the general manager and all staff would not give that info. This is the first negative review I have left on trip advisor and I have stayed in many hotels across the world. I am a level headed humble physician with average expectations, and when I say "stay away" please trust me. Me and my wife were lied to by staff and the general manager several times in trying to resolve this matter. I have plenty of money and can drop thousands on hotels. I booked this hotel at the last minute and it was the only one nearby which was available. Offering me 10% off is insulting for such negligence, mismanagement, deception, and lies. I used to live in new york city for several years and am appalled by this behavior. Owner of the hotel if you are reading this, share your contact info and me, my wife, and our friends will give you full details of our visit. This is info I would want to know if it were my hotel, so I could correct it. I got out of this hotel as soon as possible and booked at the Wyndham Tryp hotel which was a great experience, typical of many hotels in NYC.

We were horrified to watch the recptioniet laugh as we told him there was a mouse in the family room. Was disappointed there was no baby facility for the family room and the dirty bedding was out behind the tv. Other than that the breakfast had a good variety of options and area was kept clean. It was a good location.

Great place to stay. Price was ok, situated in the heart of the city, Perfectly placed for easy sight seeing, most places within walking distances. Not overly large rooms but very comfortable and clean. Own bathroom.
user_name:
Tania S
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent a week here and was very satisfied. Price ok (for the area), maid service semi-ok (didn't show up everyday, but came when called), but best of all, was easy for playing tourist and having dozens of great eating places in easy walking distance (Also, Subway only a 4 minute walk). Great park 1/2 block away to hang out.

We have stayed at this hotel numerous amounts of times and the high quality of service and attention to detail remains the same. He staff is amazing, the rooms are comfortable and the environment is friendly!

I recently stayed at the Heritage Hotel during a business trip I had in NYC. I must say that it was one of the most pleasant stays that I have had in NYC in a long time. The staff was top notch and extremely helpful. The rooms were clean and tidy. And the location is unsurpassed.

The reality of this hotel does not correspond to what is advertised on the website. I agree with reviewer ELFullerton, this is a hostel not a hotel. To start with the positives. 1. Good location2. Comfy bed!3. Nice front desk staff. That was it. The negatives (top 3).1. Poky rooms that do not correspond to the website photos. Last decorated by the look of it circa 1978. 2. The smell. The breakfast room stank and we could not stay in there. Dreadful. Various unhealthy smells around the hotel, one gag-making smell on the 3rd floor that defies description. 3. Breakfast. The room is so small that it is uncomfortable and seems to constantly have a queue. In summary. Too expensive for a hostel but not a hotel. Bookers beware.

This hotel in a great location and it's surrounded by a ton of great restaurants. That being said, the quality and cleanliness or their rooms is questionable at best. This is the type of place you stay if you really don't care about the room at all. The kind of place that you expect to find bed bugs and old crunchy towels(even when they're clean). The price and location still make it arguably worth the stay if you're not going to be in the room much or if you're too drunk to notice.

Probably the worst ive ever been in. As soon as you enter into the hotel you realise how old and old fashion is everything. The hotel facilities make you laugh. There is one gym (if you can called it that way) which consists in two machines and a media room w/ two old computers. Everything is disgusting including the hotel staff who doesnt seem to give you attention. Therefore, they dont have any intention in helping you with anything you could need help with. I completely agree with one review which claims that this hotel is specialise in first ny visitors bc once you have been in this hotel you would never ever in your life come again. The hotel is overpriced and the photos doesnt even match with the dirtiness and foulness of the hotel. Even if you are considering to take this hote bc of the breakfast, dont do that bc you are not gonna eat anything at all. Everyday is the same breakfast consisting on bread, frozen sausages, disgusting scrambled eggs and a waffle machine. The breakfast room is always crowded and you cant even find a place to sit down. The room, matching with the rest of the hotel, is just totally unacceptable, it doesnt even match the standards of clealiness. The room is really really tiny, there arent even space for the suitcases to be placed. The furniture is huge and it doesnt have a meaning in the room, just huge old tables all over the room. The bathroom is the worst part of the room. It is covered in old wallpaper which is dropping, everything is full of hair and it smells like humidity and sweat. Totally disgusting. The wifi connection is almost impossible to use, its really slowly and disconnects continuosly. You cannot use it.The location isnt totally bad, despite doesnt having any underground stations close and been in a dark street full of homeless people. I would like to point out that the hotel knows exactly the rubbish they are offering, so the answers from the hotel in other reviews doesnt make sense

Booked this hotel having researched location, costs and trip adviser reviews. We booked a room for 4, the room was in the corner of floor 10, was dark, dingy with absolutely no space to even set a suitcase down. We spoke to reception and was promptly moved into a bigger room on floor 4 (the rooms are really dark, with barely any natural daylight coming in). The decor needs attention, carpets need replacing and the sofa in our room was stained. On the second morning we came up from breakfast to see a mouse in our room!! Reception sent up a maintenance guy to check the rodent situation out. After complaining we moved to an identical room on the floor above.Breakfast was buffet style in a room that is not big enough, on some mornings you wait 5-10 minutes to get a seat! The staff in the dining area are unfriendly. The breakfast is limited, with a slow restock of the pastries and fruit. In addition to this, the breakfast is served with paper plates and bowls and plastic (and really flimsy) cutlery that you cannot use adequately to butter your toast!! What hotel uses paper plates and plastic cutlery??The "Fitness Room" is a cupboard with a few dumbbells and a treadmill and my daughter was turfed out within 5 minutes as it doubles up as a suitcase storage, so she was unable to use it!!On a more positive note, the location is good, close to Penn Station and a Metro Station and easy walking distance to Times Square.I wouldn't recommend the Heritage Hotel.

I booked this hotel for 1 night through Book-it for $187.78 for 1 person in preparation for leaving the next day for an international flight. This hotel was very dirty, smelled of cigarettes all over the property. My room was at the very end of the hall. The mattress was filthy and I found 1 dead bug under the mattress pad. The pillows smelled terrible. I did not sleep all night and slept with the lights on. The desk staff was rude and not helpful at all. The check out time in the room stated that check out was 12:00 PM. At 11:00AM my phone rang and front desk asked me if I was ready to check out. I said I thought check out was at noon and I wasn't quite ready. She obviously didn't like it but finally said OK , no later than 12;00! At 11:45 AM , I went downstairs with my bags and checked out and asked concierge to call for a taxi for the airport. She told me to go outside and flag one down. "They're all over ". I went outside and started walking down the street with my suitcases and a taxi about a block away was dropping someone else off at another hotel and asked me if I needed a taxi and I said yes. And he took me to the airport. The room at the Heritage Hotel, was very noisy. You could see the light under the door and a little along the side of the door frame. When the person in the next room came and went, I jumped right out of my skin. The bathroom was extremely small. I couldn't dry my hair without hitting the wall with my arm. Last but not not least, before I left the hotel, I walked down to CVS and bought a can of Lysol to spray my cloths , suitcase, bc I couldn't stand the smell in my clothes, hair, nose, in everything. I actually vomited that morning. I never had s coffee or breakfast until after I got to the airport. The taxi driver who was so nice told me I should call , I believe it's 333. He said it's a hotline where you report Bad hotels. I was out of the country for almost 3 weeks and just got back. To think for $25.00 more I could've stayed where I really wanted to stay. The Redbury.

We arrived in NYC early and were lead to believe our rooms would be available at 1.30pm. One room was not ready for check in until 3.40pm. The managers that dealt with us were extremely unhelpful, and lacked basic courtesy and understanding. We encountered a problem with the card with which we had paid for the room with for the account had been closed since the booking. Since the account was no longer open, (even though the hotel had taken the money), the managers argued we could not stay and could not get our 188 dollars back. I explained the situation to the management multiple times and even went to the bank to get a letter stating it was me who paid for the hotel, but they still were not satisfied. The management rang my bank, on loud speaker in the main lobby on front of other guests, and discussed my bank history- asking the bank teller all of the questions they asked me. When I spoke to the bank teller the hotel management insisted i speak to her with the phone on loudspeaker so they could hear this conversation. They then forced me to go to the bank again to recieve my shredded bank card and bring it back to the hotel. I had been travelling for over 24 hours at this stage, and the management couldn't have cared less. I certainly will not be staying in this dump again, and I would advise any other travellers, especially students- to steer clear of this kip!!!!
user_name:
aoifeoconnell2012
New York City, New York

review_body: This place looked a lil sketchy to us after we arrived. Our room was on second floor w a view of a run down building with electric fence around. Yuk. The rooms are tiny and compact so small they put to trash can side by side as u open the door. Clean and comfy otherwise.ac worked well thats a plus. Free breakfast was a helpful thing to have. But the real downfall is the parking they have none. So they tell u to park in the i park garage and thats 65$ for an suv. Cars were cheaper i believe. They did give a sticker that we were able to get a discount for the parking. We Wouldn't stay there again.

Breakfast options very good, always fresh and always plenty of food whatever time you arrive for Breakfast. Rooms a little on the small side, we had a room with 3 single beds which were plenty big enough but room a little small to store clothing and luggage for 3 people. Great that we also had a fridge and tea/coffee making facilities.Hotel in great location, round the corner from the Flat Iron Building and sub-ways stops. Couldn't fault the location was very easy for getting about. Only downside was ticket seller in the foray had run out of tickets for tours etc so had to go and buy tickets else where. Chemist and supermarket at the end of block. Could see Empire State Building from our room as we was located on the front. Little noisy outside at night but what do you expect in a city that doesn't sleep, but not enough noise to stop you from getting to sleep. Would definately stop again. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would recommend the Chinese food cooked fresh while you wait was very nice.

Great location in the centre of Manhattan. The room was clean and tidy but on the small size. Beds were very comfy which is important. We stayed when it was very hot, luckily the aircon worked very well. The rooms have refrigerators which we found great. The front reception staff were very friendly and helpful but the breakfast room staff were very rude especially one particular man. Breakfast was adequate but a bit on the boring side.There is a chinese takeout next door which we used a couple of times during our stay. The food was reasonably priced and of a good quality.

I always stay at the Heritage each time I visit NYC. This past trip involved some awesome service I received on the phone from Jesenia a couple of days before my trip. I spoke to her on the phone and she was awesome to ensure my checkin would be easy. I met Jesenia the morning of June 7 last week. She greeted with within awonderfully warm welcome. She took care of my luggage and let me check into myroom early as she knew I needed to change for a 2pm matinee show on Broadway.Jesenia exudes professionalism and cares about her customers. She is an assetto your property. Having her there made my trip that much more enjoyable through her authentic conversation and her attention to detail. She is exceptional and top notch! I greatly appreciate her! SHE IS WOW! I will always stay here when I visit!

Really good location in the center of manhattan. Spacious rooms with free coffee and tea. Fast wifiSpecial thanks to personnel and especially receptionist Anna. She was really helpful and polite. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends

Booked the heritage online after thinking it looked good and was at a good price in a good location. The latter two were fairly true; a great location and an alright (I guess) price. Shame looks can be deceiving online!The welcome desk lady was very nice and welcoming to us weary Scottish travellers but that's where the staff contact ended. We didn't speak to or see any more staff till we checked out with the exception of the breakfast staff who were in and out constantly tidying up around us eating breakfast and weren't friendly or welcoming, and breakfast wasn't good or very well stocked up!The room was a corner room and although the door made it seem smaller than it was was an ok size. This being a NYC hotel and all! The bed was a good size and reasonably comfy to lie on. The room was tidy but nothing to shout home about! The TV whilst large had bad connection and some channels way louder than others making it not suitable to watch when you come back at night and just want to switch off! As a Brit I would've liked to have a duvet cover on my duvet, but that might be an American thing...! The bathroom was ok, basic and no more or less than required. Although the shower was confusing as you could only change from bath to shower mode one the water had started running. Nice place, don't think I'll be back in a hurry soon!

I was booking a couple of weeks before my trip, and it was the only centrally located hotel that still had twin rooms under $200 per night. I have to say that after reading a few horror stories about NYC hotels my expectations were very low. However everything was okay: the sheets were clean, the bathroom was clean, the furniture was dusted, there were no bedbugs. Wifi worked, the staff were pleasant, the breakfast was edible. The room had an iron and ironing board, a safe, a coffee maker and a tv; an old and loud AC worked. Location was great. However - the wallpaper, the doors and windows all were very tired and visibly dirty. Lots of wear and tear. The telephone was covered in grease. The juice at breakfast tasted like it was mixed with water. Overall as a place where you only come to shower and sleep it was okay.

I have just returned to Las Vegas from my NY trip. I spend a week at the Heritage hotel. I was very pleased. I have been staying at this hotel for many times. Many years ago I was in the Hotel & Casino business here in Las Vegas. So I know when a hotel is well run and this place is. The front desk people are very helpful. Answered all my questions and got whatever I needed. The room was well set up, very clean and everything worked. The bed was just right for me. There is WiFi in the room and throughout the hotel. Each morning I go down for the breakfast that is well presented and has a nice selection. I use the WiFi to check the weather and see what I should wear that day.The hotel location is a plus for me. Out the door and to the right and you are at the famous Flatiron building area. Lots of interesting things to do and many places to eat. Madison Square Park and Shake Shack are right there. At 23rd and Lexington is a subway to take you up or downtown. Out the door and to the left and you are at 6th ave. And another subway entrance. Or walk 23rd over to the Chelsea area. An area going through a transformation. So, from this hotel I can quickly get anywhere in NY.The hotel manager, Zahid Rehman is always around, he knows this hotel inside and out. I appreciate how well he runs this place. His selection of staff is excellent. I turned 80 years old this trip and if I can make here again, this is where I will stay.

The location of this hotel was ideal for us as we wanted somewhere near midtown for ease of access uptown and downtown. There are several subway stations a short walk away, and the view of the Empire State Building was a bonus. However, as we had booked for Springtime, prices per room per night had rocketed and therefore we had expected something more than basic. But it was very basic. The wifi signal was appalling which made planning our week difficult. The hotel staff were mostly pleasant but not particularly helpful when we asked for advice on what we thought would be simple questions e.g. directions. The concierge was rude and we felt like we were inconveniencing them to arrange our airport shuttle (which was paid for in advance so they only had to book our time for us) and to store our luggage (which you have to pay for per bag). Breakfast was very samey and not much variety, but there was access to coffee and hot drinks in the lobby 24 hours which was a nice addition.Overall thoughts - we would stay there again but only if the cost was drastically reduced to suit.

This hotel is basic yet clean and great for a few days in New York. The room was small but not cramped. As it was freezing outside we used the heater a lot in the room which was fine. Perfect for getting yourself ready and sleeping as that's all we needed the room for. Breakfast was decent, had a good enough selection and free coffee available all day. Only 2 negatives was the paper plates at breakfast, and the noise we could hear at night time from other guests going into their rooms. Walls were thin so could hear a lot however, it wasn't bad enough to keep you awake all night. Location is the best thing about this hotel as you can walk to a fair few landmarks/places. Times square is about a 15 minute walk or you can catch the underground at the end of the street.

This place has an excellent location! Close to all major sights, shops, subway, etc. The receptionist was very kind when we checked in with our three kids at 8PM. We didn't need to pay a $100 deposit as we'd expected. Our family suite was spacious enough and had a fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. Best part was the view from our window on the Empire State Building. That was simply amazing! Beds were comfy and at night we slept very well as it was quiet. Breakfast was ok, kids loved baking their own waffles and it was mostly toast with eggs or marmelade that we had. Mote important to us is that it was included, a rarity for most hotels these days.Chelsea is a nice neighbourhood, and not sure if there would be any other similar hotels available at such a decent rate. We enjoyed our stay and would return to this hotel.

My first but hopefully not last visit to New york.A pleasent hotel needs little updating and our room had a view of a lovely brick wall,but we only used it as a base so was ok. Breakfast included in price was one of the best i've had in a long while.Staff very friendly and helpful.JFK airport is another story best left alone!!!

Arrived at LaGuardia airport after 12am, took an NYC Taxi=$40.84. Small clean hotel. Close to restaurants, 24 hr CVS pharmacy, and the subway. Snow was piled up against the sidewalks. 2 elevators, but slow, I mostly used the stairs. Very good free breakfast with everything. Room 704 was clean & clean bathroom-but its elevated so watch your step. Coffee maker with coffee/tea supplies. Fridge and safe. Comfy Kg bed. Desk & TV. Small stand alone closet was enough for me. Window faced 25th ave, Empire States Bldg in the distance, sad burned out church across the street, but its slowly being rebuilt. Very limited range wifi.

The rooms are small, tired and worn. But it's New York! (and it's a fabulous location and you won't be spending much time in your room anyway). For travellers without the budget to stay somewhere fancier, there's nothing wrong with this place. Plenty of bars and cafes less than two blocks away, and well connected to the rail and subway.A bonus is the Mile High Running Club right next door for keen runners who want to fraternise with hipster New Yorkers from 6am as they do the running (treadmill) version of spinning (exercise bike) classes. I didn't bother with the free breakfast as there's so much more to experience outside the hotel. As long as you don't have any pretensions that this is in any way luxurious or spacious, then you can't be disappointed.

Have just returned from a five night stay at this hotel. This is a good hotel for location and the fact that breakfast is included is good value. Our room was a twin. Although small had all we needed, fridge, safe iron, ironing board and television. Toiletries in bathroom were a nice extra touch. Local telephone calls were free and as we had to phone a couple of times to confirm pick up times that was a bonus. Our room was very clean, we had clean towels every day so no complaints there. Also it was very quiet, no noise from other rooms or outside noise which made getting to sleep easier. Now for breakfast. Why anyone moans about the breakfast I cannot understand. Its a continental style with plenty on offer. You even get sausage and scrambled egg and can make your own waffles!! We got a table every day of our stay and enjoyed our breakfast choices. You even get tea and coffee 24/7. Overall if you want a good stay in a great city and are on a budget this could be for you. The hotel is well used and could do with a tidy up but the staff and comfy beds more than make up for this. Free wi fi is another bonus, other places we have stayed in New York we have had to pay. Than you Heritage.

We arrived early but our room was ready and we were allowed to check in and get out to enjoy New York. We had requested a room with 3 single beds and were very pleased to find a decent size room with a view of the top of the Empire State Building. The bathroom was small but adequate, our towels which included a face cloth were changed daily. The hair dryer was powerful. Our room was serviced every day no matter what time we left. The complimentary breakfast was varied enough to suit anyone, cereal, fruit, toast, bagels, muffins, waffles, scrambled eggs and sausage tea and coffee. Location is great for the metro and walking either uptown or downtown. Flat iron building is just round the corner. Staff very friendly and willing to help. Luggage storage $1. Would definitely use again if in New York.

The hotel is in a fantastic location in easy walking distance to all the major attractions New York has to offer and is literally just around the corner from the Flatiron building. You will need to overlook the quite grubby and dated rooms and the worlds slowest elevators though. The complimentary breakfast was great because it was free but I certainly wouldn't have paid for it! It was the same food every single morning and stocks got quite low many times so it could get a bit limited. The rooms are small but very quiet and the staff are quite helpful on the whole.

Love staying here.. We come to New York 2 or 3 times a year and have stayed here for the last 4 years. Friendly staff, great location and it just feels like home. We were there for the blizzard of 2017 and flew in eaflier than we had room reservations. No problem. Room made ready and had another great stay. Going back back again in August .

This was my bday overnight trip with my girls. 3 of us. We had a room with 2 double beds. The beds were close together, you couldn't walk between them. You basically had to dive in the bed. The room was so small you couldn't move, the bathroom was the only thing updated. Phone didn't work. If you looking for a crap room with just a place to rest your head for $300- be my guest.Staff was nice.

My friends and I chose this hotel because we got a great deal on the price. Pros: The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. Our room was small, but that is to be expected in NYC. We had three single beds which was a nice change. The room had a safe, coffee pot, and refrigerator. The hotel was relatively quiet at night. Breakfast is offered downstairs. We decided to go out for breakfast, but I'm guessing it was popular since there was a crowd. This hotel is near several subway lines which makes it very convenient for getting around the city.Cons: Our room had the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. There is a shower (no tub), a small sink, and a toilet. There was not enough room to get dressed in the bathroom unless you stand in the shower. Our air conditioner only worked sometimes. The room would get hot and stuffy at night which made it hard to sleep. The internet was spotty. Usually only one person in the room could connect at a time.Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a short stay. If some of their other rooms have a larger bathroom, it would bump up my rating.

Room: enjoyed having three twin beds. Sounds weird, but with preteen daughter and teen son, it was a miracle. There were some bites on the daughter the first night, hence the lack of a star, but that ceased after the first night Thank Goodness. Really liked the price, the breakfast, the coffee all the time, and the feel of it. Small place, small slow elevator, but everyone was good-humored. The breakfast - I don't know how they do it all with a smile, people, my goodness, take so much food like they're starving and leave so much waste it's embarrassing. Really interesting mix of people from all over the world - unified in gluttony at breakfast :). No attitude in this hotel - everyone is used to walking or taking the subway. This is refreshing - not a touristy kind of "hail me a cab" attitude, but a "How can I find the walking guide for Chelsea" kind of crew. I see from other reviews if I'd booked earlier I could have paid less - I will definitely do that next time. It's two subway stops away from most anything in Manhattan. Very convenient.

We just had a one night stay in NYC and wanted to be in the Chelsea area for an art show. There are very few reasonable choices for this neighborhood so we felt lucky to be able to come across the Heritage Hotel for a reasonable rate. The hotel is old but you can see recent updates in the lobby area and in the guest rooms. We were greeted as we entered the hotel and immediately checked into our room. We booked this through a third party (Travelocity) and found it convenient to be pre-paid and in comparing other rates with others, we got a deal. We asked for a king sized bed and found the room to be small - typical of NYC - but functional for one night. I'm not sure if I would stay for a longer period of time. Although it does have a small refrigerator in the room, closet space, coffee maker with supplies, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, and some dresser drawers for clothing to help make your stay more comfortable. In writing this, maybe more than one night wouldn't be a problem! The bathroom was tiny - again, typical NYC - but clean and provided plenty of towels and those little extras that everyone likes to have. The shower was great. We were on the 7th floor and there was still street noise but I'm not sure what could be done about that. We left the heat off for a number of hours but in the middle of night, I found myself cold and the room immediately heated to a comfortable level once I switched it on. The elevators are slow. There are two elevators with one "hiding" behind a door. We would press both"down" buttons and sometimes we would still take the stairs which is great exercise because we didn't want to wait. Breakfast provided the normal breakfast items - eggs, sausage, waffles and plenty of pastries. Hot coffee and tea were available with a variety of juices. Not a bad breakfast to start your busy day in NYC. When we checked out, we asked for our luggage to be stored for the day. It was $1/piece and they led us to the storage room so we could see where our bags would be spending their day. Since we left our bags into the evening, we tipped the concierge generously. She also offered to call transportation for us since it was a very rainy day in the City. We were grateful for that offer.I would stay here again if I needed to be close to the art center of the City. We walked to several sites and it was enjoyable to see different neighborhoods. I traveled with my husband but there were families that had stayed there as well.

Hotel's location is great, right on Broadway and 5th Avenue and a few minutes walk to ESB and other attractions. There's a SuperMarket just round the corner so you can stock up. There are also Metro stations nearby. We got a room on top floor with amazing view to ESB. Room was clean with a comfortable king size bed. Wifi, mini fridge and safe were included. The reception stuff was very helpful and polite. Building is a bit old and could use a renovation. Breakfast was basic. One thing which needs improvement is the soundproof . During our last night's stay the people of the next room were shouting and arquing all night and we couldn't sleep. Overall a descent hotel for its price.

I was fortunate to have found this old charm hotel in NYC for less than $100. I stayed for two nights, and was able to have a restful sleep. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. They offer the basic toiletries; hair dryer, and a security deposit box was a welcome amenity, big enough to store your laptop, electronics, etc...The warm breakfast was a plus! The hotel location was excellent if you want to explore everything there is around the Chelsea neighborhood area. It is located in a quiet, mild trafficqued street. I was able to control the room temp to my liking -this is always a big plus when staying in NYC in the winter or summer months! Many hotels don't offer the option to be able to control the heat temperature, and many can be either too warm or too cold to sleep. I'll definitely come back to this hotel.

It was absolutely not value for money. We fell into the trap of price but we paid double price with this hotel. The general feeling in this hotel that you are in a completely run-down, shabby place.The only thing we liked about the hotel is the location. It is absolutely in the center walking distance from the Empire State Building and other attractions. Very close to several metro stations.I do not understand how this hotel has three star rating. Everything in this hotel is totally shabby; dirty carpets, furniture, walls, spots on the paint, dirty curtains etc. Our room was very small. We could hardly move in it or put our bags down. One of the worst things about the room is that there was no heating (!) when the temperature outside was - 10 Celsius. Unbelievable. We had to use the extremely noisy AC as a heater but you can't have that switched on during the night otherwise you could not sleep. The bathroom was completely without any heating. It was freezing cold. The breakfast is a total disaster, a joke. You have paper plates and plastic forks, knives and glasses. The whole room is very small and the tables and chairs are crammed into it. It is not possible to find a place there if there are more people down there. The menu is even "better" you have frozen bagels, muffins, toasts and butter. They serve the "omlette" from plastic bags and it tastes like cold plastic like the sausages. You have to line up and wait for the one toaster they have there. First morning we were "kindly" warned to clean up our place even before finishing our breakfast. Staff is like non-existent, ignorant.I am absolutely sure they are specialised in "first time New York tourists" like us. Who will never return to NYC. Not to this hotel for sure...

I spend at least 2 months every year in NYC and I normally use another hotel but during my last trip - the past 3 weeks - I decided to try this hotel for the reason that it is close to the Flat Iron place where I had planned many meetings. As soon as we entered the main door we realized something was not exactly the way we normally travel but I thought that maybe was my impression. Right after the checkin we entered our room - third floor - we realized that my first impression was just right and my antennas were perfectly tuned. The room was small, old fashion, smelly and with the carpet dirty and in bad shape. The general feeling was to be in a very old room not refurbished or up to date from many years. The bathroom even worst...we immediately cancelled the entire reservation ( 6 nights ) and we found another hotel for approx the same price but way more better, modern and most important...clean. Sorry, this is my first really bad review but as a travel agent and traveller with 25 years of experience I can suggest to do NOT reserve a room in this hotel

The room was small, but very clean. Beds were ok. We had two rooms for 7 people and it was fine for a one night stay. Location was great, we were able to walk most everywhere. We'd stay again. Breakfast was average, but did the trick.

Out-dated hotel, with gentle staff, good service, good beds, lovely shower. The breakfast is very poor. Instant scrambled eggs. I didn't like it at all. Plastic plates and more. Could and should be much better! Noisy airco also. It was minus 10(C), so we had to heat the room. Very good location, within 5 minutes, three different Subway-stations. Very close to Flatiron-building and Madison Square Park. Dinner tip; Eataly and Wagamama, both restaurants just around the corner. Afterall ok (price/quality).

As a former Comfort Inn, Heritage sticks to the same formula. Lower prices than most Chelsea hotels and a great location between 5th and 6th Ave. There's a free breakfast with mostly pre-packaged bagels, pastry, cereal, but you can make your own waffle and there are apples and bananas. My room was small but adequate for one, with a queen bed looking out on an adjacent building. The bathroom seems to have been recently updated. Everything was perfectly clean. There was a very large international contingent in residence when I stayed, mostly charming young German folks. It made for a very companionable stay.

The Heritage hotel is centrally located, within walking distance from the Manhattan area. The hotel rooms are quite small, however, the location made up for it.The rooms were fairly clean and continental breakfast was available, the eating area seems a bit small to accommodate the guests though. Coffee or tea was made available 24 hours.The stay was great, I would go back there if I happen to be in NYC.

Stayed for 3 nights in The Heritage Hotel. Very good value for money and a great location in Manhattan. Lots of restaurants, bars and interesting places nearby, and a flea market just across the road.

Stayed here on a trip with a family member. We had two double beds but to our surprise, our room was so small that the beds were basically pushed together. There was no space between them to get out of either bed. There was no closet in our room and no suitcase stand. There was no light aside from an overhead light. It was a clean room and New York is such an amazing city that you don't spend much time in the room anyway, but it was our fourth time in New York and I have never stayed in any room as tiny.

I spent 4 nights with my boyfriend and family in this hotel last summer and honestly it was great. My mom was so excited to see a part of the Empire State from this room. We had a family suite. Everything is a little bit old but it's clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and the breakfast simple but tasty!!I will be back in June with my 2 friends to visit NYC with them and we will be in the same hotel because it is a great place! I don't wanna change!! I hope i will enjoy again my trip. I recommend!

We stayed at Heritage for 9 nights. I found it to be a very good hotel for a price we've paid. Really, really clean! Breakfast was not very good but I suppose its a matter of taste. Personally I've missed really coffee, but there was couple of Starbucks around so not a problem :)Very helpful staff, exceptional location (near Flatiron building), close to shopping and subway. One minus is that we didn't have hot water on couple of occasions. I would most definitely get back to Heritage when visiting next time!

Great staff, clean and comfortable stay with hot showers! Hotel and rooms were good, little worn but no complaints. Lots of great options for breakfast - eggs, sausages, waffles, pastries, juices, apples, bananas, cereal, toast... Special mention to the young guy at the front desk who was so helpful and friendly during our four night stay - I apologize for forgetting your name...

Clean, safe and convenient, the Heritage hotel has all the quality basics you need for a stay in NYC. Two blocks from the subway, as well as lots of things to see and do nearby. Accommodation in NYC has a tendency to her pricey, however, I found this great value for money.

i booked two quad rooms as there were eight of us staying. One room was perfectly fine, not huge but new york hotel rooms are generally on the small side. However the second room was tiny. there was no room between the two beds, no headboards which made it look like this room originally had one bed and they just added another bed to it.As i said i know new york hotel rooms are not very big but this room should really never have been sold as a quad room. It was not at all suitable for four middle aged women as it felt like we were all sleeping in the same bed they were so close to each other and no storage space at all.We ended up having to pay an extra $300 for a bigger room which was unfair since we had paid the same for both rooms and they were certainly not the same sizeBreakfast was ok, lifts very slow and often a long wait not to mention they only take two people with luggage.Location is good, plenty of places close by to eat.We go to new york every year but wont be choosing this hotel again. Not because it was very bad but because there are other hotels at the same price which are better.

Stayed in this hotel for five nights room very very small very old bathroom no hot water in shower,party's allowed in rooms kept awake one night informed staff five times but nothing done.walls are like cardboard and doors don't fit correctly , window would not close had to wear jumpers in bed to keep warmstaff tell lies and they could do with attending a customer service course very poor staff on front desk.in one word rubbish would not stay there again and advise you not to waste your money and keep well clear

What a nice place to stay. We spent 4 days in NYC with my family and we were satisfied with the hotel choice. Very central location with all you need in walking distance Two minutes to Madison Square Park and very close to Empire State Building. Nice neighbourhood. The service and staff members were very kind with us. Not a great breakfast but i think this is normal for this price. And our special thanks to the concierge. Her name is Anna ans she speaks russian :) She recommended us a lovely italian restaurant (Stella Trattoria 34) and also helped with transport to the airport. Really enjoyed our stay and would recommend. Thank you!

The hotel is central in NY, and most of the staff is very nice and helpful, but there are not so many more positive things to say. Rooms are in needs of some renovations, the central heating does not work and you have to use a noisy electrical heater, the breakfast is minimal and we had to go to bar and a close Starbucks to have a proper one.Maybe good for 1-2 days stay, not comfortable for a working week.

This was one of the worst hotels I have ever visited. The concierge was ignorant- she didn't know where the Empire State Building was and the hotel is three blocks from it. She was on her phone and unwilling to help with anything. The rooms were dirty, the furniture shabby and outdated and the carpet had something encrusted on it. I saw two cockroaches in the bathroom and I was on the fourth floor! There is no view out the windows, just a block wall. The breakfast is stale and the coffee is cold. No one cares about your needs at all. I discovered that for the same price I could have state at the Hilton Millennium which is a five star hotel in a better area. AND THEY have a pool!! heritage should be condemned as unfit for travelers. It was worse than a motel six.

Pros:Bed was comfortable. Location was perfect! Close to public transportation and walking distance to most iconic places. Complimentary coffee. Good place to stay if you are travellers and will not spend much time in the hotel. Nice neighbourhood.Cons:Breakfast is very poor. Building and the rooms are very old. Heater!! When you turn it on, it is desert hot and dry, when off, crazy cold. Generally expensive for the quality. The gym room is used for luggage storage and depending on the availability, you can use the gym. And when you ask to use the gym, they say "out of service". They charge extra for keeping the luggages for a couple of hours (never seen this before...)Summary:Clean and nicely located hotel with an average budget.If you are planning to spend most of your time outside, then you can prefer it.

This hotel I assume has changed managements as it used to be the Comfort Inn. The room I stayed in was small with no place to hand clothes, it was dirty and not just the rooms the halls and elevators were also dirty. They provide 'breakfast' in a tiny room which barely accommodates 30 people. Not a great breakfast but the bagels were ok. However the shower was good. Good water pressure and hot water so that was nice.Not a highlight hotel.

I've stayed at many hotels over the years. This place is a total ripoff. It is an old Comfort Inn masquerading as a "heritage" hotel. Nothing has been upgraded over the years. Everything is old and grungy. The breakfast included with the room is just awful. I booked my airport transfer thru the hotel concierge, waited an hour at the airport, and finally had to take a taxi. The only thing going for it is location.

have stayed at many different hotels in NYC and this one was pretty good. The room was a decent size and quiet. Staff were helpful and pleasant. The breakfast was good and had a good selection. Coffee and tea were available all the time and the coffee was good, which isn't always the case. There was a fridge in the room and there's a CVS and Fairways store on the corner if you wanted fruit or snacks. We had no issues with the shower and found the room quiet by New York standards.

The state of the hotel is disgusting, extremely dirty all over the place, the rooms are tiny and uncomfortable plus you can hear every sound of the contiguous room, (and when I say every sound I mean it) the tv barely works and the wifi could not be slower, it disconnects every 5 minutes, at least in our room the only way of keeping it running for a little longer was to stay near the door. The breakfast deserves a special mention as the worst I've personally experienced in my whole life, the eggs feel like plastic, the orange juice is very far from being made with oranges, the real fruit runs out on the first 5 minutes after they open it and the muffins are simply horrible...the hotel should pay you for eating that crap. The only positive thing one can say is the location, but honestly that alone is not worth the price, which is by no means cheap or affordable.
