I would suggest to go further away in town and hopefully get a better experience than here, as this is no place to rest or feel relaxed after a long day of intense tourism / work .

Stayed in two twin rooms adjoined. Nice and clean added to the fact it's in a fantastic location. Good value for money considering all things! Walking distance from Times Square and very easily identifiable landmark locations next to it I.E the flatiron building.

By far the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I haven’t felt this way since Gerrard did the slip against Chelsea. First of all there is some crazy woman running around in the breakfasts area, screaming all over the place, and splashing waffles all over the place like she was having a seizure. She was obviously high on some drug and my friends and I found it very disturbing. Furthermore the wifi-connection was the worst I have ever tried. When you connect to the wifi you only stay connected for two minutes. After two minutes the connection disconnects and you have to start all over again. When you finally manage to connect your device to the wifi you can’t even use it because it’s the slowest wifi ever. You can’t use your Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat etc. because the internet is so slow. What’s is worse than all of this is the breakfast. The crazy women is screaming all over the place. The eggs comes out of a plastic bag and is definitely the worst eggs I have ever tasted. But that isn’t the only bad thing about their breakfast. The sausages are disgusting and taste like rubber. There’s only one toaster for the bread so you have to stand in line for 15 minutes. There is only two positive things about Heritage Hotel. The first one being the cleaning of the rooms. The cleaning lady’s does a very good job and they are very polite. The second thing being Two Bro’s pizza. The restaurant is right across the street from the hotel. You are able to get one slice of pizza for one dollar, which helps homeless and the taste is splendid.

Can honestly say that I have had the pleasure of staying here twice with business. Yes it is dated in places and needs an update (when compared to more swankier establishments) However if you take this hotel for what it is - Budget, No frills, solid service, well located, then you cant complain. This hotel is great to lay your head after a solid day of work or sight seeing. It's location is brilliant (right on 5th Ave) and a stones throw from the Flat Iron building and Madison square park (home to the original Shake Shack, which is a must visit) Service is good at the hotel and often nothing is too much trouble, I have requested many things and had them sorted within the hour. Breakfast is a comprehensive self service job, all world foods catered for, great coffee and waffle machine ect. Considering your staying in the very upmarket Chelsea the price is cheap, often people complain but this place is not the four seasons, but it's location makes up for it. If you stay on a weekend the carpark across the road becomes a very cool 'flee market' selling many overpriced 'New York Loft antiques' but you can find a bargain. If your a New York first timer and on a budget or need a good location to get all around New York, then this is a great little hotel to lay your head after a busy day of exploration. Cons - Decor / dated room technology. One thing I will say is, if your not too good on your feet, this is a tall skinny hotel, so if the lifts are in use, be prepared for a long spiral staircase to your rooms. (So get a lower ground room) Pros: Cheap (in a good way) Great Breakfast - Incredible location - Helpful Staff.

This hotel is very basic nothing special and could use some updating, rooms are small but that is to be expected in New York.The room was tired looking and needed updating but it was clean and was refreshed everyday while we out. You have a fridge and a coffee maker in your room, we didnt have any kind of a view but we were at the back and it was quite. The breakfast was your typical hotel breakfast with waffles, sausage, egg, bagels, cereal etc one day there was bananas but all the other days no fruit and no yogurt both of which would have been a nice addition. One day we were there there was no hot water and another day one of the elevators broke down both of these events were very inconvenient. The staff at this hotel were very pleasant and friendly. The location is good with easy access to the metro and within walking distance of many things.

As with most hotels not all rooms are the same. This was a decent size although bathroom a bit small but was a welcome change from where we were staying. Staff were very friendly and as you are in nyc you only need it to sleep and shower in. Would stay again

We staid here unfortunately for 5 nights.Price / location looked about right, and having been several times in NYC I knew the room would be uncomfortable small.But that's a fact of life if you want to sleep on Manhattan.But the big problems began when we woke up the second day (labor day) and did not have any hot water (this was 7.30am).When I called the front desk they acted they did not know this and would fix it and call me back.An hour later still nothing so I called again, and the guy promised me that it would be fixed in 20 minutes.Long story short, at 7.30 PM we still did not have any hot water, our room was not cleaned (we went out at 9.00am) no clean towels (we had to use a lot as washing up with cold water is no joy).When I went down to the front desk I got told they informed me wrong and had no idea when the water would be fixed, no manager was available and the room was not cleansed as it was a busy day.For that service you pay over $200 a night!I asked for a compensation but only the manager could do that.We staid for 3 more nights (next day one of the slow old elevators also broke down for over 24 hours) but the managers never called, left us no message, and we received no compensation on the final bill.This is below the service level even in NYC.Breakfast is crowded (too busy) and nothing more than bad coffee a piece of toast / cold bagel, some cream cheese and peanut butter.And something what I guess should represent sausages and eggs ?So after day 2 we skipped breakfast to get something healthy in the neighborhood and we regretted that we could not cancel our booking and get in a friendlier hotel.Once but never again!

We were a group of friends who stayed at the Heritage Hotel from late August to early september. The main reason we booked it was the inclusive breakfast and the fact we could get three beds in a room. The room itself was nice, view was as you would expect in New York of buildings around and a nice size tv. The bathroom was a tad small, and could have done with being about 2 - 3m bigger, it literally could only squeeze one person in at a time and you could wash your hands whilst on the toilet the basin was that close. Breakfast was very nice, small room and anything after 8:30am we found to be very, very busy and sometimes had to queue to sit down for breakfast. Novel idea of plastic cups and cutlery to keep maintenance down but we didn't mind this.We only really slept in the room, for what it was it was ideal for us, would have been nice to have had a bigger bathroom and some nicer sheets but that's nit picking really, all in all nice for the price it is.

Arrived early and was just looking to place are luggage down until room was ready to our surprise they had a room ready for us that was great after driving for 4 hours. Room was located on 3rd floor our room was small King size bed but it was clean bathroom was clean also, for the price I can't complain we were there for sightseeing and not staying in the room all day, the free breakfast worked it is help yourself again it's not the Hilton, they had eggs,sausage, cereal,bagels etc.. Ok as far as parking 2 minutes away from hotel and they validate so for two days it cost me $56 not bad and they are friendly at the garage. As far as location you are in the middle of everything the subway is only a few minutes away to go downtown or uptown plus you can walk to a lot of places also their is so much to do Nyu isn't far either Empire State Building is minutes away. I felt safe my entire trip every time I asked a question people gave me the correct answer also a big thanks to the staff at the hotel very nice and friendly I would definitely stay at this hotel again

I got a triple room through Booking.com. It was on July 12th, fortunately only 1 night! There was a huge scaffolding on the facade, everithing covered. The room was very small, noisy and not so clean in my opinion. We tried to have breakfast the morning after, the queue for entering the room was very long and it took us 30mins to get something to eat. Plastic dishes and glasses, just a few thinks to eat (juices, cereals, bread, jam and some cold brioches just get out from the refrigerator.No seats available therefore we just got a brioche and went out.I don't know if I have been unlucky (maybe other clients had a good stay) but I would not suggest this hotel.

The rooms were kind of small but had everything you could need. It was cheap and the location was great. Breakfast was included and was pretty decent.We walked to many sights like central park, times square, empire state building and flatiron building. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Affordable. Located in a good location. Walking distance to Times Square and downtown. The hotel is a bit run down but it was clean and comfortable. Free breakfast and wifi. The wifi connection is very good. Coffee available all day. They validate parking.

The hotel is located in an excellent spot, walking distance from Flat Iron / Empire State / Times Square and surrounded by places to eat and shop. Staff is very friendly and inviting and breakfast is served (first time in my 6 visits to NY that this is included in the price). The buffet is not extensive but enough to get you started with decent coffee :) We had quite a spacious room on the front 6th floor with fridge / coffee machine and bath with shower option. Not the newest room interiors, which can be seen in the bathroom and furniture. Clean though and nothing to complain about!

This rather understated little hotel offers excellent value for money, especially if you are a family or travelling as more than two people. The style of the hotel is quite European with coffee and tea facilities provided, ice downstairs (it was hot) and the decor. The beds were big and comfortable. The room was larger than expected. The only tiny spot of improvement might lie in the bathroom which was really a well appointed hole in the wall. It was also placed on a raised platform which was an annoying thing to remember when stumbling there in the middle of the night. But the staff were lovely and accommodating, approachable, friendly. The location could not be beat; right near Madison Square Park, Gramercy, Chelsea and the Empire State building not far off.

I booked a 2-full bed hotel room solely based on the pictures of the rooms on the hotel's website and Hotels.com's website. Being that I was traveling with another couple, we wanted a room spacious enough to accommodate 4 adults comfortable. All pictures on both websites showed rooms that were very spacious w/ nice decor. Upon entering the room, we all stopped dead in our tracks and expressed "What the *@!? The room was basically a closet, with both beds pushed right up against each other. The advertised room looks to be about 25x14, but the actual room size is 9x10! There was no room to separate them, since the 1st bed allowed just 12 inches of leg room to walk INTO the room, and the other bed was flush against the opposite wall. It felt like we were all sleeping in the same bed like swingers! We also found yellow pee stain on the white comforter, no closet to hang clothes, and the shower wasn't spacious enough to turn around in! We've traveled the world, and all agreed that this was by far the WORST hotel room we've ever seen. So down to the lobby I went to ask for the room I actually booked. The desk clerk REFUSED to admit that false advertising was at play here, and I was told that the only rooms open in the 2-bed category were the same size as mine... which leads me to believe that the vast majority of rooms are crappy little closets like this one, and should be honestly shown on the websites. The clerk refused to rectify the situation, accusing me of trying to get a free upgrade, and giving me the rudest snarkiest looks I've ever received from someone in the "hospitality" field. At breakfast the next morning, the food staff literally grabbed food away in front of you because it was 10:00 and they wanted to close it up. I had the waffle syrup next to me while I was buttering my waffle, and the guy started YELLING at me to give him the syrup! I explained that I needed to use it, and he just kept yelling at me to give it to him! My advise: DO NOT STAY HERE!!

the hotel's location in a great .the rooms r tiny. me and my partner stayed at a double twin room, and we barley had room to place the luggage...we had to put some of it on the table in order to open the door.the rooms are old nut clean

Nice breakfast included. Room was small but clean with a very comfortable bed. No fridge. Subway close by. Tourist activities nearby or easy subway connection. Plenty of food options in walking distance. Nice central gathering place on Broadway close by to hang out. Elevators very slow. I would stay here again but the price is fairly high though not out of line with the rest of New York during the early summer. Coffee available free 24 hours in lobby. WIFI very slow and intermittent from the room.

I loved staying at the heritage hotel! It was nice and clean. The bed was really comfortable and neat. The free breakfast was nice in the morning and they were able to keep my luggage there after I checked out the next day. The staff was very nice, Thank you!

The hotel was well located and priced. There was trash under the bed that was not ours. Gross. The cleaning staff used the main elevator, and the other small elevator (which seemed to be the service elevator) was quite slow to get up and down.

We were having a girls night in the city and wanted a decent prices hotel that was central to walk were we needed. This place was perfect. They had a room with 3 twin beds which was great for us! Free breakfast was awesome. The room and shower was a little cramped but we made it work since we were t really spending much time there. Also my friend dropped her credit card in the lobby and they made sure to call up to us and let her know.
user_name:
Kelley R
San Luis Obispo, California

review_body: I have just returned from staying at this Hotel. I have been here before.I am from Las Vegas where I was in the Hotel/Casino business for many, many years. I was at the famous Sands Casino, The home of Sinatra, Martin, Davis and so many others. These guys and so many more worked for us many times. It was when Las Vegas was growing up and becoming known around the world. It happened because we treated people right. Great hotels and the best entertainment in the world.. I see Heritage Hotels has taken over the ownership and running of this place. Right off, I will say they are doing a good job. I see some new faces but most of the staff are still here. So glad to see Mr. Rehman as General Manager. He knows this hotel inside and out. He knows how to inspire and motivated the staff to do the great job they do. I see him everywhere, checking on things. Reminds me of myself 50 years ago. I turned 79 this week and still feel good when I see a well run place. Some things I like:Location: It’s on west 25 and right off 5th ave. You go out the hotel door and to the right and at the end of the block is the Flatiron Building in full sight. A beautiful sight. Madison Square park and lots of restaurants all around. The 23st subway is right there to take you uptown or downtown. Out the hotel door and to the left and down to 6th ave. Again, lots of restaurants and shops. Walk a bit down 6th and you will come across some of the best shopping anywhere. This is where I shop. At 23rd is the subway and if you know how to use it then you can go anywhere in the city.I like to walk 23rd west over to 7th and 8th. The Chelsea area. Boy, is it going through a change. Old buildings being converted into multi-million dollar apartments. Continue walking over to the river and you are at Chelsea Piers and all that’s happening there. Very exciting time in New York.I applaud Heritage for the way they have started here. My stay was, as usual. Just perfect. Everything worked well. I love the WiFi to check the weather every morning on my iPad and start my day with the very nice Breakfast the hotel serves. It is so well done and free. And the Smart Phone charging outlets in the room are a great idea. I could charge my iPhone, IPad and Nook at one time.My room was well set up and everything I needed was there. Maid service was very good.The Hotel front desk staff were so polite and helpful. My last day, Jesena, at the desk helped me check out and get my Limo. Very nice.So overall I am very pleased. Heritage is doing a good job and I feel this Hotel is in good hands.I am 79 years old and would like to visit New York city later this year. If I can make it, this is where I will stay.

This is my 2nd time at this hotel. We come for the 5 Boro tour, and this hotel is in a great location, their sleeping accommodations are great, and the morning breakfast is just what a bicycle person needs!
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Frieda L
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: Great location. Rooms a little old, great staff, great price. To make sure you sleep really well, ask for a room giving on the interior yard. Way less noise, view not so great but worth the good sleep. Easy to transit to airports by subway

I love this hotel - it is small, a bit off Broadway and Madison Square park, so very accessible. The staff is very helpful. Breakfast is good and included. Even rooms on the street are quiet because you aren't on a main drag. There are a number of quirky rooms that can work really well - my daughter and I had a room with two twin beds - it was perfect! The staff has always been wonderful, but this time, the front desk chased me down the street to let me know housekeeping had found a charging cord in my room. Yes, I could have replaced it, but it was sure nice to be stopped and able to get it back. They are clean, very affordable and convenient.

Location is excellent, staff is very helpful, breakfast in general acceptable. But only 1 x toaster in a bad location so that it is often overcrowded. Majority of rooms seem to go to backyards so try to get a higher floor for some daylight. Room with 2 single beds is obviously smaller than 1 x king-size. Will go again for next visit and hope for a second toaster.

This hotel has tons of old world charm. If you like ultra modern or if you're looking for a five star property, this is probably not the place for you. But the rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and breakfast selection was really good. Great value in a perfect location. Would definitely recommend and will stay there again the next time I need a place in the City.

GREAT location. Room was small but comfortable, very efficient. Front lobby a little understaffed, but acceptable. Very reasonably priced. Had some neat old architectural features. Breakfast was awesome and free!

Stayed one night and that was enough. The room was large, but was in need a full makeover. There were stains on the furniture, coffee maker and safe did not work, everything was worn. Though the room was large (2 beds and a sofa) the hallways and elevators are small. Price was good, but have stayed in new, clean (but smaller) places in this neighborhood for only a little more. Breakfast was included and was basic (coffee was bad).

We stayed May 19 to 22. We arrived by Amtrak at Penn Station. Even with our carry-on luggage, the walk to the hotel was not hard. The hotel rooms are very clean with comfortable beds. They are small, but we were there to sightsee, not stay in the room. We enjoyed our breakfast each morning. Also, the elevators are small. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely would stay there again.

We stayed in a room with 3 twins for our girls weekend in NYC - what a perfect setup! Breakfasts were delicious, the staff was friendly and helpful and we were so close to everything! The Union Square farmers market, Madison Square Park, the Flatiron and the Highline were all an easy walk away. Easy access to subways up and downtown too. I'll be back!

Located on the heart of Manhattan and in between lower and upper Manhattan on 23rd street perfect place to stay with family near Empire State Building and close to shopping street perfect place for Business and Holidays

We needed a hotel in Chelsea and this one was in the perfect location for our needs. Close to everything! Walking distance to many restaurants, shops and a CVS. I booked a room that said fridge and microwave but there was no microwave. Rooms are small and ours didn't have a great view but at the price for where you got to stay in the city, it was worth it. Room and bath were clean. That's the most important thing to me.

The best place to stay in Manhattan! I will be back as soon as possible!! Excellent hotel, comfortable bedrooms, everything was amazing!! I recommend this hotel if you want to enjoy New York!!! Incredible people working for us!!

My two twenty something year old daughters and I took my mother in law to NYC for her birthday and needed a reasonably priced room with 2 beds. This worked just fine. Nothing special but clean, safe and convenient and that's all I asked for on the lower end of the budget scale!

This is a nice, older hotel as many are in NYC.The price was excellent for NYC. As a New Yorker, I took off to play tourist. The hotel is directly across the street from the historic Orthodox church that suffered a devastating fire recently. There are construction trucks, barricades and fire trucks on standby. This may turn some people off, but it is a sad reality. It is withing walking distance to the fashion district, Madison Square park and several subways. Free breakfast is included. I only gave it 3 stars because of the staff. They were friendly, but not very knowledgeable. I checked my bag early and clarified my reservation. I asked if it was a non smoking hotel as many are. I was told yes. We went to do our activies and returned later to check in. I overheard the same clerk asking what smoking floor they wanted. When it was my turn I questioned what she told me earlier. She denied saying it was her or she said it. She then said she must have misunderstood me!! She did not recognize me as a rewards member and I am at Platinum. We were giving a higher floor (11th) and although I requested a king bed, the bed was small, the mattress was comfortable however the sheets were stiff and itchy. The bathroom was tiny with a pedestal sink and no counter. What we found most awkward was the location of the toilet paper. It was behind you to the side and the bowl was on top of the wall so it make it an uncomfortable turn. The windows outside were filthy, so you could not see out. The evening clerk directed us to pizza parlors, not restaurants which we clearly asked for. In the morning the breakfast was standard--hot and cold. However some woman was saving at least 4 tables for people, making it difficult to find a seat. Noone said anything. It also has a small fitness center. All in all we had a good time, but I would choose differently next time.

The staff is very nice and it is in a great location however there were some issue- the layout of the hotel is confusing once you are on your floor and for an inexplicable reason the elevator is mind numbingly slow. I also discovered that my "clean towels" in the room were already damp as if they were never cleaned and just put back to look clean. Again staff was nice so that was a plus.

Need a NYC hotel with 2 beds? They are kind of hard to find in NYC, but this is a convenient place in the middle of Manhattan. I had a girls weekend with a college friend, and we stayed here for the convenience and the twin beds. FYI: this is a very basic hotel, not an upscale place. Our window view from the 11th floor was a brick wall. The breakfast was good and place was where we wanted to be. I'd stay there again if I needed two beds.

ideal position,pretty much central to visit all area's,hotel staff friendly and helpful,we had a bit of trouble with our room upon arrival,sorted out within 5 minutes,transferred to a better room (same rate paid for as original room) ☺ want to return again in a year,very happy with trip and hotel,but need to stay longer this time

Stayed here for 2 nights in May 2016. Got no sleep on both nights. We asked for a room in the quietest part of the hotel and was allocated a room on the 7th floor at the back in the area where all the air con units roar loudly all night. It was like sleeping in a jet engine. As if this wasnt bad enough we had to endure steel hotel room and hallway doors being slammed all through the night and early morning as well as a loud party of girls in a room across the hall. The hotel room doors are less than a foot away from eachother across each landing and you hear every word being said in the neighbouring rooms as the rooms are tiny and your bed is very close to the door to the hallway. I accept that NY is noisy but the inside of a hotel is supposed to be quietish at night so you can sleep. Thats why you book hotels. No point in complaining about noisy hotel neighbours to Reception here as the loud neighbours just ignored the too polite telephone request from reception staff to be quiet at 1am. I heard the phone ringing and the entire call the walls are so thin. The breakfast was awful. Do not waste your money. Comfort inn on 343 West 44th is much closer to Times Square and is way more superior with a lovely breakfast and bigger rooms.

This is just what you'd think and just as the pictures show. It is a simple room that is a little worn. We had a double deluxe which had a sofa in it and two double beds. The beds were ok, the shower was fine. The steam never vented even though it had a very noisy vent; it wasn't doing any good. It had a refrigerator, desk and bright lights. The staff In general was very good. There were some young people at the concierge desk that were pleasant but they couldn't speak English nor understand it very well. Breakfast was good. It was better stocked on the weekend than on Monday. The business center was a racket. The computer kept asking for more money to print but the printer didn't work. They charge $1. per bag to check your bags. Most nice hotels do not charge at all. The location is very convenient and it is a half block to Madison Garden, Shake Shack, the Flatiron bldg and Eataly is around the block. The metro is at 23rd or 28th. CVS is down the block, and a grocery market around the corner. There are restaurants around. It seemed to be overpriced, but everything was high this week.

my family and me spend 9 days at this hotel.i will start with the good part- clean - rooms are well maintained- staff is friendly and helpful- good location (walking distance from many touristic sites)- good breakfast choice- relaible internet (free wifi)less good though REALLY INSIGNIFICANT - rooms are smallall in all - highly recomanded - great experience we will be back

The hotel exceeded our expectations. We booked a 2 room/1 bath suite that had 2 double beds and a king bed. Upon check-in we were offered a 2 room/2 bath suite for the same price. With 6 girls staying together, we jumped at the opportunity to have an extra bathroom. The PROS: We knew the rooms were small from reading reviews prior to our trip, but we chose to stay here because everyone in our group would be able to sleep in an actual bed and not a sofa sleeper. The beds and pillows were comfy. The rooms and bathrooms were clean. There was a mini fridge and a safe. The location is perfect. 23rd St Subway station, great restaurants, stores (Trader Joes for snacks and water for the hotel room), Flatiron building are all very near. Breakfast was included - which was a great value. Food was standard, but hot and delicious. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free WI-FI that worked great in our 10th floor room. Coffee and tea station available 24/7.The CONS: Elevators were slow. There were no extra mirrors in the rooms (just in the bathrooms) - this was a big issue for 6 females trying to get ready in the AM. Nowhere to hang up clothes (just dressers). Iron was provided, but no ironing board. No counter space in bathrooms - need more shelves. Tough getting a spot to sit for breakfast in the AM. Overall, the hotel was a great value in a great location. I would stay there again!

Upon arriving at the hotel I was welcomed by an overcrowded and very small lobby this was okay I guess. Then we were directed to a cafeteria to sort out our rooms, we were then told that some rooms were not ready yet so we would have to double up. At this point I thought I would get over it and move on its a small problem. But oh was I wrong, I then dragged my suitcase and hand luggage to one of two elevators, after waiting a good 10 minutes the cranky and extremely small elevator arrived but could only fit a few of us In there. We proceeded to the tenth floor at a pace I can only describe as unbearably slow. I then exited this elevator and carried on to my room which was in a small corridor, when I opened the door my entail reaction was to cry as I was shocked at how little the room looked like the ones on the website it was the tiniest room with only a minuscule, grimy sheet of glass to provide very little natural light into the dark and dismal room. The bathroom a nasty shade of wee yellow, was so cramped I could hardly breath let alone move. The shower would only allow two temperatures, you could either freeze or boil, I chose to boil. So while standing in the shower being boiled by a hose like shower I looked at the towel which could probably only cover the body of a small child. After all of this I was glad to get into bed after a very long flight from England, so I went to close the curtains to find out I couldn't, I could only pull down some crappy blinds that still let light into the room. Then because I couldn't sleep I decided to try to watch some tv, which was positioned I. Such say that only one person would be able to see it but the that didn't matter because it was such poor quality you didn't want to see it. I couldn't even unpack as there was nowhere for me to put my any of my stuff. In the morning I headed down back into the crap elevator to breakfast, I had some apple juice, a muffin, a doughnut, Apple and banana (only fruit available ) the muffin was so dry I actually chocked, my friend had to preform the Heimlich manoeuvre. The apple juice was watery and cheap and the lack of selection applauded me. After surviving a night in hell and going out for the day we came back to the room to find our beds half made and the sheets left for us to do!!!!!! I will not be returning here nor will I be advising that anyone else should come here!!!!The only plus is the location and some staff are friendly.

I stayed in Comfort Inn for a week. It is a cosy hotel in mid-town which makes it accessible to most attractions in New York. It is close to the 23rd street PATH and Subway station which makes it ideal for tourists. Empire state building and Times Square are at a walking distance. The rooms were very clean with comfortable beds. The hotel serves breakfast in the dining room with the regular menu that you find in most hotels in NYC. Free wifi is available but the speed is not good in the room. You have to get into the lobby area for better speeds.This hotel is highly recommended for travellers who don't want to stay in expensive city hotels and yet be closer to the tourist attractions in the city.

Visited this hotel in February 2015. I found this particular hotel to be friendly, clean and the staff were helpful when needed. Breakfast was always served fresh. Also the rooms were as expected, clean and tidy, although the room I stayed in was a bit small. Overall, a good hotel!

Hotel is in a great location, close to metro, and close to good bars and restaurants.Best of all were the staff, Christina and her co-worker (didn't get name sadly), who accommodated my room request with great efficiency and a smile. Thank you.Breakfast good, decent selection, all day coffee was a plus.Would gladly stay here again, and would not hesitate to recommend to others.
user_name:
Mark S
New Bloomfield, United States

review_body: ... but i only review places i like and if i like them, meaning i'd go back if i could, then i'm not all that picky. i've lived in manhattan and visited there for over 30 years now. it can be really hard to find a decent place to stay for less than $200 especially at the last minute. but i found myself late in the city and too tired to drive back to my host's home 50 minutes away so my assistant found this little place in chelsea. a clean and safe place... no bed bugs... and a great location. i love these old manhattan hotels which have changed hands over the past 100 years many times. the rooms do not have an inch to spare, but they don't waste room either. you'll often find like i did in my room raised floors stepping up to bathrooms; a sign that the building has been remodeled to accommodate more modern plumbing and systems and is often sculpted around pipes and passages that mostly serve as conduits for wi-fi and cable and remind a person fond of history and buildings in nyc of all the changes the city has rolled with. i can tell you one weekend secret... and i stayed there late on a saturday night... three blocks away is fashion institute high school; and if you get in a jam like i did and have a rental car there's always a late night weekend parking spot in front of the school that is practically free until monday morning.

Loved the hotel, friendly staff, the concierge went out of his way to be nice and helpful. The rooms are small (as are most in NYC) but spotless and comfortable. The beds were great, had a great night sleep, linens even smelled clean, awesome! The breakfast was nice and there was plenty of seating, overall we loved the hotel and staff and will stay again and recommend this hotel and its great location to anyone who needs a comfortable and very reasonably priced place to stay while in New York.

This is a nice budget hotel in Chelsea. Close to metro, restaurants, & shopping. Near Flatiron & Madison Park. Clean & courteous staff. Free continental breakfast & wifi. Wifi is strong. We had room 208, king looking into alley. Very small room & bath, but we are just in the room for sleeping & shower. After chevk out, was told rooms ending in 04 are larger kings that look out onto street, but could be noisy because of club on corner. Also, this hotel tends to accommodate school groups & they tend to loiter in the breakfast room, taking up tables.

Our stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea was excellent as always. We always have excellent service and the staff knows us from staying at their hotel all the time. I highly recommend this hotel. One of the best parts of this hotel is it's location to everything. It is just off of Broadway and within walking distance to a lot of attractions.

We were here for a week stay in room 703 which is a family suite, one king and two double beds. Room seemed a typical size for Manhattan. Location provides easy access to 23rd presentations and is near a grocery and several restaurants. Staff are very friendly. Breakfast is included and consists of eggs, sausage, yogurt, cereals, bread, bagels, muffins, patties and waffles. Standard Comfort Inn offerings. The building is an older one with a beautiful church across the street and from our room views of the Empire State building. Bathroom was small with toilet in a tight corner. Water temp in the shower was inconsistent...sometimes great and other times tepid. Beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows. WiFi worked great. Overall I thought it was great for our purposes and an excellent value. I would definitely stay here again.

Nice room, quiet, adequate breakfast, nicely located, helpful staff, safe neighborhood, walking distance to many stores, park across the street, good price for New York City hotel, not on a heavily travelled street.
user_name:
johnsV5622LI
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I was so pleased with my recent stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea. Front desk employees were so kind and helpful. The breakfast that is included was much better than expected. An added plus is the 24 hour coffee/tea station. My room was clean and comfortable and surprisingly quiet--which I didn't expect. The location was great for me--so convenient, & affordable. Truly a great value! The Comfort Inn Chelsea is a hidden gem that I'm so glad I discovered!

This hotel is very good value for money. Rooms are an ok size but not very spacious. Superb location to everywhere and a subway just around the corner. The only thing disappointing was breakfast. Only waffles, buns, toast, sausage and egg are available although there is 24/7 complimentary tea/coffee facilities even though these are in your room. Wifi Excellent

Want to avoid an unpleasant stay where you get bed bugs and the hotel staff does not get responsible for this? STAY OUT OF THIS HOTEL! Cheap comes expensive. We showed front desk staff evidence that we got bed bugs at their hotel and they said "there's so much we can do". Unprofessional, rude staff and filthy, old facilities. The only good thing about this hotel is that it's conveniently close to subway and train stations. But I'm pretty sure we can find cleaner places next time. NEVER COMING BACK.

Great location convenient to Madison Square Garden. Convenient commute within the city walking or via subway. I was very pleased with the accommodations and will definately use this hotel again. I was there two nights in a three bed suite, which is great for a girls trip or family. I stayed over other nights in a single room, which was just as well appointed.

Very helpfull employees. We felt they were waiting for us and we felt welcome !Very Nice room ans the Area is safe and quiet .The breakfast is very good bus no Windows in the room. The employées were very attentive to our wellness.

Nice area, felt safe there. Convenient to flat iron bldg & Empire State bldg. CVS, deli, market nearby. Rooms are small but cozy. Bathroom was very snug. Elevators are extremely slow so allow time for waiting. Overall I would stay there again.
user_name:
juliejV8357QS
Coastal South Carolina, South Carolina

review_body: The hotel is in a great location for walking to Chelsea, Midtown and the Village. It is clean and comfortable and the front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a free breakfast but it is not great.

location is the key subway system 1 block away restaurtants around every corner parking discounted in the next block. very clean and friendly staff. quiet neighborhood minutes from times square and macys taxi cabs run constant up and down 23 street awesome place to stay thumbs up

My room was warm and relaxing. My room was small, but cozy. Also, my room was clean and neat, and the bathroom was in the same condition. Most importantly, the price was fairly reasonable for New York

My family was staying in Comfort Inn Chelsea in Aug. 2015 when we visited NYC. It is in a good location, walking distance in many attractions. We were there 4 days without taking any public transportation. A good exercise walk to Time Square. The hotel is outdated, the room is small and tight, but clean and no issue at all.The breakfast was not bad, can fill you up in the morning.

To show my wife NYC on her first visit we looked for a central & reasonably priced (for NYC) hotel.The Comfort Inn Chelsea was both of these.The rooms are a bit small but we were only in the room to sleep.

This was a very clean and comfortable hotel. You were close to everything. It was no problem to walk to attractions, but the metro line was very convenient to get to.The breakfast was great! I will definitely stay here again.

The Comfort in is very cozy, clean and a great bang for your buck given the location of it. Walking distance of shopping, public transportation, restaurants and the sites! We wete able to walk almost everywhere! I had only stayed the weekend because I was on a mission to find my wedding dress at Kleinfeld's. However from our window we could see the Empire State Building which was only a few blocks away and before we left noticed we were down the street from Times Square. The staff was friendly. We'll definitely stay here again when we're in New York next time!

This hotel is centrally located near many popular attractions and subway. Rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast buffet had a good variety of options. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

Room was clean, we were given clean towels and asked if we needed anything else. Breakfast was sooo good both mornings! All staff, front desk very helpful and pleasant! Only one complaint---no heat in the bathroom and it was freezing.

Very accommodating, friendly staff. Everything you need for a great price—free wifi, exercise room, complementary breakfast, free coffee/tea 24/7, place to hold bags after check-out. Also close to many awesome restaurants. Short cab ride away from Times Square.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Gr8fulKate
New York, New York, United States

review_body: Located in Chelsea area close to the Empire State Building and Union Square! Lots of restaurants in the area including the famous Eataly!! Room had a king size bed, very comfortable, but left little space to move around, which was fine for us. The staff was extremely helpful and went out of their way to meet our needs!!! The hotel itself, hallways, elevator was a bit dated but for the price in NY city it was ok.

We have stayed at many Comfort Inns, in New York and elsewhere. But the Comfort Inn in Chelsea is particularly well situated, close to transportation on the east and west sides of Manhattan, quiet and very well run. Our rooms were, as always excellent, clean, with all the amenities we have come to expect from Comfort Inn: soft and firm pillows, good mattresses, coffee and tea in each room. Of course, the free breakfast is always welcome. The building has been completely renovated and cheerfully painted (we were there some years ago when it was in process). I have absolutely no idea what eandm91(reviewer) was talking about when they spoke of "peeling paint." Desk service was friendly and helpful.

Great location for many attractionsThe bedroom was great,it was clean and a good sized room(no noise at night)Towels were changed daily.Good selection at Buffet breakfast.Very helpful staff.Free coffee in lobby all day/small gym and computer room.

The location is fantastic, very central and convenient for a tourist. In the local area we found easy access to the subway, walking distance to many things to do, walking to great food and restaurants. (We ate or snacked many times at Eataly which is just around the corner). The hotel is clean and functional, although a bit dated. The staff were friendly and responsive. There are 2 lifts, only one was working for part of our stay - but never caused significant delay. We had a family room which provided 2 joining rooms with one bathroom. I think this is quite rare for this price in New York based on my research. The rooms are small compared to any other location, however, were sufficiently large enough for the 4 of us. The rooms really just have room for the beds and bags with occasional "sideways" walking and bumping into furniture! The breakfast (included in the room rate) had a large variety including waffles (wholemeal or white), cereal, bagels, toast, yoghurt and some hot food. (Yes, paper plates but easy to keep the area clean as a result!). Could have been better choice of healthy cereal (granola?). There is a concierge service which supervises the storage of bags, arranges transport etc. This is managed separately from the hotel and doesn't provide quite the same level of service as the hotel staff.

1. Rodents went through suitcase and ate purchased gifts.2. Bathroom walls had mold on them.3. Bathroom paint peeling.4. Toilet stopped up, man came and fixed it. Saw him putting out food 5 minutes later.5. Elevator broken, had to use service elevator entire 5 day stay.6. Noisy air conditioner window unit constantly cycling.7. Shower leaks onto floor causing bathroom door to peel.Staff friendly, location great. Not exactly the review you'd like to see on yelp or trip advisor. Please respond.

This hotel is a great value and is in a great location! The prices were so reasonable even on Thanksgiving weekend. We had the room with two beds and a sofa. It was not bad space considering some of the shoe boxes I have stayed in while in NY. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. They had lots of suggestions for places to eat and things to do in the neighborhood. The concierge was knowledgeable and a great help. The hotel is very clean and has a lovely breakfast room. (breakfast is included in price) They have a deal with a garage and you can park at a great discount. (be sure to go to correct garage, we made that mistake and had to pay more) I have seen reviews complaining about the cost of them holding bags, but $1.00 per bag is reasonable considering the price for the hotel and parking.

We stayed in a triple room (3 single beds) which was compact but as expected. Shower room was a bit small but manageable. We would have had to pay nearly double for a room that could take 3 single people in other Manhattan hotels. It worked out at about £50 GBP each per night with breakfast included - good value for central New York. Breakfast is a self serve buffet with cereals, scrambled egg , suasage, juice, yoghurt, waffles , bread , toast , fruit. Paper plates and plastic cutlery. Good enough to start the day.Quiet street and hotel - not sure where the previous reviewer was - but we heard no internal noises. Some street noise from refuse collection - but not too bad. Friendly helpful staff. Fast free wifi . Great location - walkable to most places if you are feeling like a walk - and also close to subway and buses . Would recommend.

At the time of booking this was the most affordable NYC hotel I could find that was in Manhattan and in a nice, central location. It was about $200 per night and for that price we definitely expected a lot nice than what we got. The were doing renovations on a bunch of the rooms (including the one right next to hours) and that meant smelling paint everywhere and not being able to sleep past 8am because of construction noises. The elevators are so old and the hotel has a general creepy feeling to it. The only nice part that we saw of the hotel is the main floor. The lobby is alright and the breakfast area was much better than I was expecting. We ate their every morning and at least that saved us a bit of money. I guess if you're in the hotel the bare minimum, just for a night's sleep, it is not that bad. But I really think that with construction going on right next door to our room that we should have received a discounted rate.

We stayed in the triple room which was the only hotel room in NYC I could find that had 3 single beds. The price was great for NYC and such a good spot. The shower room is compact and could do with some updating, can take a while for the hot water to get up to the 10th floor. The staff were friendly and helpful.Great bars and restaurants close by.

Stayed here last year with my family and this year returned with my husband. The location is perfect for us. Quiet street, walking distance from everything we wanted to see ... Times Square and the Theater District, Lower Manhattan, Chelsea Market, the High Line, museums, etc. Subways and restaurants are easily accessible. Our room was nothing fancy, but the bed was quite comfortable and the shower was good. The staff mentioned they are in the process of upgrading all their rooms. One of the best perks of this hotel is the wonderful, free breakfast they provide each morning - complete with a waffle-maker, scrambled eggs, sausage, yogurt, cereals, breads, pastries, etc. Great way to start the day and save lots of time and money. Hotel staff is helpful and friendly. We'll be back.

I was a bit concerned having read previous reviews about this place, I should not of been. It is not 5 star, but the rooms were more than adequate. The breakfast was ideal to start the day. But the location of this place was absolutely perfect for exploring NY, right by the Flatiron building, and only a 20 minute stroll to 42nd street, also the hop on bus stop & subway were very close by. NY is a great place to visit and this hotel was perfect for it. Also Devon on reception was extremely polite and helpful.

It is always the case that high demand locations are expensive and standards do not need to be so high.This was essentially a 3 star hotel but in a good location. The bathroom was poor and the breakfast room was too small for the hotel. I guess this is what you get when the breakfast is complementary, a free for all.The location was very useful but I do feel that the hotel could do more to improve facilities and find more space for the breakfast area. The staff worked very hard and it was clear that they were doing their best in very challenging circumstances.

This was the perfect price friendly hotel for us. It was very clean, and the breakfast was great. We anticipated leaving our bags with them because we arrived way before check-in, but we were pleasantly surprised when they checked us in instead. It was 10:30 am! Both Precious and Louis were very helpful. We will be staying again.

I stayed here for 3 nights with my teenage daughter and her friend. I found this place because our regular spots were booked up, and was delighted to find that this hotel has an unusual variety of room types, including rooms with three single beds. This was perfect for our little group. The rooms felt like an old-timey NYC hotel. The room and bathroom were fairly small - you couldn't open the bathroom door all the way because it hit the foot of one of the beds. However, there was walking space around all the beds, plenty of counter space (desk and a few night stands), room for small suitcases, and even a microwave, coffee maker and mini fridge. Beds were very comfortable, and the double pillows on the bed, one softer, one harder, were great. Our room was at the end of the hall, and behind fire doors from the elevator, so very quiet in terms of hotel noise. The trash collection after midnight was quite loud, even on the 11th floor. We weren't expecting much noise because the hotel is on a narrow, not-so-busy street, and if it wasn't trash night, that probably would have been true. There were a few things that were worn and tired feeling, like the rusted cover over the tissue box, but all was clean. Wifi was reliable and strong.Front desk staff on both days were incredibly friendly and helpful. The concierge/baggage handler didn't seem to be the most informed one I've ever seen and had to look a bunch of things up, but I imagine if it is your first visit and you are going to the major sites, you could get the help you needed. One guest was asking about getting a cab, and he said just to hail one, so it sounds like they do not provide that service to guests. Hailing a cab can be intimidating, even for someone like me who has been there a bunch of times, and, since the street is small, there aren't a ton of available cabs cruising by the hotel. Breakfast was typical Comfort Inn - a few hot items and enough for everyone to find something to keep them going for a while. I loved that they did not use those horrible styrofoam plates and cups like some Comfort Inns. Unlike other reviewers, I found the breakfast area to be comfortable and neat.

My room had everything I need - comfortable bed, hot shower, safe, alarm clock. The room was small, which was fine as all I wanted was to shower and sleep. It had a view and occasional noise of a generator but with earplugs I slept well. The staff - outstanding, friendly, and helpful. The continental breakfast was more than continental, and included waffles, eggs, sausages - simple and I'm not sure the eggs were real, but satisfactory to get started in the morning. I didn't come for the breakfast but to shower and sleep in a convenient location for a reasonable price.

We stayed at this hotel for one night a few weeks ago. It was the perfect fit for our needs. Location, comfort, and good service made it awesome. The only thing not so enjoyable was the breakfast. Waffles are great but the syrup was crazy sweet! But this just may be my individual preference. My fiancé said that the eggs and sausage were so-so. Either way, the affordability made it well worth the stay. We will definitely be choosing this hotel for future trips to the city.

I had to attend a photography workshop in Chelsea and this was conveniently located just blocks away..It was easily walkable from Penn Station with lots of good restaurants all around it. 2 Parks within blocks and you could catch the Subway to anywhere. Super clean and I was actually at eye level to the Empire State Building. There is a flea market within the block that charges a dollar and has all sorts of neat things. I will use this hotel next time I stay in NYC.

Last minute business trip to New York. I chose this property because it was close for business and it was relatively inexpensive. I regret staying at this property. Upon check in, the clerk did not make me feel welcomed. The room was clean and the bedding was comfortable though. The bathroom was incredibly outdated and could use a spruce up. The carpet in the room was covering up an uneven floor even with a hole in it! Breakfast - forget about it. You are better off to go to a Starbucks. The breakfast room was dirty. Debris and garbage on the counter with the food. Where is the health department??? The quality of the food - let's just say the food I give my dog is better. Plan ahead. If you need to get somewhere and you are on a high floor where you must take an elevator, plan 20 minutes. The elevators are small and slow. I had luggage and I had to use the elevator from the 6th floor. It took 20 minutes! I almost missed my flight.Overall, spend a little more money and stay elsewhere. I certainly will not stay there again.

Breakfast at the Comfort Inn is far away from passable. If you have a sweat tooth it's for you. Otherwise you are stuck with sweat Frosties, waffles, and donuts. This breakfast is made worse by having plastic cutlery and paper plates, which makes the place seem very cheap. The staff are also not very useful, as they hardly can speak English.In a hotel you expect to be served correct? Well I was told very rudely to put my horrid plastic cutlery and paper plate in the bin, as he put milk into the jug. We were three in a room and had a sofa bed. The sofa bed was like sleeping with a spring in your back. The loo also does not work well, as even putting a tissue down it caused it to become blocked. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for anyone to stay in and when I return to New York City I will not be going to this hotel.

Found this hotel a real bargain in NYC , very close to the empire state building and 5th avenue. Bit of a walk to times square and central park but we walked it most days. The hotel was good and clean and housekeeping was everyday. the room was quite small but this is to be expected in NYC. We had a view of the empire state building from our room. would totally recommend for the money.

Cute hotel hidden in a quiet and very convenient location near the Flatiron building. Pleasant and efficient staff, great free breakfast in a great space. Old but classic and clean hotel. Close to many wonderful restaurants including Eataly and subways to go anywhere else. Reasonable rates and would definitely stay here again.

I have just returned from New York. I stayed at this hotel. It was a very enjoyable stay. This hotel works for me in many ways.1 – Location – Out the front door and to the right and you are at the Flatiron Building. And all the restaurants. Every year they keep improving this area. Always so clean and safe. The Subway is right there to take you uptown or downtown. Madison Square Park is wonderful and of course Shake Shack is there.Out the door and to the left and you are at 6th avenue and the subway at 23rd . I like to walk west over to the Chelsea area. An ever changing place with nice restaurants and interesting things to see. Sometimes I walk down 7th ave. to the Meatpacking area –right below 14th street and all the new restaurants that are opening there.Speaking of restaurants. I like to walk from the hotel over to east 20th and to Gramercy Tavern. One of the great restaurants in NY. Another, is Balthazar’s down on Spring street. Oh so good.2 – The Hotel – This hotel is so well run. The staff are so well trained. I have been in the Hotel/Casino business in Las Vegas for many, many years and I am impressed with how well they do it here. The Manager, Mr. Rahmen can be proud of the team he has put together here. The Front desk staff, all of them, are so polite and helpful. Handled everything I needed. The Maids are very good and Maintenance guys know what they are doing.Each morning, I would check the weather on my iPad using the WiFi which works so well. I headed down to breakfast. As I go to the evaluator I can smell the coffee. The free breakfast is nicely presented and the selection is just right. I like that they have staff there, who are constantly make sure all the food is fresh and ready. The coffee is especially good.So over all, a great trip to NY for me. This hotel played a big part of that. I am 78 years of age now and if I make it to NY next year, this is where I will stay.

Wonderful mid-town Manhattan neighbourhood, right outside the door. Vintage shopping, good restaurants. Subway close. Older building with dated facilities, but very clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful and accommodating. Great breakfast. Really enjoyed our stay.

Stayed in a 2 room, 3 bed family suite. Great for us as we like to have our kids in a separate beds, preferably in a separate room. Room was clean, but the furniture dated. Air conditioning was noisy and had to be turned off overnight, meaning the rooms got hot. Location was fine. Breakfasts were poor quality, and the breakfast room was small, dingy and crowded. We got breakfast out after the first morning. Charge for using the luggage store which seems a little mean.

We arrived at the Hotel which is in a good location neat almost everything that you may need. The rooms though typical of NY do not have a good view unless you are staying in the upper floors ( recommended). The down side of my experience was that there are ongoing renovations happening in the hotel. After a long trip I needed some extra rest only to be woken up by some hammering going on in the next room that was being renovated; that was very disappointing to say the least. The internet connection though was reliable so business could continue out of office. I hope once the renovations are over then the glory of the old hotel will be restored.

I had to stay here because of scarce rooms due to Fashion Week and the US Open Tennis. I booked on Hotwire and paid over $500 to stay in this dump with a broken elevator on a 95 degree day. This is a great location but they need to close and renovate from top to bottom. The room was clean but shabby with the worst lighting ever. Everything is cheaply patched and painted over. Security is non existent and not once was I stopped going through the lobby and up the stairs to the guest room floors. There were constant bags of trash and dirty laundry in the halls. Mostly full of foreign tourists who didn't know how bad this place is compared to other options nearby. It's really a gross, depressing place and Comfort Inns should be ashamed to have their name on this property. The staff was very nice...although they charged me $8 for the use of an umbrella on a pouring day. Don't stay here!

This is a good litlle hotel, in a great location and very reasonably priced. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The rooms are small, but that appears to be standard in New York hotels and there wasn't a view to speak of but, let's face it, who goes to New York to sit in a room looking out the window? Breakfast had more variety than i expected and there was no worry of starting the day on an empty stomach. The location is excellent, being within a short walk of the Empire State Building, Times Square and Madison Square Gardens. It is also close to the subway if you want to travel further afield. Indeed we had no problem getting from JFK to the hotel by subway. This is a great hotel for visiting New York.

This hotel has reasonable price, the location is great. Although it is an older hotel, the beds were good and the rooms clean. I slept peaceful nights without any noise from other rooms.Although most rooms barely have any view worth mentioning, we were lucky to see the Empire State.The location is the perfect for exploring NY by foot and the subway (Madison Square) is just a minute walk.Breakfast is nothing special so we did not bother.Helpful staff, free wifi.

this is a great location, very clean and affordable. People very nice to deal with. The location is suburb - not terribly clogged with tourists, but an easy walk to the Village, Times Square, Herald Center and Murray's Bagels - around the corner from Eately and the Flatiron bldg, and Madison Square Park and the Shake Shack

We got a nice welcome and couldn't fault the staff . Our room was small with a tiny bathroom but the room itself was clean and the maid did a really good job .Outside the rooms the carpets were a little dirty and smelly but this seemed to be an age problem but nothing that should put you off staying here. The reason I rated this very good is mainly for the location . Its near the Empire State Building , in fact we could see it from our room on the 10th floor.Just over the road is Maddison Square park housing the famous Shake Shack .. Great burgers and beer. The wife loved the shakes. Just one tip ..try and miss main meal times as its so good I think most of NYC queue there . I would certainly return to the Comfort Inn. PS .the complimentary breakfasts good.

Staying here was fun and the prices reasonable. An older hotel. The views were not good in out room however we were rarely in the room other than to sleep so not an issue, not spacious however enough room, they do serve breakfast that was pretty good. The air conditioner worked quite well. The staff were friendly and helpful. The Location was great, easy walk to many sites, restaurants and shops as well as transportation. I would stay here again.
user_name:
Chellye E
North Miami Beach, Florida

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights on a recent trip to New York. What was described as a family room just accommodated the 4 of us, but it was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in an old building and the lifts are quite slow which would be a problem if you were on an upper floor. The room rate includes breakfast, this is adequate, but is not the best and I would recommend going out if you want a good breakfast. Overall this was good value and the location excellent.

I've been a few times to NY and stayed in the Time Square area. I chose this location to be closer to other sites we wanted to see. It was a great location. Close to Flat Iron building and park. Subway was very convenient and of course just step out to 5th ave and grab a cab if preferred. Our room was larger than expected. Beds were outstanding. Lots of pillows and plenty of towels. Staff was friendly and ready to answer any questions. The only con was while the breakfast was nice the micro sausage is not good and scrambled eggs were cold.

We required a room that would sleep 5. The room was not large but it did accommodate a family of 5 which is very difficult to find in NYC. The location was good (Times Square Park at Broadway) and there were lots of places to eat locally. There is no view and the rooms small but it worked well for us. I would recommend it for those that simply want a clean place to sleep. Close to subway between 23rd and 28th Ave stops.

This hotel is situated in the best place in New York! 2 minutes walk from Madison Square Park and many tube lines close by, so all interesting places in NY are reachable in no time! Compare to other hotels Comfort Inn Chelsea has a very fair price. Nice beds, nice breakfast, clean rooms and a very very helpfull staff.

Choice hotels is a rip off. I signed up for their services and they booked me in a reservation that was non cancelable and non refundable. I called 1 full month in advanced to cancel my trip due to a change in job placement and relocation to a different state. Customer service at Choice Hotels was less than helpful. They said there were unable to do anything at all and to try calling the hotel. I called the hotel and spoke with a few managers and all of them refused to cancel/refund my reservation, referring me back to Choice Hotels. Apparently this service likes to entrap people and then give them the run around.

Whenever we come into the city we make it a point to stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea. I have stayed here in the past and when my brother and his family were coming in he asked for my best recommendation. I informed him of where I choose to stay. As per his request I was able to make reservations for him also.The location, in and of itself is well worth the total experience. The room accommodations are always first class and the cost is well with in our budget. The Front Desk Staff, Wow what can I say. Precious went out of her way to meet all our needs and sorry to say the young man which I forgot his name took the time to print out maps to get from point A to point B. Larry was another individual who went above and beyond to also meet all our needs. With Outstanding Staff like this why would anyone choose to stay elsewhere. Please share these comments with all three of these individuals. We will continue to support Comfort Inn Chelsea & tell all who come to the city that this is the place to say. By the way, I also do a great deal on TripAdvisor and was recently contacted by another traveler who had questions regarding Comfort Inn Chelsea. Well I'm sure they also had a wonderful stay with you guys. Thanks again, A. R. Trevino

Our room was VERY small and crowded: two double beds, a desk, chair, bureau, nightstand, refrigerator, TV. The door basically opened into the bed. You could barely walk between the beds and furniture. The room was clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Loved the location.

We stayed two nights. The room was very clean! The breakfast was nice. It had hot and cold items. The hotel room was quite small and had two twin beds which worked in my situation, but be sure to check if you need larger.

This hotel is in a fantastic location in Chelsea, easy to find and get around the city as a starting point... it is quite small which is nice...however the rooms, at least mine...was tiny, which I do expect in NYC...but this room was exceptionally tiny... the building is old so the corridors are small and very narrow. I only stayed overnight, so the small accommodation was not really and issue...the room was otherwise clean and the bed was comfortable. I would suggest that managment adjust the room doors/fire doors leading to the elevators, and we were awakened half dozen times by VERY LOUD slamming doors in the hallway. Terrific place for a short stay...

Excellent hotel. Very clean, comfortable beds and pillows, elevators were prompt, nice breakfast included sausage links and scrambled eggs. We stayed in Room 603 (suite that slept 6) and had an excellent view of the Empire State Building. Staff was friendly. No complaints whatsoever. Would stay there again.

This hotel is ideally located and the family suites are great for 2 adults + 2 teenagers. On arrival we got a shock at size of rooms but it is NYC and once settled in they worked really well. Walked most places and flatiron district has a great range of food options.

We have just spent 4 nights at the Comfort Inn, Chelsea. Great location and good value. Breakfast was more than adequate with plenty of choice and my kids loved the waffle maker! The rooms were very clean with plenty of clean towels provided and replaced every day. In room facilities included very efficient air conditioning, security safe, drink making facility, fridge, simple bathroom toiletries. Hotel staff were helpful and assisted with booking taxis and allowing us to leave our luggage after check out (1$ per case) Although this hotel is traditional and dated in style, it possesses some charming original features. Yes, the lift was slow but it didn't matter to us!

Had four nights at the Comfort Inn in June. Firstly the location is great, subway stations a few blocks either side, make it very easy to get around. The hotel is an older building but it is very clean. The lifts may be slow but it is not an irritant. The breakfast choice is not vast but it is adequate. The rooms are not huge but you are not paying a vast price and who goes to NYC to spend a load of time in a hotel room ? The WIFI was brilliant and the staff were great and I would have no problem returning in the future.

We stayed for four nights in June. The reception staff was excellent and the hotel is very clean. It is an older building, but they have maintained it very well. The room was not nearly as small as others I've stayed in in Manhattan. Breakfast is great! The location is two blocks from two different subway lines and one block from Madison Square Park, near the Flatiron Building.

The front desk staff and concierge were both outstanding and thoughtful in their customer service. This is a great location just off Madison Square Park, one of the most beautiful places in New York. There is easy subway access from the hotel.

My partner and I have stayed at this Comfort Inn many times during the last several years. We have never experienced any inconvenience, on the contrary, we have been very pleased with this hotel and its excellent staff. In addition the hotel is situated in a lovely part of Chelsea - very close to Madison Square Park, the Flatiron Building, plus many fine and also very simple dining options. Unlike most hotels that offer a complimentary breakfast, this hotel can handle the volume of guests present. A Fifth Avenue subway is very close and others are readily accessible. My favorite choice for N'YC!

Our family of five stayed at Comfort Inn Chelsea for three nights. We loved our location and rooms. We stayed in a suite that was clean, comfortable and spacious. Our view of the Empire State building was beautiful in the evening. The location was wonderful we walked every day and night. My favorite building was the flat iron because it's by the motel.
user_name:
Laurawfgo D
West Fargo, North Dakota

review_body: I stayed in Comfort Inn in May with my Wife, Biggest mistake ever, Never staying in that horrid place ever again,Before coming to the hotel I called the hotel to get directions, woman on the phone sounded angry and felt like she didn't want to speak to me and put the phone down.I called again a few days after, this time a guy picked up, he was worse. I think they need to go on a customer service training course.After checking in to the hotel we decided to go out for dinner, returning at around 23.00, the air con did not work, so I called the hotel reception, and the receptionist told me there is no maintenance, so I asked to move room, and his reply was, "No",When I complained to the morning staff, apparently nothing has been handed over to them, I was going to stay for 5 nights, but I cut it short, simply because of the attitude, unfriendliness of the staff.There are better hotels round the corner, a lot cheaper.For the management,:- When you can afford to charge so much for a room , I how can you serve people food on plastic plates?!!!! Just Weird!!!. $0.99 store does quality plates!

To start this hotel is a good value for money hotel in New York where rooms are normally tiny and extortionatly priced. The room here had three single beds and was a decent size... minus the bathroom but more on that later. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast which has a decent choice and you can eat as much as you want. The location is pretty good, with our room having a partial view of the empire state building and the flat iron building is just around the corner.The main negative is the outdated decor and bathroom. It is ridiculously tiny and the shower was falling out the wall and kept going hot to cold. There is barely enough room to move around in the bathroom. There are renovations happening there currently so hopefully the decor will be brought up to date. If you can deal with a small bathroom then this hotel is definitely worth giving a try.

We feel we got a good bargain at the Comfort Inn Chelsea during our stay in early June, 2015. The room was small as a lot of rooms in NYC are but the staff was awesome. The breakfast each morning was great with eggs, meat, cereals, & waffles and our room and common areas were clean.It is easy walking distance to Times Square and the underground was just a block away as the hotel is on the corner of Broadway and 25th.I highly recommend the Comfort Inn Chelsea.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea for 6 nights in room 211 with no view. The hotel is good, great location. Rooms not that big, but clean. Since we did not spend a whole lot of time in the room, it wasn't that important. You do get a safe, fridge (which is quite handy) and a coffee machine). Staff is overall friendly and helpfull. We thought the A/C was a bit noisy, but we heard that they are replacing A/C throughout the hotel. The king sized rooms have already been done.What bothered us the most was that with breakfast everything was plastic. The plates, cutlery, cups, everything. In this day and age I don't think a hotel should do this and be more sustainable. Besides the environmental factor you just can't eat normal with a plastic knife. Other than that, I could recommend this hotel. Subway is close by, it is on a great location near the flatiron building, rooms are clean, beds are good. Overall, we had a good stay in a great city.

Staff was nice. Rooms were adequate. Accommodated a group of 31. The elevator is slow and very small.It would have been nice to see a variety in hot breakfast foods. The same sausage links and scrambled eggs were offered each morning of our 4 night stay.
user_name:
Mendie H
Grand Rapids, United States

review_body: First time in New York and this proved to be the perfect location. Easy walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. Rooms are a bit small but who stays in their hotel room in New York other than sleeping. Staff are most helpful and we want to make a special mention of Ashwin & Leanna who helped us out on several occasions.

We found this hotel to be great very affordable and in an excellent position. We walked most places. But was able to use the metro as well. All facilities were great and the bonus of the breakfast was a complete surprise

We needed an economical place to lay our heads while touring some NYC colleges. This hotel is well located, near the Flatiron Bldg, near restaurants and in a neighborhood of antique shops. The lobby architecture is interesting; the clerk told me the building was initially designed as a ballroom with apartments above.

If you want a well centered place with a fine breakfast and an outstanding service: Try this one. My friend and I enjoyed it, and for shore so you do. Where we experiented NY as expensive, this is a bargain and cosy as well. As an extra there's next door a delicious and very good restaurant with the name 'TASTE GOOD'. You'll get a huge portion of fine food for little money from mrs. Miao Chang Ma. We loved her. So don't hasitate: go!

I liked this place, although the rooms were incredibly small.However, the room is only for sleeping anyway.The location is killer and the price is very reasonable.Was here for son's graduation from NYU and its location was great.Could use some more outlets in the rooms.Staff very nice.Free HOT breakfast was a bonus, as was fridge in room.Paying per minute to use the Business Center is a downer, as well as charging $1 per bag to keep bags after checkout and the 11AM checkout time were all demerits.

Comfort Inn Chelsea is located within walking...subway.. bus distance of anything you would want to see in New York. The staff are helpful. Breakfast is filling and the rooms are clean and pleasant. We chose it for location and were satisfied when we stayed there the first time. When we return to New York, and we will, we will stay at the Chelsea Comfort Inn again.Many places to eat at various prices. Good pick for us

We arrived to the hotel in the morning after a long flight with our 4 year-old child that was very tried and needed an early check in. We were first asked to pay extra 575$ for a few hours and at the end we paid extra 369 $ since we had no choice. Altogether we paid 740$ for 28 hours stay. Other disappointing points: 1. The stuff was unhelpful and unfriendly. 2. Breakfast was poor and served on plastic disposable plates, forks and knifes. 3. The bathroom was small and not properly equipped. 4. We were charged for more money to leave our baggage at the hotel for an hour after the check out.

I usually stay at the Wyndham when I have to spend the night for work, but because of Comfort Inn's cheaper prices, I decided to try it out. Not only were the rooms bigger, but they were exceptionally clean. I got a room with 2 single beds because of availability, but there was still ample room. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were very soft, and the shower pressure was good. There was a window air conditioning unit so the room was nice and cool. Each morning, there is complimentary breakfast (eggs, sausage, waffles, bagels, coffee, etc.) which is constantly refreshed by the staff. I have already recommended this location to my colleagues and will definitely stay here in the future. Thanks!

My friends and I checked in on Wednesday, 4/22. Room was small, but we expected that in NYC. The man at the front desk at the time was extremely helpful, so it was a good first impression. We had no issues throughout our stay - room was cleaned every day and everything in our room was in working order. When it came time to leave, the man at the desk at the time (same man who checked us in) got us all set up for luggage storage until we returned before our flight. This was Sunday, 4/26. When we came back to get our luggage and wait for our van pick-up, the shifts changed, and the young man who took over the front desk was awful.
