He spoke disrespectfully to the other staff who were present, was very loud so that we could hear everything, and then sat on the phone with someone discussing homework problems/solutions. I found this very unprofessional, as it does not give a good impression to anyone in the lobby. *** Additionally, the van service that the hotel had set up had a horrible driver - he turned corners so fast that we nearly fell out of our seats and we could hear our luggage tipping over in the back of the van. When he opened the back doors at the airport, my suitcase was completely upside down, wheels in the air. I would not recommend that van service, or at least that driver, to anyone.

Our room(s) was clean and orderly. We actually had two rooms. One with a king bed, and one with two queens. We entered into the room with two queens, and there was another bedroom to the right with the king, and a very small bathroom off that bedroom. The beds were comfortable. For the room price, it was fine. The carpet was worn. The hotel overall felt dated and worn. But again, we weren't paying top dollar. And the staff were very, very nice. I'm not sure I would return, but I certainly think this is the perfect hotel for people on a budget.

The customer service, from every employee (front desk, housekeeping, etc) was fantastic. Always make sure we were comfortable and everything we needed!I was surprised at the size of the room, considering we were in NYC. You could actually move around!!Best part of it all is that it is walking distance to EVERYTHING yet still in a trendy residential area. Enjoy NYC at your pace at this hotel!

When I made arrangements directly with the Hotel I told them that I was in town for the 5 Boro Tour and that my brother and I would have 2 bikes with us. They assured us, that the bikes were no problem, come on down.Well we got to the Hotel and they were not aware of the bikes; however they were so accommodating. They put our bikes down in the boiler room, locked and safe.Although the rooms were small (this is New York) the Staff’s accommodating demeanor was large and lovely! The rooms were clean, the WiFi worked, and the breakfast was perfect!! We loaded up on waffles each morning with a cold glass of juice and a hot coffee.
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Frieda L
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. When we first arrived they had us booked into a smoking room (wasn't their fault, it was our travel agent that failed to stipulate a non-smoking room). The Front Desk person (Leanne) was very helpful in trying to find us a comparable non-smoking room on the 11th floor. The rooms are a good size (by NYC standards), very clean, updated, wifi was free and worked well, and best of all - the King sized bed was absolutely comfortable. As most reviewers have already stated, the location is excellent! We've been to NYC several times and we found the Chelsea area to have many good restaurants and it's perfectly situated for what we like to do while in the city. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn for 4 nights in April 2015. For New York City, it was inexpensive, especially since breakfast was included (eggs, yogurt, pastries, waffles, fruit, juice). Our room was very tiny with only one chair for 2 people but we weren't there to stay in the room. The halls were narrow and the elevator quite slow but we didn't consider this a problem. Desk personnel were extremely helpful. Wifi was free and worked well. A subway station was about a block away and it was a short walk to Penn Station.

Chelsea Comfort Inn is a boutique type hotel. We had very good service at the hotel, as well as a nice breakfast each morning.The location in Chelsea is great! Our king size bed was very, very comfortable. The room is small and very clean. We only had one problem and that was with the concierge service. The Hotel is currently working to fix that issue with the contractor.

Room was very quiet, clean and well appointed. The staff was more than helpful and the concierge went beyond his duties to be helpful when I needed it. The location was convenient for me and the area felt very safe as I walked many blocks alone. If I return to NYC this is where I will stay.

This is a pretty decent place to stay with rooms that are clean and a friendly staff. Decent breakfast in the morning. The only problem was working with the concierge - we really feel like we were taken so be careful. This was mentioned to the hotel management and they told us they were not part of the hotel but were concerned with our issues and were going to talk the company that runs the concierge. An example was when ordering a taxi they called a small bus for three of us and charged $50 for the short trip to Penn Station - should have been $10 for a taxi!!!Overall good hotel and good location.

The room was comfortable enough, but it was a smoking room and whatever I tried to do to change it was not in the cards for me. So I bought a bottle of Febreze and sprayed down the room, after that all was well. They do serve breakfast in the morning in a really small room considering how many people were staying at the hotel it was way to small and not enough seating, so we ate elsewhere. Great location for everything though and I think that was the best part of our staying at this Comfort Inn.

Maybe this was just a one time fluke and the stars were not aligned right. I like just having a basic room sometimes when in NYC because I know I am not going to stay in the room for hours except when sleeping. But when it is over $225 a night then ...wellI was ok at first even with the tiny tiny elevators, worn carpet, concierge desk latched together with extension cords underneath and an ok hotel location. The room key pad to our first room did not work. The second room had smoke burns. Yet I am still saying to myself, you are ok.But when there was no hot water, we had enough.Front desk staff are just and only doing their job. I can understand but the cleaning staff had more personality and willingness to assist you without you having to ask. Again, maybe the stars were just not aligned for the hotel this weekend.
user_name:
K J
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We loved our stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea - it was just perfect for what we needed. Finding a room with three twin beds was just amazing for me and my daughters as usually most have two double beds and someone has to share and someone gets a bed to themselves. We also loved the location so convenient to the subway and not just one line but two - we used the yellow and orange also the entire time. We also loved the restaurants in your area. We didn't have any issues with the wifi in our room and our view was wonderful- we enjoyed watching many things right from our room. We appreciated breakfast but could have had a few more hot choices besides eggs/sausage everyday. Having a safe and refrigerator in our room was really nice - the only item that we could also have used was a microwave but I did come to the breakfast area during the day to heat up a few things so not bad. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a place in NYC. I also thought the price was great especially being in the Chelsea area and so close to so many things we wanted to do. Thanks again for making our vacation one to remember.

Just in NYC for one night and this hotel suited us perfectly. Two double beds and enough space in the room for 2 adults and 2 kids (6 and 8). The room itself was typical for NYC (on the smaller side, no view) and furnishings a bit dated but clean, comfortable and fine for a night. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise - for a free breakfast we were just expecting pastries but were pleased to find good bagels and DIY waffles among other things - so a great deal for 4 people! The best thing about the hotel is the location - right by the Flatiron Building and subway. We walked across to the Highline and down Broadway to Union Square. There's a Whole Foods nearby as well.

First off, the WiFi stinks. Other than that, it's not bad...nice bathrooms, beds; decent breakfast, and everyone is very helpfull. Depending on the room you can get a view of the Empire State Building. I would come back to this hotel, oh! It is centrally located too!

In November 2014 I met my daughter and her friend for a few days holiday in New York.While the hotel rooms are small, they are clean and the included breakfast is a good start to your day .The staff,location and price make it worthwhile to stay. We were able to walk most sites of interest or take a short subway ride . It is close to shopping areas as well and the Flatiron district.I booked through CAA and got a nice discount.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel . When I made my reservation I mentioned that a room with a view would be nice. After allowing me to check in early, I went upstairs to my room and found an awesome view of the Empire State building. Comfortable bed, good shower and toilet also. All the staff I encountered were really nice and helpful. The hotel was nice and quiet in an excellent location with easy access to subways . I go to NYC twice a year on a limited budget. After staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania, Hotel Stanford and La Quinta I gave this place a try and I'm glad I did. Easily the best of the bunch. Will definitely stay here agaon !

I stayed at this hotel from Jan-10 thru the 18th, 2015. I was very happy with my stay and my overall experience at this location in Chelsea. The entire hotel staff was a joy to deal with, very nice and professional. The front desk staff were all very nice to me and I really appreciate that. The room was comfortable, clean and warm. It was very cold outside but very comfortable inside my room. The location is awesome, literally 3 short blocks to a subway station that takes you everywhere. Awesome places to eat nearby by the hotel as well as a bunch of local restaurants, cafes, fast food places and much more to choose from. The area is excellent for shopping and sight seeing. I really liked where this hotel is located. Again, I had an AWESOME experience. Yes, I will be staying here again. Thank you very much for making my stay very memorable. Please keep up the great work. Have a nice day !!Carlos F. . .

Good hotel for the price. The bathroom was very clean and tidied each day.Lovely bed and bedding. Free breakfast adequate to start day. I would use this hotel if I travelled to America again in the future

positivessuperb location - 1 minute walk to 23rd st metro, walking distance to penn station, great resaturants around pretty view of empire state building if you step out the hotelgood breakfast for a budget hotel, nothing flash but then, provided you know how to manage your expectations you will be fine - doughnuts, pastries, toast, cereal, waffles, eggs, sausages, porridgeprice - great price for central Manhattan. comfy beds , quiet room - no noise at allfree tea and coffee in the lobby all day / speedy and free wifi in all areas - water pressure was good and the water was nice and hot.room was spotless and the maid knew how to make beds properlyDownsides - room was quite cold, although it was -15oC outside, heating was quite noisy - once under blankets was ok though - concierge were happy to provide extra blankets.

This is a very old hotel that has had a modest make over. Very modest. My room was so small that I felt like I was on a cruise ship. The window overlooked the air conditioning unit that was located between four brick walls. The staff was not terribly friendly and when I went to check out there was NO ONE at the desk. I waited over 10 minutes before someone finally came to the desk. Also the breakfast does not start until 7:00 a.m. If you are lucky they will open on time but there is also a chance that they will open even later. Having an early start to my day I missed it twice due to late opening. The room where the breakfast is served was freezing cold; obviously this is a problem because there were space heaters in there but they should have been turned on at 6:00 during such a frigid spell. The location is good and the price is cheap so if you are not fussy about amenities its a good value. Very clean.

Recently stayed at the comfort inn great location approx 200 yrs from madison square park and the impressive flatiron building , a great location for the subway at 23 rd st ,very close to empire state building . The rooms are small but they are very clean the beds are comfy along with the pillows there is a free safe ,fridge coffee machine and flat screen tv . The bathroom is probably the smallest I have ever seen ,but you only use for sleeping as you are out and about all the time . The staff are very friendly are polite nothing to much trouble . The free breakfast is a great start for the day and there is free tea and coffee in the reception would definitely stay here again if in nyc

This is a no frills hotel that is in a good location. We found the price and central location made it easy to get to every where we had on our agenda. Our room was very tiny but worked for the three of us, a three generation girl trip. We were not lucky to get a room with a view as the fourth floor only had a tiny window you could not see out of. My suggestion would be to make sure you had a room on the 6th floor or higher as those rooms are nicer and you can see the outside from what we noticed. Breakfast was very good and the dining room cheery. Staff was friendly but not too knowledgeable when we asked for directions. Wi Fi did not work the best from our room but it worked fine in the lobby and they had a computer there to use for a small fee also. Over all a decent hotel and we liked the proximity to the attractions.

Just woke up from a great nights sleep. The room was the cleanest I have ever seen in a Hotel. This old building is extremely well taken care of. Huge plus is a nice size small fridge. Room wasn't huge but we didn't come here to spend hours in it. Nice fresh free breakfast and 24 hrs free coffee and tea in lobby. We didn't have a good view from window but ohhh well.

Almost no room to move around. Bathroom very tiny, shower stall only. Little frayed but very clean. Good lighting. Breakfast so-so. Discount parking available but werent told in advance. Hampton inn nearby better choice, if prices comparable.

We had reservations here for one night the weekend prior to Christmas. Our train arrived at Penn Station at 9:30 am. Our plan was to walk to the hotel and have them hold our bags while we did some touring. When we arrived at the hotel, we were immediately greeted by the desk staff and asked if we were checking in. We were pleasantly surprised that our room was available and we would be able to put our bags in our room and get things situated before leaving for the day. The hotel is fairly centrally located. On Saturday, we walked to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and part of 5th Ave. We attended a basketball game at Madison Square Garden that got done around 11:30pm. We easily and safely walked back to the hotel after the game. Sunday morning the concierge suggested a route to the Metropolitan Museum of Art - walk around the corner, go two blocks and take the R or N subway to 5th Ave and then walk the rest of the way. When at the subway entrance a nice young guy suggested another route which was better and did work out well. This is the first time we have stayed right in the city and we were surprised by how small the rooms were. We had a room with one queen bed that had just enough room to walk on either side, a small stand that holds a mini- refrigerator, a small closet with a mirrored door, a dresser that doubles as a TV stand and small desk and chair. The bathroom is also quite small. The only two negatives of the room and it made the stay less comforting was that there was no heat in the bathroom and the heater in the room noisily cycled on and off throughout the night. The tiled bathroom floor was freezing and very uncomfortable when getting out of the shower and whenever using the bathroom. We tried to leave the door open so heat would get in the room, but when doing so, the door blocked the heater that was in the window. It was easy to hear others come and go and we could hear the TV in the room next door that was left on all night. The breakfast room was clean with the typical Choice Hotel breakfast provided. The food was well-stocked on a busy Sunday morning. Overall, we found the location and staff to be excellent, the price was comparable to others in the area and I think what we got for the money was probably typical for a NYC hotel. If you are in fairly decent shape, you can walk to many attractions from this hotel.

Older hotel structure but they have maintained it. It was centrally located allowing us access to the subway and walking distance to anywhere. Includes a very nice breakfast and all the staff were extremely helpful. Plan to stay here again on my next stay.

This hotel is well maintained, clean, and well managed. It has the character of a 105 year building yet is in great shape. It is about 1/2 walk from Times Square, or 3 stops on the R train. Well located for train transportation which is easy to navigate. Breakfast bar is really great, and there is shuttle service to the airports. Great restaurants within walking distance. I would recommend it and stay again. Also has concierge service which was a great help.

excellent location and value for the price. Highly recommend this location and will stay here again when in New York. We had a family room and this worked really well with four ladies travelling together.

The Comfort Inn in Chelsea is affordable, simple, and well located in Manhattan. Nothing special except, maybe, the nifty old ceilings in the lobby and the sparkly chandeliers in the breakfast room. It has the feeling of having once been a tad more elegant.My daughter and I needed a place to stay in the upper East Side. Not being wealthy, we had to settle for Chelsea, but picked a hotel very close to the #6 subway, which got us to the Upper East Side in less than 15 minutes (including the walk to the subway stop). Did I say "settle"? In fact, I'm very happy with the location, as it is a block away from Madison Square Park, on the edge of which I stumbled onto Eataly, an amazing food emporium of all things Italian. Not far either from the Flatiron Building or the High Line. Also a great quilt shop and contemporary quilt gallery (City Quilter). Walking the hotel's street (25th) latish at night was a bit spooky -- not many people, but we had no issues.As for the room, it was wonderfully quiet, somewhat small, especially the bathroom, and clean. The beds (two twins) were quite comfortable.My rating for this nifty hotel would have been a 4, but the one complaint we had is the same as for some other guests: the heating is erratic. The electric heater/A/C worked well enough, but the heat didn't quite reach into the bathroom. One suggestion for the hotel's next round of renovations: new windows and/or an additional pane of glass in the windows. The draft from the windows was pretty bad, especially with the cold wind outside. If major renovations are ever in the works, then a new heating system might be in order. Then again, with the price as reasonable as it is, I can put up with the erratic heat; after all, I slept quite well after walking around the Big Apple all day.I would recommend for those who like to travel as we do: cheap, quiet and reasonably comfortable.

Checking in was easy, concierge was helpful, room was small (as expected in NYC) but very comfortable and quiet (even on the 2nd floor), free Wi-Fi speed was average for hotels, and breakfast was good (we enjoyed the fruits, sausages, and make-your-own waffles the best). Subway is a good way to get around but the subway system is old. You need to read the signs carefully before entering because different lines (even the same line in opposite directions) at a station are not necessary accessible between them. It is cheaper to get a MetroCard ($1 for the card and $2.50 per ride) than buying single-ride tickets ($2.75 per ride) if you take more than 5 rides. One MetroCard can be shared by multiple people (you just hand it to the next person after you have entered). Listen to announcements carefully because some trains are express and they skip stations. Dinners can be expensive but many restaurants offer deep discounts during lunch time. For example, Grotta Azzurra in Little Italy (177 Mulberry St) offers a pasta and an entree for $9.95 (half-price compared to dinner) and it was delicious. Take a walk across the Brooklyn bridge - it is fun and free.

I was pleasantly surprised by the positive experience that I had at Comfort Inn Chelsea since my last trip. The whole customer experience has improved. The front desk is much more professional, the breakfast room staff is friendly and housekeeping is much more efficient than before. The room was surprisingly less noisy than my last trip.I really enjoy the convenience of this property to restaurants, shops and the subway. I would return again.

I have just returned from my NY. Again, I stayed here and it was very nice. The hotel is clean and so well run. My room was so well set up and everything worked. I love the new electrical outlets on the desk to charge my iPad and iPhone. I used the Wi-Fi every day. Again, the breakfast is so inviting and so well done. A great way to start the day. The location is just right for me. Out the door and to the right and your at the Flatiron building and Madison Square park. There are restaurants all around the area..The Subway is right there on 23rd street. Out the Hotel door and to left and down to 6th ave and there is a subway and bus stops all around. You can walk over to 7th and 8th and your in the Chelsea area. I like to walk down to 14th street and the Meatpacking area, so interesting and of course it's wonderful restaurants.I have been in the hotel/Casino business in Las Vegas for many, many years and I feel right in saying that this hotel is so well run. The staff are so well trained and do their job so well. The Front Desk people are friendly and helpful. Every question is answered and I got what ever I needed. The Maid service was spot on. For the first time I used the Concierge to set up my return limo to JFK and it went well. I am 77 years of age now and if I am able to travel to NY again, this is where I will stay.

I stayed here for 4 nights for work. The room was small but quiet and comfortable. There was a lot of kids staying there (school trips?). You have to get up early to get any breakfast. If you go later than 7 then the room is overflowing and lines. Overall however for location and helpfulness of staff it deserves a 5! :)

Good room. Clean. Tiny bathroom but functional. Had to make sure bathroom door was fully shut when we left room otherwise main room door would not open...very quiet and very close to flat iron buidling and subways. Has coffee maker and fridge which was appreciated. Would stay there again.

We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2014 and had a very comfortable stay. Since we were 3 adults, we opted for the room with 3 separate single beds and it worked out very well. The total cost was $780 odd incl taxes as well as a nice breakfast - excellent value for money in Manhattan! And so close to Broadway / 5th Ave, Eataly, etc.The room was on 10 th floor (1002 I think) and the wi-fi was very good as well. We were also very happy with the room service - the daily change of bed sheets etc. The room often got a bit tight for space and the bathroom was indeed small - but this is Manhattan - so no issues at all.It was amazing that they were able to fit in a working desk as well in this small room !Heartily recommended.

We stayed here for five nights and were pleased with our room in 6th floor. The cleaning of our room were satisfying, coffee/tee and other aminities in the bathroom, the breakfast buffet was not impressive, but gave me a good start every day, but best of all was the location of the hotel. We were able to do much sightseeing and shopping just by walking around. Buses, subways and Penn Station just around the corner, or the next. Madison Square Park, at the corner, had a fantatsic food-festival while we were in NYC mid September. It last's for a qouple of weeks more. I highli recomend a visit, snack, meal or drink. Good atmosphere!I can recomend this hotel to other travellers looking for a central and easy hotel in Manhattan.

Nice location, a few blocks away from the Empire State Building. From our room we had a nice view on it! Also close to the subway, but the best thing to do is to walk. We were there in January and the room was very, very cold. It had to be heated with the air-conditioning machine and that just wasn't enough to heat the whole room. Breakfast was good, there was a lot to choose from.

This hotel was a decent one to stay in during our time in NYC. The rooms and breakfast were relatively basic, however the essentials are all there to set you up for a day of travel/sightseeing. The rooms themselves were clean and comfortable; we experienced no problems during our stay. The hotel is not luxury, but definitely provides a good level of service.

Me and my husband stayed here recently so spend some time seeing New York. The location of this hotel is excellent. It is a stone's throw away from the Flat Iron Building, 15 mins walk from the Empire State Building and 5 mins walk away from various subway stations. The rooms are clean, breakfast spread is good and staff are very courteous and helpful. Elevators are loud and shaky, as it is an old building. Overall, a very comfortable stay.

We arrived several hrs prior to the 3 pm check in. They stored our bags and made arrangements for both parties in our room to get keys upon separate return to the hotel. The staff was very accommodating. Free breakfast was enough to get your day started. Nothing fancy. It was very tight for four people but it was a clean place to shower and sleep! How much are you in your hotel in NYC anyway? Very code to Madison Sq Park and Eataly. Broadway and Fifth Ave on either side can take you Pretty much anywhere you want. Very close to Subway station.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea during a recent trip to NYC. This hotel is in a great location. The room and bathroom were very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. We had a great hot breakfast every morning before we started out. Our son was in a wheelchair during our visit, and we were upgraded to a larger room to accommodate the wheelchair. The hallways were narrow, but I hear that is very common for NYC. We were able to walk to nearly all of our sight seeing destinations, or catch the subway to those a bit further away. Great trip and great NYC hotel.

This Comfort Inn is in an excellent location. It is mere steps away from Madison Square Park where 5th Avenue crosses Broadway and 23rd Street. Was able to see filming of a Dunkin Doughnuts commercial here as well as the filming of scenes from CBS Person of Interest. The hotel is close to subway stations on either corner with 23rd street and 5th or 6th Avenues. Close to food places like Olive Garden, Fairway, Chinese restaurant next door and Hill Country Fried Chicken. Comfortable bed, clean rooms and very helpful staff make this hotel good for return visit. Was able to get some names of excellent staff Loraine, Mike, Mr Patel, Esperancia. But staff was really helpful, pleasant and courteous. Breakfast was decent to get you going for the day. Rooms a bit small, but this is Manhattan. Hotel a bit dated but clean and comfortable.

Excellent location, close to restaurants, subwayClean net rooms, exceptional staff, great breakfastFree Wi-FiWould stay here again and I recommend this hotel, good for families too.Comfy beds, hot shower

Let me start by saying that over the years I've used TripAdvisor reviews,opinions,maps etc. and enjoyed the places I've stayed,sites visited and numerous nuggets in locations like Paris, Morocco, Seville, Tangiers, Provence, Big Sur etc. but have neglected to write back.Recently spent 5 days in NYC travelling from NorCal specifically Napa, CA meeting family visiting from elsewhere....and decided to give back.First, from JFK to your hotel in Manhattan let me suggest Supershuttle shared vans. $20.00 plus a tip gets you right to your doorstep. The NY subway is GREAT (a/c trains,not stations) but NOT with luggage,at $2.50 a ride use it everywhere once you're in. Had to meet family and a party in Hoboken (New Jersey) for the World Cup final (Germany v. Argentina 1-0 in a great game) and the PATH train to NJ (NY subway doesnt go) was 3 blocks away from the hotel! There (and back after) in a flash.By the way, the water from the faucet in NY is delicious! Refilled my water bottle umpteen times. The elevator is tight but being on the 9th floor (room 904) with a view of the Empire State Building it was a good thing after walking miles everyday and night. Breakfast in the mornings was OK to get you off. Lots to eat and drink all around for any budget you please. Pizza by the slice at 2 Brothers down the block for a dollar late at night....nice and cheesy too!The Chelsea Comfort Inn is steps away from Madison Square Park (Shake Shack mmmm burgers and shakes), great people watching and a good place to plan,Eataly is a fun, fine Italian market, produce and food eat-in, Eisenberg's Sandwich spot, Flatiron building, short walk to the superb albeit touristy Hi-Line park....superb landscaping and views. The 40-40 Sports Club (Jay Z and partners) is on the corner 25th/Broadway and a good sports bar. Went to see Derek Jeter and the MLB AllStar game, poor crowd, nonchalant service, but was told the focus is NFL and NBA ....Walk friendly, people nice enough with directions etc, even telling me how best to maximize use of my new camera. Chelsea, considered mid-Manhattan is close via subway to uptown to Central park, all the Museums, Times Square, Harlem and downtown to the FI-Di (Wall ST, 9/11 Memorial recently opened and very worth it). .........take the ferry to Statue Liberty and Ellis Island....eat at Noodletown NY in Chinatown, Ruchi's Indian near 9/11 site, good and half price at lunch...what,yes true and good too...I could go on.....but go there yourself and see why NYC is my new favorite city in the world!!!

Room 206: The room was small (approx 12' x 20') yet presentable. Beds, room and service were great. However because this was a smoking room, carpet felt strange beneath naked feet. The window had little light coming from the tiny courtyard-like space. Front desk service was great when room cards needed reprogramming. Free breakfast consisted of orange and apple juices, coffee and tea, cereal, bread, muffins, Danish, waffle maker.We stayed Wednesday through Sunday. We are non-smokers and stayed in a smoking room due no availability. On Friday evening, we smelled Marijuana in the hallway. Room 206 is surrounded by elevators, so the smell came from the nearby room. On Saturday night and Sunday night we could smell cigarettes. I could not sleep properly due to smell. I tried turning on washroom fan and A/C to full blast but to no avail. I did not know that Me, my wife and my young kids would have to deal with second hand smoke...I blame building for poor circulation-- it's old.The refrigerator in our room did not work. Our room had two twin beds and a small couch (loveseat) that was a pull out but no mattress within. I had registered only 2 of my 3 kids since it's hard to get any hotel that accommodates 2 adult and 3 kids.This booking was a cost saving measure on my part. We made use of the sofa cushions onto floor and made our extra "bed". The location is superb for a reasonable price. It is walking distance to shops, to subway, Broadway, Penn (NYP) Station, Empire State Building.Aside from alcoholics nearby and smell of urine on street, and the faint sawing and hammering we heard in our hotel room during our second night at 1 am, it was an ok stay.

This is great location. I thought the bed was comfortable but daughter thought mattress was too springy. Plenty of room for an affordable New York hotel for 4. Room was quiet. Breakfast was fine. Love the waffles. Nice selection especially eggs and sausage.The staff maintained the eggs, sausage and waffles, with only 20-30 minutes left of service. They have two elevators both were slow. Subway stations are at 23th st and also 28th. In no time we were at Times Square, Central Park, Museums, shopping, Statue of Liberty or Empire State Building. The staff was very knowable. The Eataly is around the corner. It is a must to visit. Also try Shake Shack for hamburgers.

Location, location, location…This hotel exceeded my expectations. It is safe to say all rooms in this hotel are not created equal. I think we got one of the best rooms. We faced the street directly across from a cathedral and we had a view of the Empire State Building just slightly off to the side – very nice. It may have made a difference that we made our reservations early, stayed four nights and are members of the hotel’s frequent quest program. Having the breakfast buffet is a plus because it is NYC and visitors have lots to do. We were able to walk to our Broadway play and nearby restaurants. Subways are very close by as well. We took a taxi from LaGuardia airport but I did see that one can take an airport shuttle. We took one other taxi but then used the subway or walked to where we wanted to go. I used to live in the City so I am somewhat familiar with the subway routes but I think an adventurous person could figure out the subway system.One pleasant surprise was that one well-known food store, Fairway Market, has a location just around the corner from the hotel. It has prepared food in addition to healthy, grocery selections. Note that sometimes it is crowded because I think it is a local favorite. Luckily, right across the street from Fairway is another small store, Sunac fancy food, which also has prepared food and we enjoyed snacks there as well.Another convenience was a nearby dry cleaner, Digital Cleaners on West 26th St. I had one item, I prepaid and they delivered it to the hotel the next day. (I love New York.)Staff was great. Regarding the hotel room I expected “okay” and got “very nice.” Note we did have a door to what could be an adjoining room but we didn't hear any noise until the last day and it wasn't a big deal. We’d definitely stay at Comfort Inn Chelsea again.

I stayed here with some family upon a recent vacation to NYC. The hotel is in a great central location and is close to the subway so getting around the city is easy. The staff here were great and they went above and beyond to provide excellent service. One day we were trying to buy tickets online for the 911 Memorial and Museum and the computers in the business center happened to be down. The staff went out of their way to process the transaction for us on the hotel computer behind the desk, which they certainly didn't have to do. Everyone was friendly and helpful. There were 6 of us and we had two adjoining rooms and one bathroom. The beds were comfortable and we really didn't hear much street noise at all. We had a great view of the Empire State Building too, which made it extra nice. It's not the fanciest hotel, but they do keep it up and keep it clean. It was just what we needed for a family vacation and we were glad to be able to all stay together in one room. We had a fridge in the room too so that came in handy to keep drinks and snacks cool. The free breakfast was also a nice extra and one of the reasons we chose this hotel in the first place. Overall, we had a great stay here and I would definitely stay here again upon my next visit to NYC.

Moderately priced good location. Breakfast was ok. Sausage was nasty. It irritated me that I paid what I did but yet they wanted to charge me to use the computer? They wanted to charge me per minute and per page printed out? Not good business.

Great little hotel. Service is perfectly fine. It's not the best or most modern hotel I have stayed in New York but it was definitely the largest (Room 606). Two doubles, a pull out couch, small fridge and plenty of room to get ready, particularly when sharing. Room was quiet, even though we were beside two elevators. The location is between two subway stations and close to both trader joe's and another grocery store for in-room refreshments. TIPS: For wine, I would head to the Chelsea Wine Cellar @ W.21st and 7th. They have a good selection and decent prices. If you plan on using the subway more than 6 times, buy an unlimited 30 day ride car for $30. Check out EATALY. It is right beside the flatiron building and houses great restaurants, a roof top bar and gelateria.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn for two nights for a convention. The location of the hotel cannot get any better. Everything else very close to the hotel and it was so easy to get around. The hotel itself was nice, clean and accommodating. Our room had two double beds, a sofa and it had plenty of room for us and our luggage. There was a great air conditioner which doubled as a noise filter, because our room was pretty much sound-proof. The bathroom was a bit small but the shower was great and everything functioned very well. No issues at all. There was a mini-fridge in the room along with an iron and a full sized ironing board. I would definitely stay here again if visiting NY because you cannot beat the location and the price.The breakfast was not too bad - you can definitely find something to satisfy you unless you are just completely never satisfied anyway. Fresh fruit, yogurt, hot waffle press, sausage, eggs, hard-cooked eggs, excellent endless coffee and juice. And the sitting room was nice. The staff was very nice and they were cleaning all the time.

The only interest of this hotel is, basicaly, the location. Time Square is at 15 minutes (as Penn Station), the Empire State building and the Flatiron are at the corner.Except that, it's the worst hotel I ever been to. The staff is not smily. When you ask a question because there is a small problem, they try to explain it's their first day. The breakfast is poor quality with plastic cattlery which makes you feel that you are in the camping. And the rooms are so tiny that you can even put more than 2 pieces of luggage anywhere.

Not quite sure if this was the comfort inn I stayed at but if the others are up to this standard of service they were wonderful.An older lady travelling alone stranded by Tornadoes down south in NY on around 29th of may and stressed to all blazes they welcomed me at 1 oclock in the morning made sure I was fine and showed me to a very comfortable room and a gentleman by the name of Charles looked after me as his own Mum.The room was extremely comfortable and not overpowering as the name said Comfort Inn.

well located, rooms are small but if you intend to spend the whole day off and really enjoy NYC, that is more than enough. Breakfast is free but, again, that could not be different than that, w/ very few opptions. We had no issues w/ the free Internet.

Location is the biggest plus, close to major attractions (midtown, downtown).. in walking distance to tourist attractions, .... Friendly staff.. Hotel needs a little TLC in the way of cleaning, dusting and a general well kept appearance.

Stayed here with a school party. Clean, nice contemporary rooms, friendly enough and a very good breakfast, although very busy so best to get down early. Great location too. Easy to walk into the centre of Manhattan from here

Good location within stones throw of subwayCan walk to a lot of places from here too such as time square, empire state building, grand central station Room was comfy with 2 big beds Breakfast was hectic but we went easter weekend so was fullWould recommend and stay here againStaff on reception helpful

I just wanted to say that I just returned to Canada this morning after spending 4 nights at this hotel. The last time was almost two years ago. And it was even better than the last time! We were treated very well, with the staff continuing to be super friendly and helpful, it's clean, comfortable and again, couldn't be more centrally located to everything within walking distance. They have kept the hotel up appearance wise, with some new changes to the breakfast room for the better (more seating), and I can't get over how knowledgeable the staff all are about restaurants, places to visit, routes to take via transit/taxi etc. Kudos to the staff! You helped make our stay AGAIN a fabulous experience in Manhattan. We wish we could have stayed longer. Appreciate the little extras you did when asked (something as simple as bringing us some toiletries we had forgotten at home and we were in a hurry to get to a meeting and couldn't get out to a store to get them---one phone call and in minutes we had what were needed), the smiles and sense of humour. Thanks! Will definitely be back.

Stayed here on a geography field trip for a week. The hotel is in a prime location just moments from Broadway. The food at breakfast was good and the staff were very friendly. It was clean and comfortable and the air con in the rooms was a welcome additionThere is also a nice little flea marker opposite once a week where you can get your hands in some awesome retro american memorabilia.

Pleasantly surprised, great location, close to Penn Station, a block from Madison Square Park and Original Shake Shack, yum by the way. Around the corner from the Flat Iron Building, and on the corner was Hills Country Fried Chicken, another great food find. Walking distance to just about all the New York tourist sights. The only time we took the subway was to go downtown to the Freedom Tower, the E will take you right to it. And the station was only a couple of blocks from the hotel. The rooms were big enough for the 4 of us, 2 full size beds and a pull out couch.The rooms were clean, nothing fancy but how long are you really in it. And a full breakfast was included. Eggs, sausage, cereal, fruit, pastries, toast, bagels, coffee, juice, and make your own waffles. Definitely would stay again.

I came with my group of 44 sixth form students and 8 other adults and saw most all of the rooms the students shared. They had more room than the equivalent European hotels and the beds are very comfortable. The decor may not be exactly up to the minute but rooms and bathrooms are clean and the showers work efficiently. The desk staff were always courteous and helpful and the breakfasts and the space to eat them in are an improvement on 2011 - the last time we visited NYC. The location makes this hotel the best choice of all the ones I was offered by my school tour company and the museums and sights are easy to get to via the various subway lines nearby. Lots of restaurant choices and trendy shops, cafes and bars within walking distance. It can be quite noisy outside but that's New York. This hotel is used to having groups but there were plenty of people staying that were just families or individuals and if you prefer to spend your money on what you do rather than where you stay, then I would recommend Comfort Inn Chelsea. For anyone organising a group tour, especially students, this hotel has much to recommend it, not least the accommodating staff.

If you're main criteria is to save a few bucks this hotel I suppose fits the bill.The constant noise of on and off heater in the room was quite disturbing. Didn't want to turn up sound on TV but had no other choice than to keep it loud.The lack of space for 'stuff' was frustrating . The beds were ok. The shower was ok. The limited breakfast choices were fair at best. Overall it's a no frills but decent hotel. Would we go back for 1-5 days again? Well, price is a big factor. It was clean and employees were nice.

Well what can I say...,,, my colleague and I took 19 upper sixth students to New York on a 4 day visit, location great near a subway, rooms lovely and clean and secure. Breakfast buffet was superb plenty of choice hot and cold. The staff were so accommodating, the best up to now and I've been running this trip since 2007. They also included tourist advice in the lobby way and plenty of maps and to cap that provided free secure storage for our bags on the last day. On behalf of my school thank you so much for making our stay so memorable as they say in the states 'awesome'. We will be back!

The property is standard Comfort Inn fare, so if you stay at Comfort Inns you know what to expect. The property is an older building and as such has some ornate designs in the foyer as well as breakfast room that add charm to the property.The front desk staff is professional and cordial. They were most helpful during the stay.I was very disappointed in regards to housekeeping in 507. The maid did not clean the second day and blamed it on us, saying that we had the do-not-disturb sign out. Unfortunately that was a total lie because the sign was in our room the whole time and had fallen on the ground well away from the door. The housekeeper used this as the usual excuse to not clean a room. The front desk also blamed us, which tells you that the housekeeper gave the wrong info.On the third day the housekeeper did clean the room, but the service was very shoddy. There were articles left on the floor that were dropped from the garbage can, the toilet paper roll holder was left to the side and there was soap stuck to the tub, which mean she/he never cleaned. In addition, the housekeepers are extremely load and boisterous when they clean in the hallway, offering no respect to guests.On the third day the houseman had the audacity to throw his bag in front of the door stop of the elevator while he went to the front desk with his fire detectors. He left me waiting inside the elevator until he was done.The property is also a youth group magnet. It's not that bad, but good to know that you will have dozens of teenagers all around the small areas .As such, they tend to bang the doors all night, which you can hear with paper thin walls.The housekeepers and housemen need training. They are under par and severally unfriendly to guests.

Stayed overnight at this Comfort Inn and can report that the room is clean, the staff is friendly, the bed is comfortable and the bathroom is clean. Everything works as advertised. No frills, but not bad in any way. Breakfast is served though I skipped it. Looked good though. Great neighborhood. Temperature was a little hard to keep comfortable. With the heat on even low, it was too warm and off the room was cold and it was not that cold out.

If I could give half stars, I'd actually give this place 3.5 stars, but I couldn't quite give it 4. It's comfortable - it is the Comfort Inn, after all - but if I was travelling under my own steam, I think I'd head somewhere else. I was visiting for business for a week, and it's perfectly fine as a place to crash if you're note spending much time there. Room was rather cold on first entering, but once the heat is on, it's pretty toasty. Decent sized room, big comfortable bed, wifi - not much to complain about. Breakfast had plenty of options, but it was all served in styrofoam and plastic - not great. For me though, the best aspect was the location. This is in one of my favourite parts of New York - around the corner from Eataly and the original Shake Shack; away from the hustle and bustle of touristy Times Sq (yet not too far from it if you want to catch a Broadway show); and in the middle of one of the best foodie locations in town. Subway is just a couple of blocks away in each direction. Wouldn't be disappointed to stay here again on business or if I was on a budget.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn from Dec 20-29 2013 and had a lovely stay, The staff are very helpful and friendly, The breakfast is just what you want with out pigging out on to much food, It is clean tidy and comfortable, Nice easy access to all the main streets so we will be staying there again for sure.Chas &Heda
user_name:
chas j
Leighton Buzzard, United Kingdom

review_body: I enjoyed staying here. It certainly is not a fancy, high end hotel, but it is nice and clean. We were only in our room to shower and sleep, so we really didn't need a large and fancy room any way. We arrived at 10:30am and they offered to hold our bags until check in! That was great because we didn't want to be stuck lugging them around all day. The free breakfast was good. They offer cereal, bagels, danishes, eggs, sausage, waffles, coffee, and juices. We definitely took advantage of that. Again, it was nothing fancy, but it was a light, quick meal to start our day until we were ready for lunch. This hotel is located in a good area and close to the subway, which was a nice. The only minor complaint that I has was that the walls were paper thin. We stayed on room 1107 and I could hear what was going on next door. It didn't bother me much since I only heard the other room while we were getting ready for the day, etc. the bathroom was small too. My husband and I couldn't both be in there getting ready at the same time. But again, no big deal! They also had a full length mirror on the closet door which was great. A woman needs a full length mirror! We would definitely stay here again.

I booked this place for the weekend based on the reviews here. I was looking for something affordable in the city for three single ladies. I happened on this place which offers a room with 3 single beds - unheard of. It was the funniest room I had ever seen - reminded us of Goldilocks and the three bears! It is on the 11 th floor, good view of the church across the street and a peak of the Empire State Building. The room is very small - you have to step out of the way to let another person pass but has a small fridge,safe, desk and chair. The bathroom is tiny and reminded me of one you might have on a cruise ship. We got a Friday night price of $188.00. Just can't find that in NYC! Room was clean, service was adequate and the location can't be beat with access to subway only a couple of blocks. Felt safe and it was quiet for sleeping. Will stay here again next time.

We were very pleasantly surprised by our stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea this past weekend. It was clean, the staff friendly and the location perfect for our needs (several subway stops within a few minutes walk). Our room (604) was large for a hotel in this price range in Manhattan. The wifi internet signal in our room was strong and fast, something that has often been iffy in other Manhattan hotels. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well. I am particular about my beds and often cannot sleep well in hotels with bad beds.On the downside, the corridors are starting to show wear. However, the room interiors are quite nice and have been well maintained and CLEAN. The breakfast is a hot breakfast, with the usual continental offerings, in addition to the scrambled eggs (instant) and sausage. I'm not a waffle fan, but after trying "the make your own hot waffle," I had a waffle each morning in addition to the eggs. If you don't like instant scrambled eggs, they also offer hard boiled eggs (peeled).All in all, this is a very nice hotel and we will return to it the next time we go in NYC.

In September 2013 I stayed at the Chelsea Inn for 5 nights. The location is great, on Broadway, the subway is nearby, the room was big enough for me and my friend, the bed was comfortable, the cleaning staff was kind and they made the rooms tidy and clean. Our window was right across a wall, but how cares when you are in Manhattan. It was quiet at night and there was free wifi. There's also breakfast included, which was fine. Eggs, bread, bagels, pancake maker, juice, coffee etc. The hotel staff wasn't all the nice (except for the two concierges, they were present at breakfast as well, and the cleaning staff). There is one concierge who is REALLY nice, he really get's the whole concept of guests. I believe his name was Andy, but I should have written it down for this review... The front desk staff was not nice, almost rude. They hardly welcomed us when we arrived, he just asked for my last name and dropped down two room keys. Nothing more. I noticed more than once that they were rude and almost denigrating to the concierge, which he really did NOT deserve, because he was the nice guy over there.Anyhow, all together this is a fine hotel for a city trip. Clean, good location, nice beds, quiet, free wifi and breakfast. What more can you need?

The room is very small and the bathroom is smaller than small but when you're in NYC, you're not there to stay in a hotel room. The price is reasonable, breakfast is good and the rooms are clean. Location is great, walking distance to some great areas. I would stay here again.

If you want a question answered from the front desk, although you may be just another annoying customer they will bother answering it as well as going out of there way to give you directions. The hotel has charm in the details of the construction. The rooms are super small but clean and the bed is comfy. The breakfast goes till 10am and is average with a few little extras. The location is what really sells this hotel, close to everything and easy to get anywhere as its close to a subway station. The elevator is super slow but I think the biggest improvement they could make is friendly, they are just not. The gentleman that sets up the breakfast was great. Always checking to make sure everything was refilled and if you ask him for anything he was great at making that happen, I ask if they had bananas and he came back with a pile for everyone. I think the front desk could learn from him.

One night NYC. We had a 2pm show for Wicked. Ashwin at comfort inn was very nice . Let us check in early. Made extra effort so we could change before show. Room was clean. Bed was very comfortable . Front desk gave us a room with a nice view of Empire State Building . Breakfast was good. Good price.

Hotel staff was incompetent, aloof and demeaning. Breakfast was terrible (powdered eggs every day). The comfort inn franchise should be ashamed to be associated with this hotel. I have stayed at several comfort inn's across the nation and this by far is the worst one of them all. This hotel belongs on an episode of Hotel Impossible. In reality this is the type of hotel you get for $39.99 per night. The proximity to Manhattan is the only plus, but if you familiarize yourself with the subway system just look for a hotel that is close to subway station and you will be able to get around with ease. use google maps app for reliable subway transfers. Do not stay at this hotel, you will be disappointed. Trust me. Do yourself the favor and look elsewhere.

The location is outstanding: three metro station in 5' walking, Broadway and 5th Avenue in 2'. Rooms: we did not have problem with noises (our room was far from the elevators).Breakfast is under sufficiency, but the overall is very positive.

A few decades ago, NYC had a large number of small hotels like this one. They are pretty hard to find anymore, especially at a decent price, and this is one of them. Including tax, on an AARP rate, the tariff was $250, and that is cheap for Manhattan. As long as you're not expecting a flashy new hotel, or a room large enough to hold a party in, this one was very decent. The bed was good, the room was clean, the wifi was excellent, the free breakfast was at a Comfort Suites level, not a Comfort Inn level, and, since we were on an air shaft, the room was very quiet by Manhattan standards. The staff was very helpful, and even though my wife has mobility issues, we found it easy to get around (although I did have to give her an arm to get up the front steps). The location is outstanding.

I live in Las Vegas and visit New York every year. Been doing so for about 15 years. The last few years I have stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea on 25th street. It is right near the Flatiron Building and that wonderful area. I have been in the Hotel and Casino business here in Vegas for a long, long time. This hotel is so well run. The rooms are clean and everything works. The staff is professional and very helpful. In the mornings I always go down to the breakfast area and start the day with some coffee and some cereal. The breakfast is free and so well presented. If you go out the Hotel and turn right and go down the block, look left and you will see the Empire State building rising up into the sky. Look to the right and there is the Flatiron Building. Two of the most interesting building in all of New York. At 23rd street there is the subway and from there you can go anywhere. Out of the Hotel and turn left and down the block to 6th ave and at 23rd is another subway stop. This will take up and down the west side of Manhattan. I suggest you study the subway before you go and when you get here, you will be able to go anywhere in NY.The Hotel has WiFi, so I bring my laptop and check the weather every day. This hotel is so well located and so well run. I will stay here again, next year. I look forward it.

The hotel is in a great location. The price (AARP rate) $230 including tax was great. BUT, carpet is very worn, room is compact (acceptable but very noticeable). Looking out 3rd floor window which was covered in dirt-gave a grunge factor. Street noise was incessant all hours of the night. Turned on TV to muffle outside noise picture was marginal, channel selection dismal. I normally sleep well on the road, not here. Upside: location, proximity to Flatiron, Chelsea, great food (Eatery, Mario Batali’s place around the corner), lots of public transit options close by. Bottom line: pay an extra $50 or $80 and stay somewhere else nearby.

This hotel does not bother to state on their website that they are NOT handicap accessible. If I hadn't called to ask about something, I would have not known this until arriving n NYC, which by them would have been too late to cancel!

First, the good things about this hotel. It was very central, the front desk staff were helpful, efficient and friendly, the breakfast was good and the free wifi was powerful. The small bathroom was clean and had everything I needed.The less good things. The room had two double beds but if you used both beds there would have been serious problems about where to put suitcases and moving around the room would have been a challenge. The single chair in the room was an office chair but the room was so cramped that it was virtually impossible to place it next to the table that served as a desk.Value for money and downtown locations in major cities do not go together well in the same sentence. Generally, I find that Comfort Inns are good value for money but my experience has always been based on out-of-town and small town locations. This hotel was just plain expensive for its quality.Would I stay there again? Possibly (so long as someone else is paying). because when you search for value in NYC it appears to be absent.

Yes, this is an older hotel (over 100 years old) with beautiful ceilings and woodwork. The room was actually larger than I expected, the bathroom was small but had a full-size tub. The room and bathroom were clean and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast is the standard hot breakfast although the offerings were the same every morning, scrambled eggs and sausage links. Location is only 1 1/2 blocks from the Flatiron Building and the subway right off of 5th avenue. Just 10 or so blocks from Macy and the Empire State Building. I would definitely stay there again.

The only good things about the hotel is the location, and the included breakfast. And I have to be fair, the mattresses and bathroom were also clean. Other than that, the hotel is old. rooms are small. Hallways are narrow. Carpeting and walls need to be upgraded, they are old with bad color taste. But what really needs to be improved is the customer service. Most of the staff at the front desk lack the knowledge of how to treat a customer or respond to their requests. They are either rude or lazy. They will try to find any excuse to not fulfill your request even if you are not comfortable in your room and need to switch. Each will try to send you to the next shift employee. Or they will treat you as if you staying in the hotel for free and they are doing you a favor housing you. I guess it is a cultural thing, since the whole staff come from one ethnic background.

Thanks to Fashion Week in NY, the hotel prices were even more sky high than normal. I paid $339.00 for this little hotel right near the Flatiron Building and Madison Square Park. Now, $339, in most other cities in the US, will get you some level of luxury-but not here! This is a typical European Tourist Mill. Nothing wrong with that, but if you are on business and looking for even a level of a Holiday Inn Express, you won't get it here. I don't like going into a room that has an aroma, that of a gym locker room. The room was large enough, had a new TV. The bed- ok and I hope new and clean-that's a leap of faith! It was fairly quiet-I was on the top floor. Expect for the banging doors throughout the night. Why people can't just hold the door and close it quietly in hotels is beyond me. The Breakfast room and selection was not bad. The internet-did not use. Don't know if there is a gym or not. Don't expect a spacious, artsy lobby here-more like rooming house basic. The staff- indifferent. I have been in much nicer hotels in this area, so I can't really recommend this for business stay.

Stayed in this hotel as we are a family of 5 not wanting to book two rooms. This hotel was able to cater for us in one room. Room was clean, a little small but adequate for our needs. Situated right next to The Flat Iron Building & only minutes walking distance from The Empire State Building. We had 3 nights here. Breakfast was included in our rate which was all ok. Cereals, toast, pastries, a waffle machine etc. Complimentary tea/coffee in reception at all times was very handy. Concierge could do with doing their homework a little more on the hotel amenities & what is on offer in & around New York. All in all this hotel is fine as a pit stop & place to sleep. Dont book if you want more luxurious stay in Manhatten.

When planning a long weekend in NYC for 6 friends, this was the only hotel we could find that could accommodate our group for the price of a single room. It's actually a 2 room suite with a king bed in one room and 2 double beds in the other. We even had a view of the Empire State Building. Only 1 tiny bathroom but we managed OK. The elevator is small and slow but we were on the 3rd floor so we took the stairs if we didn't want to wait.The Chelsea location is within walking distance to several subway stations. At the end of the block is a 24 hour CVS and a Fairway Market if you want drinks and snacks for the mini fridge.There's also a free breakfast at the hotel. Nothing fancy but good enough you get you on your way.All in all we were very happy with our stay. Perfect place for a large group on a budget!

The Comfort Inn Chelsea is in a great location, around the corner from the subway. The staff are very helpful and the price is incredible given what hotels are charging in NYC these days. The rooms are extremely small - barely any floor space to walk from the bed to the bathroom. It is an old hotel with two very small elevators (holds no more than 3-4 people.) They have smoking rooms which adds a layer of dinginess. Although breakfast is included, your best bet is to walk to the corner to find a deli. In any other city, I would not consider staying in a hotel like this but in New York it is a rare find!

I stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea for 4 days from 22 July 2013 onward.The hotel is blessed with a central location. It is located at the beginning of the Chelsea section of the city. The hotel room contained a safe, a mini-fridge and A/C. It was clean, comfortable and ... compact. Thanks to my AAA membership, I got a great rate on the room. Overall, I was pleased with my stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea. It's in a good location and it's economical.

We chose this hotel because this is one of the few hotels in Manhattan that can accommodate a group of 6 at a reasonable rate, without having to pay for separate rooms. Our suite consisted of one room with two double beds, TV and closet and another room with a King bed, bathroom, safe, coffeemaker, TV, closet and mini-fridge. We were not expecting a five star hotel so we were not disappointed. There are some things that could be improved but for the rate, these are things that were not super important to us, especially because we did not spend too much time in the room: The A/C was loud, the rooms were small, the exhaust vent on the bathroom was full of lint/dust and the safe was not working when we arrived. However, we had a nice Empire State view from our window and the location is great, two short blocks to the subway, right next to the Flatiron building; and breakfast was included. The breakfast was slightly better than the typical free breakfast: Muffins, toast, bagels, bananas, oranges, apples, instant oatmeal, yogurt, cold cereal, hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs and sausages. We all found something to eat to keep us going until lunchtime. The gentleman tending the breakfast room was super efficient and attentive.

Location is convinience, but this is the most we can say about the hotel.As we loaded the laugage on a cart, we struggled with it to the elevator. It did not fit in. The concierge did not know which elevator can be used... More struggle was to get the cart through 3 doors in our floor to the room...The safe did not work, and manitenance worker worked on it for some hour before he gave up and told us it would be done the next day...Same happened with the phone set beside the main bed. Next day...Next morning we went out by 9AM and came back by 3PM very tired, exhaousted from the heat in Manhattan. As it turned out the room was not done yet... After asking, we were told it was done regulary by 5PM. So we had to wait in the room while the cleaner came to do her job...Rooms are tiny but this probably what is expected in Manhattan.AC is very noisy.Sounds confusing? That's exactly my feeling.

I went on a school trip and stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The staff are very friendly and are more than willing to help with anything. For example one of my friend was ill in the stairwell and they couldn't have been nicer and more helpful! They also cleaned it up straight away which was no issue to them. The elevator is extremely slow and on departure as we were a large group all needing it we were waiting over half an hour for it due to it being constantly full. The stairs are rediculously narrow and steep! Not recommended for anyone - especially not with luggage. Rooms are clean and supplied us with everything needed including a decent size safe - there was 6 of us all using it. The bathroom however was tiny and for 6 of us was rediculous!Beds are comfy and the heater was a life saver considering when we arrived it was -8 outside! Although the duvet/ comforter was too thin - more like a sheet so this could be improved or we just asked for 3 more. Again staff were fine with it. Location was great! As we were a large group of school leavers we were fairly lazy and didn't want to walk far haha but everywhere was close to us! Flat Iron building is about 5 minutes from hotel and about a 20/30 minute walk to Times Square (if I remember correctly - I was very tired haha). I wouldn't recomend food in the hotel as if breakfast was anything to go by it isn't great. Breakfast consisted of 2 cereals, doughnuts and/or waffles, scrambled egg and sausage. The food was nice just not a substantial breakfast to keep you going. However there is a chicken place directly opposite which was nice and a Chinese next door (closed when we went). Just a word of advise: don't order Dominos! Made us all ill and was horrible! Also the delivery man couldn't have been more rude!!Hope this helps and I hope you have an amazing time like I did!

This hotel is in an excellent location. And for the price is everything you need and nothing you don't. Breakfast is poor but was enough to get you through till snacking time! The rooms are out of date and our view of a brick wall wasn't pleasent. But to be fair your in New York! Your not there to live in the small bathrooms, or the outdated decor. It gets you through the week, the hotel is the least important thing on a trip to New York, enjoy its excellent location!! Would recommend for basic travellers, I was in a group of students so needs weren't high, we had a great time.

Went on a double-date to NYC and stayed here with two of our best friends last year. We had a room with two double beds, which left hardly any room to walk or put our suitcases in the room. The bathroom was tiny and you had very little room, but all in all we looked at how little time we actually spent at the room and realized it was a great value. If you're planning on spending most of your time outside the hotel room, this is a clean, affordable (by NYC standards) and perfectly located place to stay. If you're planning on spending a lot of time in the room, you'll go nuts in a room this small.

This was our first trip to New York and we were swayed back and forth on the type of hotel to choose. Some told us to stay at the less expensive but far nicer hotels in New Jersey and take the train in. Others told us we'd regret the remote location and suck it up and pay midtown Manhattan prices. After much to and fro, we chose the latter. After missing out on a really good deal at the Holiday Inn, we chose the Comfort Inn as our second choice based on decent reviews we read. We can say that everything said about this place is true:PROS: - super convenient location: close to two different subway lines, within walking distance to Times Square and Empire State Buildinbg - free wireless internet (though it was intermittent) - free hot breakfast: we didn't expect much and was pleasantly surprised by the choice of food items, plus hot items like scrambled eggs, sausages, and self-made waffles! We're not terribly picky (indeed, we actually enjoy IKEA breakfasts, which are on par with the hotel's)CONS: - tiny tiny rooms: our family of 4 crammed into a small room with two double (!) beds. One person can't even walk by another without having to jump on the bed first. - not much other amenities: don't expect a pool; the fitness room had a couple of treadmills and that's it - efficient but impersonal service. Perhaps I can't fault Comfort Inn for this specifically, as this seems to be the New York way. But we never got a sense that we were welcomed guests. The staffers just looked like they were doing their jobs--no more, no less. Our faulty room safe was attended to promptly, so I have to give kudos for that. - rather expensive given the age and rating of the hotel, but we're told all Manhattan hotels are not cheap - area is slightly on the sketchy side, but not enough to alarm us as we walked around at nightSUMMARYTo us, the pros outweigh the cons. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and go with 4 stars. With our late night returns, it was nice to be able to take the subway back directly, without having to fear missing the shuttlebus if we stayed in New Jersey.

If you don't care about the ritz look - and want a good fun and cool location - this might be it, not too expensive, and they have rooms for 5! Around the block from Mario bitallis eataly - a short walk to union square and the flat iron area. Close to the John dorey oyster bar and strand bookshop. If you need a functional only hotel and like the Chelsea scene, go for this place. I will be back for sure.

This is a good hotel, the staff was friendly, the price was fair in my opinion. Location is very good, since it is not so far from Times Square and not so far from many attractions in NY.The room was small for me, we were a group of 6 and there were only two rooms and a bathroom and the rooms were very small that i couldn't move a lot, so you must sit on bed to watch TV but other than that the hotel is good.

I spent two nights at the Chelsea Comfort Inn and was very pleased with the overall experience. While the property itself is a bit dated (like most mid-priced hotels in NYC), the location, price, and staff really made the stay better than expected. Sherry at the Front Desk very kindly helped resolve a credit card problem with my business office, and other staff were helpful when addressed. I loved the LOCATION - less than 15 min walk from Penn Station, and down to NYU through the lovely Washington Square Park. Not far from the Highline or the subway. Price was lower than all other decent options for the two days I was there, and I found their morning breakfast was comparable to other similar hotels, with a nice selection of items in every group. I would definitely stay here again for business or pleasure.

We got this room free for a night using rewards points. The staff was helpful and polite. The hotel is nice and clean. They held our bags for us all day for free until we checked in. Beds were comfortable and clean, bathroom was average size and also clean. The room has a mini fridge and a safe as well as free wifi. Overall its a nice, average hotel. The free breakfast is a major plus too!

The hotel is steps away from Broadway and the subway system at 28th & Broadway. Buy a $30 Metro Pass that will give you a week of unlimited trips on busses and subways. The rooms are clean and compact and include a small fridge, iron and ironing board. We were travelling by train and loved that Penn station was a short walk from the hotel. The hotel includes a free full breakfast to start your day. The Chelsea neighbourhood boasts great restaurants and at the end of the street from the hotel is Madison Square Park. If you want a quiet, economical NYC experience this hotel is your best choice rather than a $350+ per night in a large, noisy, busy up town hotel.

We read the reviews it's a 2.5 star hotel in a big city, but wow what a location! Close to the subway within walking distance of Penn station, breakfast is included but you just have to wait for a table if you go at family o'clock which we seemed too. Breakfast staff were great kept everything well stocked. Yes the elevator is slow but you're on holidays! Rooms are small but again, aren't you just there to sleep, it was clean. I was expecting it to be noisy as I'm a light sleeper but I was really surprised it was an oasis in a big city.

I've stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea several times before this review. It's always been a decent enough, no-frills, ok because I'm on Business sort of place. Ideally situated (for me) right between my NY office and my client.HOWEVER, this most recent stay has really got my blood boiling. Apparently, when you request a no-smoking room, it's never guaranteed. You get it if you're lucky. And my luck has finally run out. The only room available in all of Manhattan this week (that's not $600 a night) and it smells like a BAR. Furthermore, I went to open the windows to air the room out...and there are NO SCREENS. I sure do hope the pigeons who are sure to visit me at some point are as disgusted by the smell as I am. Will not be booking at this property again.

For New York the room size was to be expected. Small. But the bed was cozy and in an area that's not nearly as loud as when I've stayed in Time's Square. There is quick access to everything too. I would stay here again.

This hotel delivers what it promises. It is moderately priced (for New York), well situated and basic. The elevators are tortoise like, the rooms cramped, the breakfast of the cardboard plate variety, the running machines broken and the reception amateurish. However it doesn't promise more, is clean and friendly. So it warrants three stars and is pleasant to stay in. I shall return there and recommend it to anyone who isn't looking for luxury and isn't hyper critical.

I was pleased with the location, close to everything, but was disappointed there was no view. The fridge in the room was bearly cold, and the orange juice in the breakfast was warm! Yuck! But overall a nice one night stay.

This hotel has a great location!! We parked in the recommended parking garage for a discounted price! The hotel checked our bags before we checked in and after we checked out for just one dollar a bag!! The breakfast was great. Filled us until lunch. They had a small excercise room that had a water dispenser and fresh towels. The employees were very nice and helpful. The room was small..this is NYC after all, but they were clean and had plenty of towels. There was a refridgerator in the room and a safe, which both worked fine. We had a great meal at Eataly, around the corner and a wonderful lunch at The Melt Shop Grilled Cheese which is one street over. I would stay here again. Great price, location, clean rooms and friendly service.

I stayed at the Comfort Inn for 3 nights after a business trip to Philadelphia and after the previous 4 nights in the Hilton which cost less! I was a little dissapointed. Your first impression is of course the reception desk which lacked space for families and their baggage.ROOM was ok cheap chipboard furniture could barely stand straight and there were no accessible sockets apart from one in the bathroom for charging mobiles, laptops etc without moving the furniture to get to additional sockets. The bed was comfortable enough and i had a view of the empire state building which was good. There was free wi-fi which was fast and reliable. The hotel was serviced by two small lifts which i am sure the cleaning staff blocked off as more than once i waited ten minutes before taking the stairs.BREAKFAST - absolute junk, paper plates, plastic spoons, i went the first day then never went backLOCATION - superb, close to the metro, the area felt safe to walk about, no complaints there!

Just a 5 minute walk from Subway station.Rooms quite small but clean, bed comfortable.Breakfast was acceptable.Paying in S.A. Rands we found it very expensive for what you got, saying that we found New York to be very expensive, but well worth doing.

The hotel is very well located and I was using the hotel for a business trip so well located for the financial district. The rooms were naturally very small - as you'd expect in any large city. The decor did leave something to be desired and was reasonably clean. Some of the grouting and plumbing in the bathroom was very poor and I struggled to shave in hot water as the basin tap was no more than a very slow trickle.The staffs were friendly by NYC standards and always smiled politely as I passed through the lobby, the breakfast was passable and given the budget my company gives me to work on in NYC the hotel was one the better ones I have stayed at.On the plus side the WiFi was free and fast.
